description:
What can I say about this place ... 

Our flight from the east coast came in really late and I called the restaurant to see if they could push back our reservations, and without hesitation they did, and even said if we came in earlier they would try to sit us.

A local friend showed up a bit early and they told her as soon as something opened up they sit her at the table we had reserved. Luckily we were too far off, when we arrived I think we waited 5 minutes.

The place was jamming ... it was completely packed.

We started with a round of yummy margaritas .. and then food !!!!!!

They then gave us the house chips and the amazing salsa ... we loved it .. we ended up asking for 3 more orders of chips and salsa .. thats how good it was.

We ordered queso fundido - melted cheese with fresh mushroom ... really yummy
followed by papas bravas ... potatoes in a nice and mild sauce .. again yummy. We then ordered Guacamole which was really good. Shishito peppers ... that were nice and crunchy. 

Meanwhile the service was awesome ... everyone we encountered was great and friendly. Perfect service !!!!!

For our main plates we ordered the pork belly salad, 2 orders of fish tacos, and an order of carnitas ... the fish tacos were amazing .. the pork belly was just perfect and the carnitas was nice and toasty and crunchy. 

It was an overall great and awesome experience .. I truly enjoyed it and will not hesitate to come again. 

As for prices ... well its above average for Mexican food, but this isn't your cheap Mexican food it's very good on the border of high end/gourmet Mexican food, totally worth it.

Food was a perfect 10 out of 10 for us. The drinks was 10 out of 10 and service was 10 out of 10.
author: Jimi L.

description:
I love coming here! Their cocktails are so good and unique. I forgot which one my friend ordered but it came in an actual cowboy boot. We were caught off guard but it tasted really good, ha!

The food is always fantastic from the tacos to the.. tacos! That's honestly all I get, whether it be the tucan taco or the panko avocado taco, yum. The ceviche is also something you should try. 

The decorations are vibrant and unique, it's a super cute spot that every time we go there, my friends and I try to understand the meaning of the decorations, ha. 

It could get packed so there may be a wait. Plus it's small inside and you may be brushing elbows with someone next to you! I wouldn't go with a huge party, at most maybe 4-6?
author: Ashley B.

description:
We walked in around 6 PM on a saturday, everything was full but the hostess, who by the way was super cool and nice, told us we could sit in the kitchen counter in half and hour. We waited at a coffee shop nearby and came back in half and hour.

Place is AMAZING. Decoration is quirky and cozy. Food was fast and the place was packed. We shared dishes so we ate around 5 different dishes which were all delicious!! I'm mexican and this was accurate and so yummy. Pork belly taco was my fav! 

Try reserving before hand though! We got lucky and were a small party.

Pricing is worth it, the tacos are well filled and some of the dishes tortillas were so obviously hand made and awesome.

Great food, cool place, nice staff!
author: Andrea S.

description:
My sister invited me here for brunch and it was tapas style. It's pretty cool space, I'd label as hipster deco, delicious food, and delicious cocktails.

I had the arugula salad which was delicious, a bit on the small side but again because it's meant to be tapas. Then also had some of the tacos, tacos tropical is soooo good, their tortilla is made not of flour or corn but it's so light yet crispy and a bit moist. It's delicious. Please order that if you don't get anything else.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Definitely a 4.5 place.

Nice ambience to hang out and chill. For a Mexican place, it's so surprising that their French Toast is amazing. 

Try Ceviche and hairloom tomato toast too. Loved the place.
author: Abhinandan R.

description:
This review is for brunch which was alright. Don't get me wrong, the food was good but portions size was incredibley small for the price of it. 

The GF huevos rancheros was yummy but 2 sunny side up eggs on a corn tortilla was not worth $12! That's like $2 to make at home. Ceviche was about palm sized, not an entree dish, and it was okay. Guacamole was good, and I think we got two bowls of chips with it. All-in all, I wouldn't come again for brunch when I can make the same items for a fraction of the cost.
author: Lisa L.

description: This definitely has a kitschy and cute vibe going on with all its colorful walls and weird decor (e.g. the chairs we were sitting on were lined with large, male suit jackets). I got the sensitive times, which were this nice floral pink and tasted really good. I think the food is supposed to be more tapas style as some of the dishes like the tacos are small. I got the pork belly which came with lots of fatty pieces of meat with pieces of cilantro and radish strips. They also have free chips and salsa too which I really liked. The chips were the thinner ones that had lots of flavor and the salsa was amazing.
author: Jen L.

description:
The ceviche is just DELICIOUS !!! 
It's also a really cool place, the location is super fun and cozy, I love it there!
author: Mirjam G.

description:
Cozy Mexican restaurant serving hearty brunch up until 3.30 pm. Located conveniently on Valencia, it's yours to claim on a lazy Saturday when you don't want to have to dress up to unwind and eat some good food. 

I was disappointed they didn't have horchatas and cilantro rice, but they had really good avocado tacos and brunch toasts! 

We had fun and I wouldn't mind going back some time.
author: Vidya R.

description:
Hmm I think the waitress likes my business partner or something because the service was exceptional and food came super fast LOL Maybe I'm just cute ;) Either way, we received GREAT service on a late night. 15 minutes before they close to be exact. Were seated immediately, waters came quick, good food to follow. Very reasonably priced!

Guacamole - i like it a lot, not spicy, no tomatoes and shit, just a good guac. I prefer a little more lime or maybe a lil more onion for flavor but still good. 

shishito pepper was a no go for me. the peppers were spicy!!! I usually dont mind the spice, I actually love the heat, but I am not cool with heat that lacks flavor. This is a MISS!

Tropical Taco 10 stars! must get! kill yourself if you dont get this, even if you are allergic to shrimp. this is so good that it's worth risking your life. I am so serious. So it's a bit on the sweet side, the mango salsa contributed to that. The shrimp were perfectly fried. crunchy but not hard to bite. you know how some shrimp taco has really good fried shrimp that will hurt your gum if you take a too big of a bite? these are just right! I'm telling you, this is THE SHRIMP TACO YOU WILL EVER NEED IN YOUR LIFE! and you can THANK ME LATER *Drake's Voice*

Tuna Tacon was also yummy, I like the soysauce/Tuna twist, but the tropical was just that much better for me. You should still get this if you like tuna, not canned Tuna, real real tuna. it's still rare on the inside. this is the true marriage of sushi and taco.

My second favorite has to be the mushroom EMPANADAS!!! so cheesy, yet light and flavorful. It's hot when you break it open, you can taste the mushroom in every bite. this is a must get! It also has corn inside. the flavor was really exceptional.

the three cheese tlacoyo was too healthy for me. Too many veggie on top scared me! lol what are all these? The green beans on top were ok. I picked off a few things, not for my taste buds.

drinks were good too ;) I will definitely bring more dates here LOL
author: Kris J.

description:
I really wanted to love this place but it was disappointing in many ways from the service to food quality especially with their price.

I fell for the cover photo of this place on yelp with the fancy bubbly stuff with pomegranate. What they actually present is nothing similar to that photo. 

We had carnitas, ceviche, and beef taco. 
DO NOT get the carnitas! They serve one small chunk of good part of meat, and the rest is over-fried hard scraps. Even the edible part was completely lacking in flavor.
But I just couldn't believe they charge $20 for this crap!!
I am really calling this "crap" because that's how low of quality the meat was and I couldn't believe they served this.

Btw ceviche was good but you will find this dish with more diced radish than actual fish. I was like, did I order ceviche or a radish salad???

The waiter kept forgetting to bring us chips even after he said he was going to. 

Over all, no good value for the price you pay. Most likely will never return.
author: Cartman P.

description:
I came here to take a dear friend out for her birthday dinner. I had never heard of Lolo but she said that every time she searched for a good restaurant, Lolo came up in the search.

I got the earliest reservation at 5:30 through yelp and we got seated right away. It's tapas so the dishes are small but that meant we were able to sample a lot of dishes without getting too full.

We ordered: 

PASTEL DE ELOTE/CORNBREAD roasted poblano pepper & cream sauce, pomegranate seeds: This was really tasty - the poblano pepper & cream sauce gave the sometimes dry cornbread some kick.

EMPANADAS portobello mushroom, poblano pepper, oaxaca cheese, corn: They were piping hot and delicious! You could really taste the mushroom and poblano pepper.

CALAMARI AND OCTOPUS GORDITAS blue corn masa with squid ink, avocado, habanero crema: A little messy but really good. I think this was my favorite dish. The calamari had texture and the habernero crema added some spice. 

For dessert we ordered the flan....who can resist flan? Creamy and not too sweet. It was the perfect ending to our meal.
author: Nette T.

description:
I got the Tuna Tacon, Taco Tropical, Grilled Beef Tacos, and Sangria. All of them were delicious (fancier tacos that can get messy to eat), and though three tacos didn't fill me up, I was on the worst date ever so I inhaled my tacos, chugged my sangria, forced a smile, and bounced as soon as possible. I legit tried to make eye contact with people in the restaurant to send them the "save me" signal. I'll be back to try more things and leave feeling full and happy!

Make reservations! This place gets poppin. We got lucky and got seating at the first come first served bar after waiting a couple minutes. While you're waiting there are some cool spots you can check out in the neighborhood!
author: Annie S.

description:
Our entree (crab & squid ink tacos) came first, our appetizer (ceviche) after we finished our entree, and then as we were finishing our appetizer, our drinks came.

A meal in reverse. 

It's not the order you'd expect things to come in but everything was so good that you didn't really notice until the next thing came. Service was friendly and the space was colorful. I was coming off almost a month of not-drinking and got the drink with yellow bell pepper and it was deeelish and really sauced me up PDQ. 

The tacos we got were the daily special. $16 for 2 tacos but there was a lot of crab and the squid ink taco shell was a cool touch. We were trying to do a tapas tour around the city and didn't want to get too full so splitting the 2 tacos + ceviche (which was a really large portion) was perfect for first food stop. 

I'd totally come back again because there were like 4 other tacos plates that sounded soooo good and were pescatarian friendly. It's cool as a fun date spot or meeting gal friends. I'm not sure if they take reservations but we got there a few minutes after they opened and the place was already more than half full with a long wait by the time we left.
author: Candice G.

description:
Great ambiance and selection of food!

I know is weird for a mexican restaurant, but believe me: if you order only one thing make it the Key Lime Mousse! OMG it was soooo good! It was extra citrusy and so so so delicious!

Below the review of the plates we had:

- Guac and Chips were delicious and super creamy
- Then we had the ceviche which was good but not remarkable. 
- The pork belly was extra crispy and delicious. 
- Tuna tacos were kinda simple, but good

Fun fact: the check is brought on a mini boot which was cute!
author: Eugenia C.

description:
Favorite things about Loló: the interior decoration, great ambience, and amazing tapas. 

Decor is eccentric and lively and honestly just made me really happy. Service was lovely as well!

We ordered the Three Cheese Tlacoyo and the Seared Pork Belly Salad. Both were fantastic, but the pork belly really took the cake. It was moist and smoky, and the mint was surprisingly a really great complement. We left feeling satisfied and not too stuffed, which is always good when surrounded by great dessert options in the Mission District. Will be back for the ceviche!
author: Sophia W.

description:
I came here to celebrate Mother's day with my family and it was sooo good!!! We ate sooo much, but here are some of my favorites/ must try:
- TUNA TACON
- QUESO FUNDIDO
- 'A LA DIABLA' SHRIMP
- TUNA TACON

Some other yummy things were:
- CHICKEN TINGA TOSTADAS
- TEQUILA !!!!
author: Kassie E.

description:
Loló is hands down my go-to place for eats and drinks in the city. If I'm looking for something brunch-y, their huevos rancheros and breakfast burrito are to die for! And their take on the traditional mimosa... amazing. 

However, the real star of the show is their dinner menu. My boyfriend and I come in frequently to eat their empanadas. We also love their tacos tropical and carne tacos (which I also believe are on their brunch/lunch menu). Not to mention, their guacamole and salsa are so fresh - the perfect appetizers. SO GOOD. 

The service turnaround is very quick, so it's an awesome spot if you're looking for something to get in and out (but they don't mind if you choose to hangout longer and sample the menu as we've so often done). It's a trendy vibe with intimate table arrangements and the decor is so festive and fun. 10/10 would recommend!
author: Alex Y.

description:
The food here: inventive new takes on traditional Mexican fare. 

The guacamole (yes, I went there) is absolutely delicious - fresh and flavorful.  Taco Tropical? One of the best seafood tacos that I've ever had - served on a jicama raw taco shell that was unexpected. Quesadillas? Phenomenal. 

I can't say anything about table service (we sat at the bar) but cocktails came quickly and they didn't bat an eye when we ended up doing a bottle of champagne instead of margaritas.

It's a quirky little mission restaurant that's definitely worth the wait.
author: Suzannah S.

description:
The best Angus Tacos... Simple but very flavorful. The buñuelos were so delicious and worth eating then.  The ambience was great, the decor was different and unique.  
Loved the dessert menu... 
Parking sucks but hey... It's the city! I will definitely be coming back for more.
author: Ivonne G.

description:
It has been probably a year or more and I am still thinking about this one specific order my group of 4 made. We ordered the taco tropical which is shrimp topped with sauce and garnishes, but what makes these tacos so special is the thinly sliced radish used instead of the traditional corn tortilla. 

LET ME TELL YOU. LIFE CHANGING. IT HAS BEEN SO LONG AND I STILL THINK OF THESE TACOS. I live in NYC and I cannot find one place that could even compare to how good these fish tacos are!! I hope I don't over hype it for you guys, but it was truly an amazing tastebud experience. 

The next time I come back to SF, I will buy 2 orders just for myself and one for to-go if they even let me. Honestly, this is a MUST GO in SF. I would travel out of my way for these fish tacos. 

My party ordered a bunch of other stuff, but I don't even remember because this just out shined them all by a ton. The interior is very cute, perfect to enjoy a dinner with friends.
author: Shirley G.

description:
BEST MEXICAN FOOD EVER!
If you know me you'd never catch me saying this. But it actually is guys. Everything about Lolo is superb, from the colorful hippie decor, to the handsome Spanish-Zac-Efron waitor, and of course to the food. 

My friends and I walked in on Sunday brunch and waited for around 15 mins while wandering around the shops nearby. The dishes are kind of small plates but you can ask for a certain quantity you want for the tacos. We got the Beef Tacos and Tuna Tacos. While usually, I'm a meat person, the Tuna Tacos definitely wins this round. The fish fillet is seared to the perfect level without being dried, then paired with avocado, cilantro, and a magical sauce. Best tacos ever!! The Ceviche was so fresh with lots of shrimp and fish. The Avocado Toast is bomb!! Even tho the toast was kinda hard, like hard-to-chew hard, the guac was soo good with chunks of avocado, sundried tomatoes, smoked salmon, and arugula. Just do yourself a favor and order this plz. 

Price is great for the quality honestly. Can't wait to be back soon.
author: Hannah V.

description: Been here for dinner and the vibe is fun. We enjoyed our drinks and the food wasn't bad but it also wasn't spectacular. Open to coming back and trying brunch.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Overhyped, overhyped, and it got me overhyped as well. Every single order is on sour side, not good, not bad! Every item I ordered to be expected to bomb my mind off but well... At least with that many items, bill totals to be $133 including a Domaine bottle! 
Food: Tuna Tacon(7/10)
Taco Tropical (8/10)
Pork Belly (5/10)
Ceviche (3/10) - my most expected wish :/
Calamari (6/10) very very fresh squid ink 
Sliders (5/10)
author: Jenny N.

description:
Finally got to try this place and happy that I did. My cousin and I made reservations ahead of time to avoid the crowd on a Saturday night- best decision ever. When first going in, the smell of the food had us drooling from the door. It's a small place with some bar seating, kitchen bar seats, and a few tables. It got busy fast.

The best thing about tapas is that you can try little bits of everything. My cousin and I ordered:

Taco Tropical- The flavors reminded me of eating a miso based salad dressing. Pretty tasty and interesting.
Tuna Tacon- Yum! Can't go wrong with seared tuna.
Chicken Tinga Tostados- Confit chicken had a good kick to it. My cousin really enjoyed this one.
A la Diabla shrimp- The taste of this reminded me of this one Korean soybean soup. This dish came out last, which I felt was the perfect ending to our meal. It was so good that we killed it even though we were super stuffed.

FYI, ordering four tapas was more than enough for the both of us. We even came starving, since we both skipped on lunch that day. But order at your heart's content! :)
author: Ester S.

description:
4.5 stars!
The vibe in Lolo is amazing--you're surrounded by the quirkiest, most unexpected decor that's eclectic and impossible to describe. But for me, the food here is the real star! Coming in for brunch, I was impressed by the quality and finesse of all the dishes we had, and I would definitely come back for more! 

The tortilla chips we started with were warm, thick, and fresh, and they came with some of the tastiest salsa I've had in a long time. The tuna tacon tacos came with a piece of seared albacore tuna, along with a slice of avocado, aioli, and tomatillo sauce on flour tortillas. The flavors were just bursting, and the wonderful juiciness of the fish really stood out. The taco tropical came with panko-dusted shrimps with relish and spicy aioli, served on a "jicama" tortilla. I've never seen anything like it before--the tortilla was literally a thin slice of jicama that somehow still held together, and the tacos were presented on a Japanese sushi board, highlighting its fusion aspects!

I only wish we had ordered a few more things, because all the food that was being brought out from the kitchen looked simply amazing! The prices here may seem high for the portion sizes, but they are really quite fair for the quality and flavors you get!
author: David K.

description:
Small lovely place. We came here after a last minute search on a Sunday afternoon at 3 or so. The place was packed and we got to sit near the kitchen counter. 

We ordered the mollete ranchero, avacado tacos and a toast with beets and other vegetables. A fish taco was also ordered . All dishes were great though I really really wish the potion size was slightly bigger. The Guacamole was about okay - not great. 

Overall, great food , small potions. Will recommend.
author: aditi g.

description:
Interesting vibe inside and great selection of tapas!  A bit loud for my taste but food was tasty enough.  Came here on a Wednesday night with an 8pm reservation.  

Venue / Service: it tends to feel a bit crowded, especially when the bar is open at night, making it difficult to hear conversations.  In fact, we were sitting next to people who were shouting so loudly I had a hard time hearing what my date was saying.  Otherwise, the interior has a somewhat hipster feel to it, with lot of knick-knacks on the walls and blazers sewn into the seats on the wall.  Service-wise, the waiters came promptly to bring out food though it was sometimes difficult to wave them down if you needed something else, like your check.  

Food: what stuck out was the decent selection of tapas... probably the most versions of tacos I've seen in a while that we had a hard time choosing which ones to get!
-- CEVICHE (shrimp and rock fish citrus roasted pepper sauce, avocado, corn nuts)($14) - slightly sour for my taste, but at least it covered up any fish taste/ smell that might turn people off from ceviche in general.  The fish was cooked a good amount that you knew it wasn't just sitting around in a vat of liquid, and had a decent refreshing quality to it.

-- EMPANADAS (portobello mushroom, poblano pepper, oaxaca cheese, corn)($9) - one of our favorites of the night, perhaps because we haven't had a "veggie" empanada before.  Liked how there wasn't too much cheese and that the inside didn't feel too dry either.  The poblano pepper added a good amount of kick, which the mushroom and cheese mellowed out.

-- TUNA TACON (seared albacore tuna shellfish aioli, avocado, roasted tomatillo sauce on the side)($12) - this was our favorite taco of the two we ordered.  The tuna was cooked well and the tomatillo sauce added a great acidity to the taco.  The avocado was good in mellowing out that kick.  

-- FISH TACOS (catch of the day, hand made corn tortillas, habanero, crema, peanuts and piquin pepper sauce)($11) - fish was fried well so that it was not overcooked inside but still crispy on the inside.  A bit spicy for my taste with the habanero, so thank god for the crema to balance it out.

-- BIRRIA SLIDERS (braised grass fed beef flap steak in roasted dry pepper broth, garlic mayo, brioche bun with shoestring potatoes)($12) - another favorite of ours that night!  The birria had a slight kick to it, but was quite tender and delicious!  The only thing was that the bun was rather large so I ended up taking the top bun off and eating it open-face style.

-- DULCE DE LIMON (key lime pudding w/ Mexican vanilla cookie layers)($8)- unfortunately a miss for us.  The pudding was a tad on the sweeter side than I would have liked and the cookie layers were a bit much / confusing.  Would have been better if they included 1-2 layers as opposed to the 4 we got- the overall mouthfeel was like sand once you hit that cookie layer.

A bit hectic for my taste, but I enjoyed the food enough and I'd be willing to go back!
author: Audrey H.

description:
Amazing drinks, amazing food, great decor and awesome service. Definitely a must go to place in the mission. Restaurant gets full fast, so consider making a reservation to save yourself some wait time. I got lucky and showed up right at opening and self sat at the bar. Definitely order a craft cocktail. They're amazing albeit a bit pricey but definitely worth it. 

I ordered the sangria, ceviche and tacos tropicale. Highlight of the night was definitely the ceviche. Ceviche was some of the best ceviche I think I've ever had! It comes served with fried crispy crackers that kinda remind me of fried wonton skins. A perfect pairing to the ceviche! Ceviche itself was nicely tart with huge chunks of seafood, also served with corn and avocados in the mix.

Sangria was pretty amazing too and very strong. Be wary!  Super tasty but the alcohol can sure sneak up on ya. If you're eating alone, eat at the bar. It's quite a show watching the bartenders in action. And they're really quite nice too! 

Definitely coming back here but with a bigger crowd so I can order the entire menu next time around!
author: Michelle C.

description: Food taste was very good and also reasonably prices. Service was good. Highly recommend the avacado taco, fish taco and shrimp and rice dish.
author: Sivalingam S.

description:
One can make reservations for here through Yelp !
Their interiors are pretty cool. Lots of tiny dogs and bicycles. The ambience was quite nice with upbeat music. The cocktail menu presented drinks with interesting ingredients. The salsa that came with chips was simply amazing. It was spicy enough to keep me interested.The drinks were good. Then it was time for the tapas! The brussel sprouts had good amount of oil with the nice fried flavor with enough tanginess. The shishito peppers were the only thing I did not enjoy much as it had more citrus flavor than salt on it.The tacos and quesadilla were really good too. My favorite was the one with fried avocado. It was warm and creamy. They have limited dessert options. We picked the one with lots of sugar and cinnamon and that was a sweet end indeed.
author: Tejashree M.

description: Always a good spot!  Great menu, some traditional some innovative.  Good service.  Highly recommend
author: Glenn S.

description: Food is pretty solid, portion sizes are on the smaller side for the price. I ordered the Panko Avocado Tacos, which were nice but not very filling. Would be nice to have more substantial vegetarian options. I expected the tacos to have a bit more flavor and texture, but I was comparing them to the fried avocado tacos in Torchy's (best tacos I've ever had) ... all the way in Texas :(.
author: Varsha V.

description: Great ambiance great service great food. Loved the shrimp taco and the radish as the taco is out of this world divine! Definitely recommend those and will definitely be back for them again!
author: Brittany C.

description:
Really fun environment, addicting margaritas, and fantastic tacos! Note that you should make a reservation unless you don't mind waiting for a long time for a table. It's a rather small restaurant, but it's so crowded and lively! 

The tacos my date and I tried were the tuna tacón, fried avocado, and fish. Although they were all delicious, there was a bit too much sauce for my taste (particularly for the fried avocado). The tuna was cooked a bit too thoroughly as well, but it was still really good. We also tried the ceviche (loved it), and the guacamole. 

The margaritas are absolutely delicious-- I had 3 or 4 rounds! I totally recommend coming here in general if you like margaritas and tacos :)
author: Christina W.

description:
I would recommend making a reservation if possible, they do have first priority.  We happened to score two seats at the bar when we walked in but noticed within a few minutes several people were waiting for tables.

We started with drinks (negra modelo, love when they have more than buds on draft, and a sangria which my wife said was good but tasted florally). The bartenders were attentive and very busy.  They seemed to be making craft cocktails nonstop (a lot of which looked interesting yet pretentious).

For two of us we shared 3 plates:
The ceviche- this was just ok in flavor. I really like the tostadas with them and the portion was quite large compared to most orders however there was a lack of seafood in the dish. I would not choose to order this again especially since they gave us chips and salsa to start which I was unaware of when I ordered.  

Fish tacos- these were great. They had a really large and tender piece of fried fish on a homemade corn tortilla topped with a slaw and a delicious sauce.  I really enjoyed these but they were a little too spicy for my wife.

Cornbread- this was delicious. This actually came late after we had finished all the rest of our food and drinks and were getting really full. I thought they had forgot about it which would have been fine because we were stuffed. However, they did end up bringing it out and I am glad they did. This was the most moist piece of cornbread I have ever had.  Even after being stuffed I still enjoyed it. My wife preferred to scrape off all the toppings and just enjoy the bread itself. Either way, I would recommend this.
author: Danielle B.

description: Came here for my friends birthday and enjoyed the experience. We got the cornbread (amazing!! Really recommend it), the pork belly salad, and some tacos. I personally didn't enjoy the pork belly salad as I didn't like the taste but I did enjoy the tacos a lot. For dessert we ordered a strawberry deep fried concoction which I didn't like. I'd come back just to get the cornbread again as it was very very good.
author: Mira B.

description: Went here for a friend's bday. It was so delicious and the cava was sweet and bubbly! Kale salad and ceviche! Yum! Make sure you get a reservation!
author: Phee F.

description:
Really tasty. Flavors matched well together. Shrimp taco was my fav,  then the bean toast.
Positive vibes; staff was attentive and friendly and it was easy to park.
Only negative was the portions are ridiculously small, even for Tapas. Brunch Sunday, no alcoholic drinks, 4 of us left hungry $125
author: Kelley K.

description:
This place was delicious!

Came here last night and got the tuna tacon (a must!), shishito peppers (they are pretty generous with the portion), pork belly and papas bravas (sauce was delicioooouuss - the complimentary chips went so well with this sauce!).

I'd love to come back and try more things on the menu, though I'd also get the tuna tacon and papas bravas again for sure.

My only ding for this restaurant is that it's really loud, but not a deal breaker since it adds to the cool vibe too :) Very well decorated inside too.
author: Cal C.

description:
The atmosphere is energetic, bright and friendly. The staff was accommodating for a walk in and seated us
Only after a short wait. Where it fell short was the food and cocktails. The cocktails we orders were sooo awful we couldn't even drink them. The flavor profiles were clashing and what was left was a toxic taste that could not be consumed. I don't like to return items so we just didn't drink them. The food overall lacked flavor. The beef lacked seasoning and left something to be desired. The presentation was appealing. I would not return.
author: Gabriella H.

description: Came here for dinner on a Saturday around 5pm without a reservation and there was no wait at all! The food was really good, especially the tacos. Also I would recommend the brussel sprouts. They're a bit different that usual restaurant but ones since they are flavored with hazelnuts! Yum!
author: Amanda F.

description: One of my favorite spot in NV to hang out with friends and relax during my vacation
author: Jason D.

description: we drunkenly tried this place, and it was just ok. the dishes weren't particularly pretty, and the taste was just ok.  I don't know about anyone else, but when my belly is full of wine, I'll eat a piece of charcoal and rave about it the next day.  For this reason, I can't imagine the food being that good.
author: Lisa L.

description: I absolutely love Loló !! It's has such an amazing energy. My husband and I go once a week, and they always treat us with kindness. My favorite is the pan de elote, and all the vegetarian options. The drinks are also very delicious and the bar tenders are always in a great mood. Highly recommend !
author: Monica G.

description: Nice busy restaurant. Making a reservation will be recommended or it would be about 1+hr wait. Nice service and cool concept. We didn't order entrees but the appetizers and drinks were not really as good as I hoped it would be. Ceviche wasn't too bad.
author: Cindy C.

description:
The tapas are creative while still being authentic. The place is nicely designed and, always important, the tortillas are homemade. We sat at the counter and could see the masa being pulled from a bin, rolled into a ball and laid on a tortilla press before being cooked.

I took my Mexican mother here and she was impressed with the food. We shared three plates and while on the pricier side, I felt it was justified by the quality, ambiance and location.
author: bryan f.

description:
Why isn't this located closer to me???! The drinks? So good!! 

I had the side car with mezcal which was really good, but what makes me want to come back? The sangria! It had cardamom and was vodka based... I'm seriously in love. I wish I could have a glass everyday... in moderation obviously ( stop judging me!).

We also had some great food too. Also, extremely gluten free friendly! All their gf items are noted. We weren't a fan of the squid and octopus sopa.. some textures that weren't so enjoyable to us. The brussel sprouts and guacamole were good, though weren't amazing.

Our favorite? The chicken tostada... I should have ordered 3 of those!

Can't wait to come back next time I'm in the mission:).
author: Gita r.

description:
Came here for a company holiday party and had a great time. We had our own private space downstairs.

The watermelon mezcal cocktail was out of this world! 

The service was outstanding-- water glasses and drinks never empty.

We had chips with two types of salsa and guacamole along with shishito peppers, all of which were very good. The kale salad was very fresh! Lastly, the pork and churizzo dishes were very flavorful with a lot of meat.

I'd definitely recommend this place for a party!
author: Jonathan N.

description:
3.5 Stars

Pretty good! Came here after getting out of Urban Putt a bit late. Lolo was open late and still serving a full menu. We left around 12:45am and I can't remember the last time I was in a SF restaurant that late--one of the few late night food options. 

The decor is eclectic to say the very least and the service was awesome. We were pretty hungry and ordered a few bites to share. The portions are pretty small even for a tapas place and the price was reasonable given the area but a lot more than taqueria prices. 

Lolo serves "fancy" or "high brow" Mexican food (Oaxacan). Ingredients are fresh and seasonal and the flavors were good--admittedly not great though. The empanadas were just okay and the other app we ordered (forgetting the name but three cheeses and sort of like a papusa) was slightly better.

The quesadillas were a major miss--tortillas with cheese and mushrooms on top. Not folded and not resembling anything I associate with a quesadilla. The chicken tinga tostadas were tasty and the best bite of the night. My friend got the ceviche and enjoyed it.

Overall the food was slightly above average and a little pricey, but will be back if in the area late and wanting a nicer sit down place .
author: Semuteh F.

description: Figure out what's good on your own and give them ur $. It's great to go to a restaurant in SF that doesn't have the same menu everyone else has.
author: Peter M.

description:
This place was amaZing! Their handmade tortillas and delicious salsas put the Zing in amaZing! We walked in with very high expectations and they did deliver! My daughters loved the food and they devoured the chips and salsa! My husband enjoyed his dish and so did I. We ordered the corn and squash taco, the mushroom and cheese appetizer, a side of rice for my little lady, the steak with veggie and the steak tacos. All of the dishes were a winner! They all had flavor and you can taste the love with every bite! The only thing, we walked in on a rainy afternoon and right after us, the place got packed and we never saw the light of any server again. Lol. I understand they got slammed unexpectedly because they were not expecting this many people of a weeknight with plenty of rain. 
We will be back! The price was well worth it all! We left stuffed and grateful for that amazing experience
author: Wajma Z.

description:
Made reservation to come here for brunch the night before - so reservations aren't too hard to get.  

First thing I noticed was how cool the decor is in this place!  There's a lot of unique/eccentric art and decor all over -- there's quite a lot to look at -- but it totally works.  I loved how colorful and vibrant it was inside.  Very Latino (coming from a Latina).  

Be aware, some of the tables are TIGHT - as in very close together.  We turned down the first table option because it was going to be like literally being on a double date.

I opted for a mimosa and a coffee.  Mimosa was a mimosa, coffee was not too great to be honest (not bad, just not impressive).  I also ordered the ceviche and my date ordered the croissant french toast.  Both dishes were really good and we were both pleased.  

Service wise, it was meh.  I really wanted another mimosa but our server never came back for like 45 minutes aka when we had already finished our food...so at that point it was too late.  

I loved the vibe in here, loved the decor.  Food was good.  I would return to try again before I said I was sold.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Seriously, who doesn't like tapas? If you don't, then you can't sit with us at Loló. 

I like Loló a lot. Colorful, tropical, and kinda quirky ambiance makes for a cute date night or girl's night spot. 

A few of my favorites:

- Ceviche ($14) is delicious, and the portion is huuuuge! Biggest ceviche portion I've ever been served in SF. 
- Tacos! Tuna Tacon and Taco Tropical (served with jicama instead of tortilla)
- Empanadas are pretty good 
- Grilled Octopus ($28) - my absolute favorite thing on the menu, perfect tenderness. Worth the splurge 100%. 

Food's good, but the service is pretty subpar here. We never received our chips and salsa. Our server played it off by saying it's usually brought out when you order guacamole. Girrrrrlllll, I've been here before, no need to lie. Plus every other table has it besides ours. 

So basically:
- make a reservation
- bring a good amount of mouths so you can share a lot of food 
- don't be afraid to ask for your chips
author: Laverne N.

description:
SF is filled with hyped up eats, and I think this place def. was a little more hype than what it was worth. The restaurant itself was narrow but roomy and jam packed with people inside and waiting outside, which raised our expectations even more. Decor was adorable, cute random knick knacks and bright colors created a fun and quirky fiesta vibe Food was a modern fusion of American and Mexican food. Maybe my friend and I ordered the wrongs things...BUT we just didn't get an awww amazing foodgasm moment by any specific dish. It was good by all means, but it just wasn't amazing.

Let's dig in:

(1) House chips and salsa - fresh house chips came our warm and crispy just the way i like it! lightly and perfectly salted and the sauce were mild spicy overall and tasty.

(2) Brussel sprouts - my fave dish here! Super fried and crispy with a nice glaze overall, the taste was light and although there was prob. a great amount of butter - the light vinaigrette sauce cut the taste in a nice way.

(3) Shrimp tacos - large panko fried shrimp were unique and tasty, but what made this dish even more unique was the JICAMA taco shell. The jicama was def. refreshing and added a unique texture to it overall - would def. order this again!

(4) Fish tacos - disappointing overall, the fresh house tortillas were good and the fish was fried to perfection and well seasoned - BUT was unfortunately was drowned in the dressing like house sauce, WHICH although was good was just too much overall. 

(5) Empanadas - stuffed with mushroom, pepper, cheese, and corn = a delish and perfect OOEY GOOEY interior. Although the exterior was a little too fried and dry for me, but it was still still good.

(6) Tortilla soup - weirrrrrdddddd...in a no bueno way. This was not a SOUP at all my friend. it was a freakn dipping sauce! This soup was so THICK we pretty much just dipped our chips in it throughout the night, since it was the only way we could actually eat it... Just too thick and slightly cold, AND the flavor itself was just smoky and not tasty in any particular way.

(7) Heatwave cocktail - yummmmm! Super citrus and refreshing with a generous fresh mint touch. The only thing was I wished it was a tad bit more spicy overall, there was sadly no wave of heat in my mouth...(I LIKE MY DRINKS MUY CALIENTE =))
author: Saleen L.

description: Cute ambiance. No wait. On the downside: service was slow, chips were not fresh-tasting, guacamole was bland, and the chilaquiles was just OK. Also, it cost 3x what a taqueria would charge.
author: Morris R.

description:
My first Lolo experience was at their Cevicheria (RIP), and I've wanted to try their original restaurant ever since. Needless to say, Lolo serves up stellar Mexican tapas in a quirky space, 

The decor inside is super zany and colorful -- whoever decorated the place had fun while doing it. This restaurant has a festive, tropical vibe that matches their creative menu. Since we stopped in for a late lunch on the weekend, we didn't have to wait for a table. However, this place gets pretty crowded in the evenings (but they take reservations!). 

After being seated, we were immediately treated to chips and salsa. The salsas here were wonderful -- spicy and flavorful. For a drink, we ordered the Michelada -- this beverage had a kick! For our main dishes, we ordered the ceviche, tuna tacon, and panko avocado taco. Each dish came out beautifully plated and served on colorful dishware. The ceviche was a surprisingly generous portion and tasted super fresh. Since I'm a big fan of seared tuna, I LOVED the tuna tacon. The aioli on top adds the perfect flavor. The panko avocado taco was such a fun surprise. I think panko-fried avocado may be my new favorite way to eat avocado! 

I think it's impossible to not have fun while dining at Lolo. Inventive Mexican food, quirky atmosphere, and fun cocktails -- what's not to love?!
author: Elyse W.

description:
Favorite restaurant in San Francisco. This place is so special and dear to me heart. I love the bartenders, they were always so sweet. The ambiance is retro, with a Mexican and modern twist. It was lively, and the restaurant is filled with color. 

These are tapas, so don't expect a gigantic meal to fill you up. My absolute favorite two things here are the Tuna Tacon and the Lamb Sliders. Cooked to absolute perfection. 

The Tuna Tacon comes with roasted tomatillo sauce, and it makes my mouth water. The tuna is seared to perfection. It's on the rare side so if you're like ANTI raw anything, then yeahh this might not be for you. If you get it well done, you'll destroy the whole dish. Go to Mcdonalds and get a fish fillet then. ANYWAY, best thing ever. 

For the Lamb Sliders, it can get a bit messy so maybe avoid this on a first date. The sliders are sooo flavorful and extremely juicy. The different spices in there just blows my mind. 

Been going here for 4 years now, and now I live in NY. Every time I go back to the bay, I always have to stop by my lovely Lolo
author: Frances T.

description:
Disclaimer: review for weekend brunch only. May not be representative for dinner.

Brunch selection was meh. The portions are also extremely small! $14 for two small tacos? I had to go to a taqueria down the street to fill up.

On the other hand, the food WAS delicious though, and the service was pretty great. Still, won't come back for brunch.
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
If you want some more upscale Mexican fare in the Mission, Lolo is where you want to go-go (get it!?). The drinks are on bar with a trendy cocktail bar and the food is worth it.

Here's what you need to know:
1. Dranks are key. If you're here, you should be drinking something. Almost all of the drinks are worth a shot. They're the right amount of delicious and strong.
2. Get all of the food. The tapas are well-portioned so you really feel full with the variety of bites.
3. The vibes and music are trendy Mission. The art on the wall makes Lolo's vibe even more memorable.
4. The wait can be a little long but there are usually spots at the bar available.

If you're looking for something more/trendy. Lolo is one of the go-to spots in the Mission. It's a great date spot, catch up with friends spot, or whatever place you need to show everyone you know what's cool.
author: Kathryn T.

description:
I was very impressed with this restaurant, despite it not being my first pick for dinner last Saturday night. I loved almost everything about it. The decor was colorful and fun, the staff were very friendly, and the food was amazing.

Food:
-guacamole: can't go wrong with guac.
-ceviche: very fresh, had a good amount of shrimp, a delicious combination with the baked crackers that are included with the dish.
-taco tropical: I was surprised that the "taco" tortilla was not a tortilla, but a daikon. That's my fault for not checking beforehand, though. Either way it was good. I just wish it came with more shrimp.
-grilled octopus: if it were cheaper, I would've definitely gotten another one. It was grilled really nicely, and had a slightly smokey flavor.
-pork belly: decent. The meat was a little bit dry, but had a good sweet and salty flavor. The dish was cooked with mint and I usually hate mint, but it wasn't overpowering, so I didn't mind it too much. 
-diabla shrimp: yum. The sauce tasted similar to an Italian tomato cream sauce. 

My favorites were definitely the octopus and diabla shrimp. You're missing out if you're not getting octopus. I know it's a bit pricey, but get it anyways. You deserve to treat yourself...probably. 

Like I said at the beginning, I loved almost everything about this place. If I had one complaint, it'd be that a waitress asked if my table wanted more chips with our dip, but never came back with any. It's okay though. We had barely any dip left anyways.
author: Lucinda H.

description:
Food was really great tasting and the atmosphere was lots of fun.

I highly recommend this place. 

We kept ordering things off the menu each time we saw a neighboring table getting something we did not yet have.

Everything looked at tasted so yummy.
author: Faldo R.

description: I went here on a Tuesday night and it was pretty crowded but I think we must have had a reservation. I loved the tuna tacos, the empanadas and the bees tacos. The guac, chips were nothing special. I would not order the squid calamari. It did look cool though.
author: Julianne O.

description: I am on vacation in San Francisco and this was my first stop. I absolutely love this place. I went on a Tuesday night and it was so busy, but luckily we had a reservation. We ordered drinks and guacamole to start. The guacamole is sooo good!Then for dinner we ordered the fried avocado tacos, my friend is vegan so she ordered this without cheese. The avocado tacos are my favorite. We had gotten our food and our drinks didn't come after waiting a really long time. We reminded the waiter and then they came out right away. That was my only complaint for my night, but they were very busy so it's understandable. The food really is incredible. I have come here so many times and have tried just about every vegetarian option on the menu (which there are a lot of). This place is Latin American, but definitely has a hipster vibe to it. I would eat here everyday if I could. I love Loló so much!!
author: Angelica B.

description:
Lolo's is so fancy, but so good! I don't usually go fancy cause fancy = expensive, but it's okay to splurge sometimes right? And if you want to spend your money on a bunch of Tapas, then why not?! (As I try to make myself feel better for spending $70). 

I came here on a Sunday with a reservation for 3 people and it was crowded! (Reservations highly recommended!) 

We ordered so many plates!
-Fried Brussel Sprouts $8
-Tuna Tacon $12
-Pork butt? $16
-Birria Sliders $12
-Carnitas $18
-Grilled Octopus $28
-Three Cheese Tlacoyo $10
-Flan $8

I never usually eat Tapas, but everything was delicious so we had to order more!The meats were all so tender and juicy. My favorite was definitely the Tlacyo, I LOVE BEANS! The grilled octopus was extremely good too!! I thought it would be tough, but it was so soft and it cut like butter! 

I also recommend the Birria sliders! There was a side of broth that you poured on the meat. Ugh so good! Esp the shoestring fries, they were like a in between French fries and potato chips. The flan was also delicious, very rich!

Lolós gets 5/5 stars for their tender, savory Foods, and also the service was excellent! They just kept the food coming one by one!
author: Meliza M.

description: I love this place!! Amazing drinks, delicious food, friendly staff. It's a great atmosphere all around, and brings me back to home. I can't wait to bring my parents here when they are in town!
author: Gaby L.

description:
OMG I literally love this place and can eat here every weekend. I absolutely love the ambience, very interesting twist with puppies, car doors, jackets and boats on the wall.

I went here with friends on a Saturday and we had to wait for 20mins to get seated, although a bit of a wait time, I still think much better on a Saturday morning, they told us ~30min wait but seated us in 20, which was a win.

As soon as we sat down we got the Sangrias and it was yummmy, we went in for round 2. We got some recommendations from the waiter (who was super cute btw) and it was all on point. We tried the Chilaquiles, tropical taco and the Chilaquiles is to die for!!!! Definitely a must try. 

I have been before for dinner as well but definitely love the brunch here.
author: Darshana S.

description:
First thing you need to know, this place does not serve tapas despite the Yelp description.  Tapas are Spanish.  This place serves Mexican food.  To me, it is glorified taqueria serving two tacos for $11+ dollars.  I had the shrimp entree that came in a sauce reminiscent of the creamy tomato sauce that is the signature characteristic of penne with vodka sauce.

The place is really loud so if you are there for conversation, you will be sorely disappointed.  Service was inattentive at best.  We told our waitress we were not sharing our food but each plate still came out one at a time so by the time I got my dish, everyone else was finished eating.  This was a Saturday night before the symphony so this pacing of our meal made us get to the Civic Center area much later than we wanted to be.  

Because I was looking forward to tapas via the Yelp description I was even more let down by this meal than I would normally have been.  It wasn't bad.  It just wasn't good, either.
author: Jeannette W.

description:
4.5 stars

Interesting art/interior design, great service, and delicious tapas.

Pros: 
-Easy reservations via Yelp. I booked for a Saturday lunch the night before. Make sure your whole party is there though, or they won't let you sit.
-Delicious appetizer chips and sauces
-Delicious food. The tapas are made for two to share

Con: the tables are so close together, I could totally eavesdrop on the conversations on either side of us if I wanted to. And if I didn't.

Food:
-Ceviche: Delicious! 5/5 would recommend 
-Panko avocado tacos: filling and yummy 4/5
- Tuna tacon: seared tuna, avocado, aioli, and sauce on flour tortillas 4/5 (my friend liked it even though she isn't a big tuna fan)

And just like that, we were full. I would definitely come back to try more tapas.
author: Corinna T.

description: Loved the food and ambiance. Great service and friendly servers. Manager came by to check on us. We enjoyed the food very much - highly recommend!
author: Mimi A.

description:
I am so in love with this place. The taco tropical is a huge part of the reason why, but also they have great tequila & mezcal drinks!

Here's what we ate: 
- Chips & salsa: Who doesn't love free chips?
- Shishito peppers: Tasty. No complaints.
- Taco tropical: I could eat this all day. It's so unique with a thin slice of jicama in place of the tortilla, and the shrimp, tropical relish & aoili combo is right up my alley 
- Jicama salad: Simple and refreshing. Nice to chomp on inbetween other dishes
- Ceviche: Wishing this had more shrimp and fish in it, but the bites that did were so delicious!
- Pork belly: Nice that it was gluten free! Good but might not get again

Would definitely recommend! Perfect for brunch or someplace to take out-of-towners. Make a reservation now!
author: Angela T.

description:
I've had this spot bookmarked for a while and am so happy I finally got to try it when my friend came to visit. After a quick shopping trip in Noe Valley, we decided to come here on a whim. Although we didn't have a reservation, we were seated almost immediately since it was about 5pm on the weekend of Christmas. We ordered:

- Corn on the cob: Pass. The corn was a weird drab/grayish-yellow color and tasted old, as if it had been cooked, stored and then reheated.
- Shishito peppers: Blistered beautifully and a good portion size.
- Kale salad: A little too light on dressing which makes the texture of dry kale hard to swallow.
- Taco Tropical: A refreshing, delicious, unique take on tacos. Would definitely order this again!
- Fish Tacos: Fried perfectly but the fish was not fresh. It tasted like it was borderline spoiled before they fried it. (Speaking from experience because I've tried cooking questionable fish at home and you really can't get rid of that smell lol)

3.5 stars rounded to 4 stars only because the Taco Tropical kind of took me by surprise. Enough so to be interested in trying this restaurant again, even with the questionable corn and fish.
author: Tina H.

description:
This is one of my new favorites. We got the pork belly taco, fried avocado taco, and sliders with shoe string potatoes. I don't have a single thing I would change about the food. Definitely bring some people so you can try a bunch of things, but if you only get one of the above I would go with the fried avocado taco.

Then we had the lime dessert which was tart but good. 

Next time we'll have to try some drinks because they had some really interesting sounding cocktails.
author: Elena K.

description:
I didn't want our last meal in SF to be in the airport, so after playing tourist at the Fisherman's Wharf and not finding anything particularly appetizing, we headed to the Mission District.

This place was open and gave our party of 3 a table without reservations. The restaurant's decor is very interesting, definitely in character for the attitude and the experience.

We had a bunch of small plates washed down with a bottle of Cava.

The Ceviche was easily the best dish- extremely fresh, perfectly marinated and just so delicious I couldn't stop eating it even after the other, tapas-style dishes came  Crab croquettes were sweet, almost dessert-like. The Fish tacos were very filling, again the fish was fresh and the taco deliciously crafted. After that, the sliders were a good finish, pulled pork was well seasoned and the dipping sauce pleasantly savory. 

Excellent place to hang, get a small meal, drink up some booze.

Service was outstanding - pleasant and professional.
author: Alex C.

description: If you're looking for delicious Mexican food, you have to pay this place a visit. I especially enjoyed the guacamole, empanadas and the tacos. Oh and their margaritas are great too!
author: Farah D.

description:
Came here on a Sunday for brunch, and was able to make reservations easily. It's in a lively part of the Mission, so it's nice to walk around before or after eating here. The decor and ambiance is festive, but for some reason when we were inside it was blazing hot. I was sweating while eating just from sitting there haha.

The menu is limited, but the food we ordered from it was great. I was skeptical because I've been here before and gotten the avocado toast with fish, and it was terrible (bread too hard to eat). My BF & I shared the Huevos Rancheros, the seafood tacos, and the croissant French toast. The Huevos Rancheros is super basic - eggs, sauce on top, side of avocado, a tortilla, and some pureed beans. Simple but the flavors were good.

The seafood tacos come with a lot of aioli on top, if you like that sort of thing. I scraped some of it off because I thought it was overpowering. Instead of a tortilla, the outside of the taco is some sort of vegetable...radish maybe? This was my favorite dish. The seafood is lightly battered with fresh tomatoes (like a pico de Gallo?) inside, wrapped in the vegetable skin. Yum!

Croissant French toast was interesting - definitely can tell it's different than normal French toast because it's made with croissant bread. Comes with berries, whipped cream, and syrup. Pretty tasty, but I knew I was gaining like 10 lbs when I ate it lol. It's a heavier, carb-y dish.

Prices for the food were decent, overall good value!
author: Betty M.

description: Fun experience and ambiance. Great service. The tropical tacos were my favorite by far. Guacamole game on point too. Wait is long but oh well.
author: Awmber M.

description:
Meh. I saw this place on Check Please Bay Area many years ago, and I had it bookmarked since then.

I had a college girlfriend in town for one night only and I know she loves Mexican food... it was on like Donkey Kong!

I had no problems making a reservation for 3 at 6pm on a Thursday 1 week prior.  

Unfortunately the items that they raved about on Check Please were no longer on the menu. Lamb sliders and Steam pork in a a banana leaf.  

We all ordered a different a cocktail from the extensive list, many are tequila based. I forget the name of mine but it had whipped egg white on top. I tried all three, they were good, but expensive ($12ish) and not very strong, and all in pretty small glasses.

This is a good place to share a few items to eat. We split the sliders , the carnitas, the flautas, the queso (with mushrooms), and the salmon tacos (special of the night). Their corn tortillas are obviously hand-made, but I found them too thick and bland.

I was not over-impressed with any of the items we ordered, they all seemed pretty bland.

It was also hot as hell in there, so do not go here if the temperature outside is anywhere even near warm. (I believe it was somewhere in the low 70's outside but was close to 90 inside, towards the end our our meal, I felt like I was going to pass out.

The service was fine, nothing special, as it got more packed we had to flag down a few people to get our check.

Total for 3 without tip was about $115, so the price was decent.
author: Amy W.

description:
Set inside a bustling, retro, yet hip ambiance, Lolo delivers authentic Mexican food with a modern twist. Went here with a group of 3 and had a wonderful dining experience. 

On weekends reservations are highly recommended as the wait can exceed 1.5 hours easily. The meal began with complimentary chips and salsa that were excellent. We also ordered a guacamole (4/5 stars) that was creamy and bold with added texture from the cotija cheese. The fried brussels sprouts were incredible (5/5), crispy and tender, served with a perfectly balanced vinaigrette with hints of wine. Other highlights included the panko avocado tacos (5/5), which paired a perfectly fried panko crust with the creaminess of avocado. The fish tacos (4/5) and empanadas (4/5) were also delicious. 

Overall a great place to come for small plate mexican food!
author: Aaron C.

description: Loved this place! Highly recommend for those nights you want beers with small bites. I ordered IPA- it was the chillest draft beer I have ever had in SF. It starts with complimentary chips and salsa, loved it. As for the food, expecting usual tapas size, it was bigger portion than I thought. Highly recommend tacos: salmon tacos (not on the menu but ask the waiter) and tropical tacos, both were amazing and I bet other tacos on the menu are as good. Ceviche and pork belly salad were also pretty unique and delicious. What makes the experience the most special and memorable is the unique interior decorations, even the receipt comes in a small leather boot, so cute! Each part of the restaurant has its own theme so it will feel different every time you sit at different location. Everywhere you look around has their unique presentation and you will never get bored visually while eating. I'd definitely want to come back and try other dishes. This restaurant is now one of my favorite tapas and beer places on the list!
author: Adel A.

description: We ordered tuna tacon. It was average. The guacamole was as if it was from a grocery store, bland. Flan was thick as a cheesecake. We were surprised by all the good reviews that the food was just average.
author: Sivani B.

description: Ahhh-MAZING!! We tried ALL the things, practically! Empanadas , panko crusted avocado tacos , spiced-seared halibut tostadas were to die for!  We even let the server talk us into eating fried crickets !! The service was outstanding, the drinks were delicious, and the food was spot-on! Definitely worth making the reservation!
author: Danielle D.

description:
Came here for drinks at the bar before a real authentic Mexican meal at Taqueria Cancun ;) the place was packed when we arrived but luckily we caught a party leaving and snagged an open seat at the end of the bar - my boyfriend had to stand. 

The drinks were great! We started off with two mezcal mules which weren't on the menu but our bartender was very accommodating, relaxed and had a chill vibe. The drinks were very fresh and delicious. Next, I had a spicy margarita and my boyfriend had a michelada. Both were absolutely amazing. The spice for my margarita came from a thin pepper alone rather than a mix-in which I loved! It brought out true flavors. 

We didn't have any food, so I don't have much to comment on that part, but from what I saw, it looked amazing. I was craving the guac they served! I would say my one downside was the lack of bar space, but otherwise I would definitely recommend coming here!
author: Maddy O.

description: Came in a large group for brunch. It gets really busy on weekends so you should make a reservation! The food was good, but the waiter messed up my order. (Might have been avoided if they just wrote it down)
author: John S.

description:
Festive, vibrant and fun tapas restaurant in the Mission with some pretty reasonably priced food! I came here for brunch with a group of friends and had a great experience. Some of us arrived earlier than the rest of the group so we had to wait to get seated, so we decided to chill at the bar and get some sides since were were already pretty hungry.

Lolo's atmosphere is very lively and I really enjoyed being surrounded by fun wall decorations and colors. I would imagine it's a good place for groups of friends to kick back.

The brunch menu consisted of choices like huevos rancheros, tacos, ceviche, etc. The choices all looked pretty enticing and prices range around $9-13 which was great for the quality of the food. After you order, you get complimentary chips and salsa. I noticed that the portions for the tacos appeared small on the plate, but apparently they were pretty filling. Note that the sides like guacamole, grilled beef, eggs, etc actually come on a side plate, not mixed in with your food. The food is plated beautifully and very Instagram worthy. 

Service seemed pretty decent, the only annoyance being that our waiter barely filled a tiny cup of coffee for someone in our group who ordered it. Given that it's refillable, it's not a total ripoff but it would have been better to give a more reasonable amount from the get go.

Kale Salad - Gaja apples, caramelized pecans, cotija cheese, roasted garlic shallots and lime vinaigrette. I actually got the salad without the cheese, and mixed some scrambled eggs in for protein. Huge portions, the bowl of kale was practically spilling out. The dressing was mixed and integrated really well with the kale and the pecans were appetizing. I would have liked more apples and pecans given that they were pretty hidden and sparse in the salad, but this didn't bother me too much. I recommend adding some protein into this dish. 

I would definitely come back and try more dishes here!
author: Chelsea W.

description:
A really great place for Tapas in the Mission.

Some of my favorite dishes are the Guacamole, Fish Tacos, Shishito Peppers, and Grilled Octopus. 

I would recommend getting reservations booked in advanced, especially for parties over 2.
author: Bryan M.

description: This place has been on my radar for a long time, and before our Alamo Drafthouse movie date, we decided to make Saturday night dinner reservations here. The decor is so eccentric, I've never seen anything like it! We started our meal off with margaritas, which were fresh and delicious (and not too sweet) and the guacamole which was divine. I was hesitant to order the cornbread because the photos of it on yelp didn't look too appetizing but HOLY HELL I'm so glad we did. Hands down the best part of our meal. I ordered a veggie quesadilla and my boyfriend ordered chicken tacos for entrees, both were fine. I would definitely return for cornbread and margaritas!!
author: Stephanie A.

description:
We were around the area and decided to grab a quick brunch, so found ourselves here. It's a nice, hipster spot with a fancy non-traditional Mexican flair. I wasn't too hungry, but ended up ordering the Avocado Toast ($11) with the Guacamole to share ($8). Let me start by saying, don't bother ordering the guacamole. I mainly got it because I wanted chips, but they actually provide complimentary chips and salsa for you anyways. On top of that, their guacamole was bland. I found myself enjoying the salsa much more, especially the green one --great kick of spice in it!

As for the avocado toast, it was a pretty solid choice. They two pieces of toast were crisp while topped with huge chunks of avocado and smoked trout. Some more arugula greens were covering the top drizzled with olive oil. It was a fulfilling, yet healthy choice. I actually struggled to finish my second avocado toast. So yay to the avocado toast, but nay to the guacamole. I guess this place is a hit or miss depending on what you order.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Loló is absolutely wonderful! I have been a few times, and it never disappoints. Excellent cocktails, too.

Standout dishes are the tuna tacos, the grilled octopus, and the carnitas.

Highly, highly recommended!
author: Eric T.

description:
Ceviche, tuna tacon, fish tacos, queso fundido. 
Four items not to miss when you stop in. Delicious!

Oh, and very friendly attentive service. I'll be back.
author: Stacey L.

description: Took some friends here to eat. No reservations but it was easy to grab a spot at the counter. Ordered basics, carne and fish taco.. they loved it and being from SoCal that's a good thing! Good service and our server was very good about checking on us.
author: Ann B.

description:
What a fun,delicious treat! Tapas style tacos were inventive and well balanced. Portions are small so be prepared to order 3 or more entrees if you're really hungry. 

Minus 1 star for slow and bad service. Took 20 minutes to get a beer and this was before the place got crowded. 

Bad service is when someone tells you they have a food allergy to mushroom and dish comes with mushrooms. I know mistakes happen but it's not like we want to spend the evening at the emergency room.
author: Julie O.

description:
Late last night we were looking for good eats after midnight. I found Loló's listing and 8 of us converged there around 12:30am. The staff served food snd margies super quick with excellent service and quality.
Late night in SF??? Great till 1am. Thanks!
author: Frank S.

description:
There are a lot of hyped up spots in SF that end up falling short for the price you pay. I was pleasantly surprised here, the portions aren't that small even though it's tapas + it was tasty. 

The chips were a lil thin for my taste but was happy to get chips and salsa while we waited for our dishes. My favorite item of the night was the 3 cheese tlacoyo (kind of like a pupusa, topped with all these vegetables and more cheese). The brussel sprouts were also really good and make you feel slightly healthy. I wouldn't order the ceviche again, it was tasty but part way through I started realizing that it wasn't that much seafood. Would come back to try drinks and other dishes!
author: Hana S.

description:
Amazing weekend brunch place!

Went here with a couple of folks on a weekend around noon. It was somewhat packed. There is bar seating first come first served but the service was nice and they got us a table pretty quick.

It's predominantly Mexican food and there were a lot of vegetarian options. The waiter recommended the chilaquiles which turned out to be pretty amazing! It was an interesting dish - mostly chips really well mixed and cooked with a bunch of spices plus nachos type toppings. Also tried the iced coffee which was perfect to start the day!
author: Vignesh B.

description: This is hands down probably one of the best Mexican restaurants my husband and I have ate at in a long time. They have a large selection of unique Mexican food and whatever we ordered tasted pretty damn good. We ordered 2 margaritas and they were just right, def enough alcohol. The TUNA TACON is to die for and a must try. The Empanadas were also tasty. Overall we had a really good experience and will be back.
author: Deanna O.

description:
Interesting decor! 
Yummy cocktails! 
Delicious tacos! (but they come in small portions.... )
author: Henali P.

description:
Solid 4 star place. I've been meaning to come here for some time now, and was happy to finally be able to get a dinner reservation at a reasonable time. This place always seems booked!

Came here at 6pm on a Monday and tables were already filling up. The decor is nondescript on the outside, but incredibly eclectic on the inside. Case in point: back wall is decorated with car doors. Yes, you read that right.

We ordered the ceviche, al pastor tacos (daily special), and the grilled octopus. Complimentary chips and salsa were served as well. The shrimp and fish ceviche came in a generous portion and was fairly tasty when paired with the tostadas. It was a bit too sour for my taste, seems like they went heavy on the lime. The al pastor tacos were excellent. Great flavor in the pork, balanced by some sweet pineapple. The grilled octopus was definitely the star. Perfectly cooked, great flavor and texture. 

Many of the Yelp photos look a bit dated, as none of the dishes we ordered looked like their photos. So, if you come eat here, take pics and upload them :)
author: Tim X.

description:
Obsessed with that place. I've been there several times and each of them was special. I want to thank the owners for creating such a beautiful and cozy place. I lived there so many beautiful moments. But the food is a sensation guys. Wherever you are, come here and taste is. It's worth everything. I'm more of a spicy person, so tacos and nachos+salsa conquered my heart forever. 
And the stuff is always so attentive and respectful. Always a pleasure to come to you guys. See you soon!
author: Claire S.

description: Came here last Friday night and everything was delicious. My friend and I ordered the tacos, ceviche and chips and guacamole. The wait was a very long time, but the food was definitely worth the wait. I will definitely be returning.
author: Alicia M.

description: Place is packed for a Sunday night even for a 9pm reservation.  Pricey Mexican food but it hits the spot.  Decor is hipster and funky a la Mission.  I liked tuna tacos, beef tacos, pork belly, sliders, guacamole.  Skip the three cheese torte.
author: Bailey N.

description:
Start with the highly recommended Panko avocado taco and their interesting cocktail - two birds one stone.
The molletes ranchero is another good option for veggie lovers.
Hueves a la mexicana- scrambled eggs is certainly very substantial and not as cheesy which is great. 
The portions even though look small are very filling. We ordered just 3 options and felt super full within a jiffy.
Pricey yes as each tapas is around $13 - $14 seems a bit high for a casual dining experience in my opinion. I would say reduce the size and price to give more options of trying a variety of dishes on the menu. Perhaps it was their brunch menu but definitely expensive.

Service was very good and welcoming. Will return for sure.
author: Priyanka S.

description: Had to wait a long time, but we got to have drinks and appetizers at the bar. The menu options had huge variety and everything was delicious! I didn't feel like trying the one with crickets, but others in my group were pleasantly surprised.
author: Madeline C.

description:
The best fish tacos of my 28 years in life!

What makes it the best? The sauce! Sauce can make it or break it for many taco dishes. Some place give so little sauce that I can't taste anything in my fish taco. Lolo does it just right! They are generous with sauce in their fish tacos.  The complimentary chips and salsa were really good as well! Cool decor! Will definitely be back when I'm in town.
author: Nina P.

description:
Lolo is a hip and popular tapas place in SF's Mission District. It can get pretty packed (both the bar and the tables) at peak hours, so it's a good idea to make a reservation before coming (super easy to do on Yelp).

I came for dinner at 7PM on a Friday night and got my table for 2 literally right as I walked in the door (thanks to my reservation!) I've heard that this restaurant can have gnarly waiting times, but I personally did not experience anything like this.

I ordered roasted Brussels sprouts, which were honestly not that great. They were seasoned too salty for my taste, but at least they were quite generous with the portion. Fortunately, the meal got better from there! The taco tropical was awesome (panko and shrimp) with a super rich aioli-type of sauce on it. It lived up to the hype! However, I must say the crab croquetas were my favorite plate from the evening. They were kinda like crab cakes that were crispy and fried on the outside, but super gooey and creamy on the inside with a semi-sweet flavor thanks to the sauce they were served with. Excellent!

And to finish off, I'm not one to indulge in sweets too often, but I am so glad I looked at the dessert menu. After reading the description of the bunuelos, I felt obliged to order it. It was well put together and so flavorful. A delicious, large scoop of vanilla ice cream was served over crispy little flakes of fried dough. Oh my goodness, after eating it, the only thing that stopped me from ordering a second was the fear of overdoing it on the carbs. I highly, highly recommend it!!

Overall, Lolo is a good tapas joint in the Mission as long as you're ordering the right stuff (hit or miss). Either be ready to wait or make a reservation.
author: Phillip V.

description:
Brunch was delicious!! Highly recommend making reservations this place gets packed, quickly.  The interior is colorful and inviting. Each wall is decorated differently and creative.  Service here was on point from being greeted at the door, to accommodating us so quickly (we didn't have reservations) to taking our orders (we orders rounds of food) and to checking in on us.  The entire staff at Lolo was excellent.  
Now lets talk about the food....come ready and prepared to eat some flavorful tapas.  
Taco Tropical: amazing flavorful shrimp tacos
Guacamole: topped with cotija cheese
Chilaquilles: this dish can be shared or for one.  I forgot to order this with an egg, it doesn't come with an egg but still had tons of spice to it and the different types of cheese, yumm.
Ceviche: DELICIOUS!!! good amount of fish
French Toast: The croissant was so light and tasty.

Can't wait to come back and also can't wait to come and try there dinner menu.
author: Abby C.

description:
Came here with 3 other girlfriends for two of our belated birthday celebrations. We ordered a bunch of dishes to share and really enjoyed every dish.

- Guac & Chips: Tasty with a kick of spice - easily devoured this in the beginning of our dinner.
- Ceviche: loved the thin chips that were different from guac and chips. I liked them thin because they didn't overpower the taste of the ceviche when paired together. Loved the large corn pieces and the perfect amount of citrus for the dish.
- Empanadas: very tasty, and only came with enough for the 4 of us. We easily finished our own empanadas and ready to ask for seconds if we weren't full at the end of the meal.
- Shishito peppers: not many had that kick of secret spice, but the flavoring of how they were cooked was delicious and kept me grabbing one after the next.
- Fish tacos: The tacos were probably one of my top favorite dishes of the evening and highly recommend ordering! Flavor was all there and the crispy texture just wins me over.
- Porkbelly: one of my least favorite dish, but only because these dishes at every restaurant have more amounts of fat than the pork meat itself. The flavor was good however, but not much to eat when most was fat.
- Octopus: grilled and also large pieces with yummy arugula. A little on the too charred side, but the texture and flavor was there. We were getting full so this was the dish we started slowly down on.
- Potatoes: These didn't look like potatoes upon arrival because they were covered in sauce that looked like refried beans. They were delicious, but way to hard to finish at the end of this filling meal
- Bunuelos: When ordering we thought these would be something like churros, but we were in for a surprise. The dough strips were like thin chips that tasted like cinnamon toast crunch (cereal) with ice cream, caramel and, strawberry bits. Actually really liked this dish, but wish there were more ice cream than the chip pieces. 

Overall, I had a great experience with the food here. However, we felt rushed to leave because there were people waiting in line. The waiters and waitresses would come around many times to see if things were okay. I understand that people needed the tables, but it didn't feel good to be rushed either when I haven't seen these friends for a long time before this. Other than that the food and cute decor will have me returning one day.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Came for brunch -- this was a lovely experience from start to finish. The service from the hostess to the bartender, to the waitress was excellent. The decor inside is lovely, modern, and clearly Mexican. Food was absolutely delicious - 4 of us ordered different things and every one was beautifully presented and tasted delicious. Great drinks menu too - beer choices included a really nice Mexican IPA, and the bar worked up an interesting grapefruit themed mimosa presented nicely.

My wife is Mexican and she approved resoundingly!

Will be back here for dinner some day.
author: David J.

description:
