No pictures unfortunately but needless to say that this small quaint restaurant is big on flavor, taste and service. Maya, our server, was a pleasure. She's the good thing that comes in a small package. We had the Fish tacos the Chicken tinga tostadas and the Birria sliders. 

Fish was flaky and succulent. Contrast to the fish tacos we had earlier and another Mexican restaurant around the corner, whose name we shall protect for privacy. My favorite was the tostada. Very tasty chicken flavor and the crisp tostada was a treat. The sliders were tasty but my least favorite of the 3.  And by the way, did I say it was cinco de mayo ? Yeah and the margaritas were tasty and flowing. Who doesn't like a tasty margarita?
author: Gerald S.

description: Okay so I've been here twice , and this is definitely one of my favorite spots! It's great for a GNO or even date night but it does get loud. & It does get super busy no matter what day it is.. so try to make a reservation if you can. The food is delicious, my favorites are the ceviche ( super meaty, and the flavor is A1), the diabla shrimp (warm & savory)& the panko crusted avocado tacos (creamy and full of flavor). I've also tried the grilled octopus which was super tender and the carne asada. The drinks here are good as well! I can't wait to come back, and try everything else on the menu!
author: Erika-Kelly C.

description:
Good place for brunchin in the mission district if you're feeling like having mexican cuisine minus the grease. The restaurant itself was really pretty/cute and the host was really friendly. But I had to take off one star b/c the waiter that served us was a little rude.

But moving on to food. We ordered Tuna Tacon and Chili Verde pork butt. Tuna tacon was delicious. Tuna was perfectly seared, cooked on the outside but still raw in the middle. The aioli was what made this dish special tho. Chili verde pork butt was just okay on the other hand. I felt like it was just carnitas cooked with chili verde salsa. It was good but it wasn't outstanding. Chips and salsa were on the house and it wasn't stale.
author: Valerie H.

description:
Colorful decor and friendly vibes here!

Got to sit at the chef's counter, which is my most favorite dining area, to be honest. Why? Because you get to see the food being cooked and prepped in front of your eyes.  It was appealing and entertaining, indeed! 

I loved the Crab Croquetas! Warm and mushy on the inside, lightly crisp texture on the outside and sweet, sticky sauce provided as a surrounding! Homely and delicious! 

Ceviche is a zesty starter and a guaranteed hit.  

They have splendid Mexican-Spanish tapa dishes to be delighted over. 

Pulpo, grilled octopus, with purple potato purée  and topped with arugula was splendid, nicely cooked and savory! 

They have refined cocktails to delve into.  I adored my refreshing Mezcal Mule. 

Friendly staff.

Love!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Very nice ambience. I had the illegal passport Cocktail which was very good. Then I tried the Brussels sprout fried, the fish tacos, the octopus and the special for the day which was slow braised pork and potatoes in this amazing Mayan sauce. Both were very good. Their habernaro sauce is awesome. It's an awesome place in mission.
author: Ash M.

description:
Tip 1) Make a reservation. It'll make your life easier.

Cocktails are great. Food is great. Everything we ordered was great. Decor is great. You can't go wrong. Love this restaurant. It's up there for my favorite San Francisco tapas restaurants with Cha Cha Cha (the one on Haight) and Picaro.
author: Julie L.

description: Quirk filled atmosphere. Interesting options to choose from menu. Only complaint, my mezcal mule wasn't served as shown option. Upside, they did serve it even though it wasn't there in the menu. So will like to visit again if they promise a mezcal mule mirroring that tempting picture on yelp!
author: Kashyap J.

description:
For the discriminating pallet, Lolo serves up a savory variety of small plates, tapas and drinks.

Be forewarned their bar uses olives with pits that can break a tooth. Everything else in this artistic environment was just excellent; kudos to everyone tonight! 

At $4.00 they make a refreshing unsweetened Watermelon Fresca we will try again and again. 

At $7.00 the Shishito Peppers lightly salted and in lemon olive oil were very tasty yet not at all spicy. And, at $9.00 the Empanadas of mushroom, poblano pepper and cheese were another delicious hit. 

At $28.00 their Grilled Octopus was the bomb. Perfectly prepared this was the most delicate grilled octopus we have ever had. I hope that can happen again.

At $13.00 the Chorizo Special was a bit salty for my tastes yet my friends loved it. And, at $12.00 the Chicken Tinga Tostadas were another favorite. Shredded chicken, beans, bacon and peppers arrived on a thin, not oily yet crisp tortilla we all loved.  

We concluded this experience with the $11.00 Fish Tacos'. Tempura rock cod and a few other ingredients made these savory guys a delicious mix of textures and flavors, mmm mmm good. I have added seven descriptive photos for your scrutiny.
author: Caesar A.

description:
We got a reservation here after waiting a while, but glad we finally went here. It's a cozy place and there aren't a lot of tables. 

The food was great, so were cocktails. Service is a little slow but the people are very warm.
author: Namrata J.

description:
There is ALWAYS a freaking wait here. I mean, it's good, but I do think at this point it's overhyped. That being said, I'm also allergic to shrimp crab and lobster so I've never had the famed tacos that people rave about. Maybe they're right haha. I prefer this place at dinner over brunch though their cocktail list is amazing during both times so even if you're not aiming for a meal, definitely get a drink here. 

It's four stars because my dinner experiences here have been five stars (but also every time I'm here for dinner I've been sufficiently drunk so maybe that's why) but my recent brunch experience here was three stars-- it wasn't bad but it wasn't enough to blow me out of the water. The chilaquiles are dope: GET THEM. Best ones I've had in the city and they're slathered in sauce. Servers a bit out of it and don't pay much attention to you but hey, it's a popular place. Chips and salsas need a lil more salt but the spice level is just right. I would say that you could pick anything and be fine here. Come for dinner- try to reserve in advance, or just come early to beat the rush.
author: Christa Lei S.

description: One of my favorites. Try the Windshield cocktail (mezcal, rye, and bitters, and syrup).
author: Bruno B.

description:
Came here for brunch on a Saturday and place was pretty packed but we had a reservation.

First thing you notice is the decor. Every wall has something colorful and interesting (even in the bathroom).

They bring complementary tortilla chips and salsas as you wait for your meal. 

We got the breakfast burrito with chorizo (special of the day), the huevos rancheros and a watermelon agua fresca.
The burrito was good, toasted with a good amount of avocado on top. It was a bit too salty though and I wish it had sour cream to had freshness. But the chorizo, eggs and bell peppers were really tasty.
The huevos rancheros were good too. Eggs were cooked perfectly, the yolk was runny and they come covered in salsa. The beans were too salty too though.
The agua fresca was refreshing but too sweet to my liking.

Service was great! Helpful and nice :)

I will come back to try more of their food, but I'm mostly in love with their ambiance.
author: Coralie S.

description:
My friend and I came here for a late brunch on a Saturday. We made same-day reservations 1.5 hours prior to our dine in time, but given that we ended up eating around 2:30pm, there were a couple open tables when we arrived.

Given the late time, my friend and I were both famished, so we wanted put in our order quickly and get our food asap, however the service was a little bit slow. It took a while for the server/bus boys to give us the menu, bring us water, and finally take our order. I'm used to flagging down servers at Asian restaurants, so I tried to do the same here, but our server was nowhere to be found for long stretches at a time which was a little bit frustrating.

However, the food was phenomenal, just as I remembered from my previous visit. I got the bacon omelette ($13), which comes with green onions, avocado, cherry tomato and roasted home fries. It was a huge omelette stuffed full of avocado and a generous amount of bacon. I definitely felt like I was getting my money's worth with this omelette! 

My friend loves eggs benedicts, and he opted for their Mexican benedict eggs ($12), which is two eggs over fried organic corn gorditas, refried beans, creamy poblano sauce, fried shishito peppers. I didn't try it since I had my hands full trying to finish my own dish, but he really liked it and said it was very different from a regular egg benedict.

They also give you chips + salsa on the house to start your meal, which I thought was a nice touch. Since we were starving, we went through a good amount of these (including seconds) before we got our entrees.

Our total came to around $45 for the two of us, including a drink each. Not too bad for a delicious brunch experience! Plus our bill came in a kid's boot...what an interesting idea.
author: Dianna H.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in SF. I love the fish tacos, the nice atmosphere, the decor. Everything is wonderful!!!
author: Erica V.

description: I love this place. It's got a quirky and very hipster atmosphere and I love the interiors. I've been here for brunch and dinner twice. I think dinner is much better. They used to have lamb sliders which were amazing, I hope they bring then back. The cebiche and brussel sprouts are amazing too. Highly recommend this place.
author: Vyoma K.

description:
This place has been in my list for a while and one day we finally checked it off! My overall consensus is that the food is good but a little overpriced. However, you can't really hold that against them since we are in San Francisco where most things are over priced. 

All of our food was good with the exception of the shishito pepper appetizer. If you've had shishito peppers, you know they don't need much. Just a little olive oil and salt. These came out and there was barely any salt. It was kinda silly that a dish so straight forward lacked seasoning. Other than that our other tapas were really good.
author: Katlyn H.

description:
Food is great, I'll get to that in a bit, but first ...

CAN WE TALK ABOUT THE"BIRD AND SEED"?
It is amazing on so many levels. First, High-five to the genius who thought to put chicken stock (or was it broth) into a cocktail. The cocktail was sweet with a nice tang from the lime and the essence and suppleness of a good chicken soup (without the salt of course). Very refreshing drink. I'd go back just to get that cocktail. I also had the "Shiso overrated," which was wonderful as well. Normal mint is used so often in cocktails, so it's great to see a more interesting one used here instead.

Ok, onto the food. If you like octopus you need to get it here. One of the most tender octopus I've had. Great flavor as well, and I also loved the poi-like mash underneath. Carne asada was also grilled to a perfection. Juicy and red in the middle, nice char on the outside. Grilled little gem salad was also great. I've never had grilled lettuce leaf in my salad and love the dimension grilling added to the dish.

Only thing I was underwhelmed by was the ceviche. Fresh ingredients, but not the most innovative preparation I've had. It's pretty standard, i just mainly tasted the sourness from the lime juice.
author: Helen C.

description:
I had high expectations for this place, but was sadly disappointed. The guacamole was average, tasted kind of watery, with an excess of lime. The shishito peppers were too blackened, and too salty. The octopus, which I was really looking forward to, was ruined by the weird, gummy potato purée. It was unnecessary, and the consistency didn't work well with the octopus. The octopus itself was well done, but I would have been much happier if it had been served with just the arugula. 

The fish tacos were tasty - crispy and moist. The tropical tacos were good as well. I liked the use of jicama in place of the tortilla.
author: Saralyn D.

description:
Had a great experience. I've only been once and I will definitely be back. The server was great but he was swamped so he was unable to get to us for a little bit. A few other staff members and what appeared to be the owner helped out to make sure we were taken care of when our server couldn't. Great teamwork!

The food was great quality and the cocktails were very tasty as well.
author: Victoria A.

description: I'm a big fan of a good tapas place. The birria sliders were okay. I was not a big fan of the octopus sopes. The interior was unique. Maybe I'll just come here for drinks next time rather than food.
author: Tilly D.

description:
Ive passed by this busy restaurant and finally got to go in for brunch a few days back.  Now I understand the hype.  This place is great its like eating in an art exhibit.  Lolo is decked out with art installations all over the walls.  I sat next to the paper plane wall and found it very amusing.  
Equally important is the great food.  My boyfriend and I decided on the carnitas and tuna tacos.  The tacos were incredible.  I also enjoyed the chips and salsas which paired perfectly with our cocktails.   Will be dining at Lolo more often.
author: Alicia G.

description: Lovely environment, vibrant food, and unique drinks. The octopus melts like butter and is one of the most amazing dishes I've ever had. It's a must try!!!
author: Kathia B.

description:
The food was bland. The bill was a little over $200 and not worth it at all!

Went in because we were running late and wanted some fresh and light seafood. Chill vibe and nice decor, the host was super nice and got us seated quickly! The menu looked great and had many options that appealed to us.

We started off with margaritas, drinks were a little light and tasted like cucumber water, this is when I first noticed their salt was super light in flavor.

We had a bottle of white wine to pair with our seafood, it was super chilled to the point where it was sweating the glass and leaving rings on the table. Once the temperature got warmer the wine really opened up. That was around the time of our last bite...

Our first plate was the ceviche, it tasted like tomato water and a squirt of lemon juice with a few shrimps scattered through out.
Sprinkled a little salt on top, tasted like I sprinkled flavorless fairy dust.

The octopus was cooked decently and it was quite tender, yet again it was bland. The arugula had more flavor than anything on the plate, it was the only thing memorable. 

The tuna tacon was cooked well and had a great texture, but the light flavor might as well have been sashimi. 

'A la Diabla' Shrimp. They need to change the name because its misleading. Buttery, creamy, tomato soup with shrimp and a scoop of white rice would have been great if it was $8.99 and what I wanted to eat but I ordered 'A la Diabla' Shrimp...

If I had to choose one item worthy of eating it would be the calamari and octopus gorditas, light in flavor but in a good way. Great mix of textures and unique. This was the last item we got and its what saved my sanity allowing me to enjoy the rest of my night.
author: Yosof R.

description:
Really wanted to like this spot, but because I live in LA I know Mexican food. 
We started out with the guac, can't screw that up! Then we got the tuna tacon taco and the taco tropical as recommended by our waitress and I couldn't get over the terrible tortilla. It was thick and stiff like cardboard. I ended up just eating the taco filling. We also got the chicken tostadas that neither of us finished. If we enjoyed the dishes we got we would have ordered more.
author: Alyssa B.

description: Don't hesitate, run to Lolo now! Everything is delicious but the Tuna Tacon, Taco Tropical, and empanadas are exceptional! By far my favorite SF neighborhood restaurant, and I live on the other side of town!
author: Rita F.

description:
AY YI YI, I AM GOING LOCO FOR Loló!!! This is the PERFECT, I want/need to eat before I drink, but not eat too much so I still can get buzzed or semi wasted or super belligerent wasted or pass out in a Jack in the box 75 cent entry public bathroom wasted (just a spectrum of my drunken states btw - the Jack in the box scenario is if I didn't eat). Anywhoo, Loló has perfect tapa serving sizes, flavorful food, tasty drinks, cutesy but not tacky ambiance and wonderful service that will always start your night off right! 

WHATS GOOD: 
-The Ceviche - great roasted flavor to it and good amount of seafood. 
-Fried Brussels Sprouts - My mama always told me you always need to add some greens and these bad boys are fried to perfection. 
-Tuna Tacon Tacos (Comes with 2 but you can add a third for 6 dollars). Seared Tuna is all you need in life and this hits the spot, reallll GOOODD.. 
-Grilled Picanha - Note: their special of the day is sometimes a meet, but I highly suggest getting this top sirloin rather than the special b/c the special is a hit or miss. 
-Grilled Octopus - Could be more tender at times - but the potatoe puree and the greens combined with this is not yo regular octopus. 

Pair their GOOD food with some drinks like their mezcal mule (highly suggest because of the smokiness that it brings out of the whole drink) or the Lorenita (Mezcal Margarita) and you are set! Did I also mention that the servers are really nice and you probably should do a reservation ahead of time as this place isn't too big.
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
Went back for dinner and was very happy! Still not actually tapas - well, not Spanish tapas. Latin American small plates, which I guess a lot of people call tapas - but just to be clear, not Spanish tapas.

Everything was really pretty good. 

Least impressive was probably the Shishito Peppers - not that there was anything wrong with them, just nothing particular to speak of.

Tuna Tacon is super good.  The Aoili is bomb and the tomatillo sauce on the side is a great balance of sweet and spicy. I think this was the winner of the night

Empanadas are awesome too. Especially for being vegetarian. Very flaky rich dough - the most important part!

Carnitas were also very good. Not the BEST I've ever had, but still really tender and flavorful.  Always wanting more of these. The tortilas come in a fun red pot too - very festive.

Definitely good idea to make a reservation!
author: Sarah C.

description: Came in for brunch with a few girlfriends. The food was good but the portions are craaazy small, especially for tacos. Drinks were nothing special.
author: Shalini C.

description:
So glad I finally made it to Lolo! My friend and I stopped in on Saturday night (8:00pm-ish), which we expected with about an hour wait. We headed to the bar (busy) and ordered cocktails, hovering over people who looked like they were starting to finish up. I ordered this odd cocktail with mezcal and chicken broth because it was enticing and it ended up being really delicious and smooth (recommend)! About 30 minutes in we stole a seat at the bar and immediately ordered chips and guacamole. A large portion to serve 2 - 3 people and the guacamole was tasty, chips on the thinner side. For our main meal we had the following: 
- arugula salad: super tasty and refreshing - 4 stars 
- three cheese tlacoyo: Don't get me wrong, great dish, but I saw three cheese and immediately thought three-melty cheeses and not the case. It was fresh crumbled cheeses, which again was delicious but I had melted in my head! - 4 stars 
- carnitas: so good, just get, tortialls were pretty thick, avoiding need for two - 5 stars 

There are so many good dishes... can't wait to go back and check out more!
author: Aryn C.

description: I knew when I head the Beastie Boys instrumental album I was in the right place! Atmosphere was great as was the music and staff. Food isn't to be overlooked. I got the Beef Tacos and the meat was tender and delicious. Solid experience.
author: erin X.

description:
Was excited to check this place out with my boyfriend based on all the great yelp reviews but unfortunately both of us left the place disappointed. We managed to get reservations for a Saturday night quite easily, thanks to yelp reservations and the place was packed when we got there.

The problem was the seating; our table was right next to the other table of two so much so that it felt like a party of 4 and I could totally overhear their conversations. We asked if we could sit at the bar instead but were told that the seating at the bar was first come first serve and that we wouldn't be able to eat food at the bar so we decided to stick with our table.

Service was good, we were attended to promptly on arrival and our server kept checking on us. We ordered the empanadas and two drinks - devil's dandruff and the perfect stranger. The food was ok but the drinks were mediocre, we didn't quite taste alcohol in them. The quality of food didn't live up to the price. At this point in time, I felt like the place was overhyped.

I am willing to give this place another try but not anytime soon since there are plenty of good Mexican restaurants in the mission that serve delicious food.
author: Preeti R.

description:
I love going Lolo! The food and drinks are consistently amazing...and those tacos...delicious!

What's consistently not amazing is the inaccurate wait times for dining without a reservation. I've eaten here ~20 times in the last few years and usually never have a reservation. Wait times are always quoted as 3-3 1/2 hrs and it's usually 1hr-2hrs max, even on a Fri or Sat night. If I were the owner, I would cringe if I watched the amount of business that left the restaurant due to inaccurate wait times. There's plenty of stuff happening on a Valencia St, people will come back for their table. Just be more accurate and quote 2hrs, it's not unreasonable :)
author: Brian C.

description: Best Mexican in San Francisco. Good vibe and service, reservation a must! Pork belly is to die for.
author: Richard S.

description:
Best. French. Toast. Ever.
Seriously.

The atmosphere is upbeat and the music gets you moving. The decor was my favorite part about the restaurant. It was very unique and peculiar. 

The food is good and they like to play around with their ingredients to make things more interesting, like the tacos with the jicama tortilla!

Overall a good experience.
author: Elva C.

description:
Came here for dinner, a little dim but maybe it's setting the mood hehehe 

We ordered a few tapas and everything was so yummy ... the food came out fairly quick  (which was good because I sat through traffic and was starving) 

I asked the waiter "what's your strongest drink" he suggested two and I picked one. Man o man ... he wasn't kidding! That drink was strooonnngggg and trust me when I say it's strong, it's probably strong. I'm not even sure what the drink was but all I know it was clear hahhahaa 

Def will come back to try more stuff :)
author: Jenny M.

description:
Yummyy!!

I came here during their brunch time and had a mimosa that made me say: Shit, that is fresh. 
(bonus points if you get that reference)

Their cocktails are delicious and well-crafted. They have an eclectic and playful interior with a theme of boots! - the check comes in a tiny one that's so cute.

We got the guacamole and chips which was creamy and flavorful but I kinda regretted it later seeing that it was $8 LOL. But the salsa that comes with the chips, was everything I like: tangy and spicy. It was perfection - i wanted to drown in it. 

As for the food, I was deciding between the chilaquiles or huevos rancheros and decided to go with the latter. The flavors married well together and my favorite element was actually the beans. I love refried beans and theirs is smooth and savory.

It's on the pricier side, but I guess for SF it's average. It's also in a really cute neighborhood close to The Balm and Dandelion Chocolate, so definitely a place to checkout and try.
author: Amanda K.

description:
I was really hoping to like Loló based on the reviews and photos (that are 6 years old LOL), but perhaps because we went during lunch and the fact that didn't order that much food variety... it was simply average.

The greeter was extreeemely nice and respectful. Our waiter on the other hand... when he was speaking to us, it seemed like he was looking elsewhere and wasn't even paying attention to us. 

We ordered the ceviche, side of guac and beef tacos. Ceviche was the best dish - fish and shrimp were fresh and it was a good sized portion. We wanted guacamole - fyi, I think the side is a perfect amount and you probably wouldn't need to order the actual guacamole dish, unless you have a party of 3 or bigger. Guacamole was standard... nothing special but jalapeños were supposedly really spicy. Lastly, the beef tacos were good, but again, nothing stood out about these tacos. They definitely slather on a ton of beef per taco though! You also get tortilla chips with two sauces as an appetizer. The sauces aren't spicy and both quite good. The chips that gave us were all broken though, like the ones at the bottom of the chip bag. We had to ask them for more (whole) chips.
author: Cathy C.

description:
Came here with a couple friends on a Sunday morning, and everything was going great. I ordered the breakfast burrito because I was starving and needed to fill up. 

After finishing it, I wasn't very impressed; the flavor wasn't there and the meat was like, grossly mushy. Actually -- the whole thing was kind of just one big mush, with not a whole lot of flavor. I had to ask for hot sauce to add something to it. It helped. 

Anyway, that wasn't the worst part. I started feeling nausea and headaches a couple hours later, and over the course of the next 4 days I had the WORST times in the restroom and some serious stomach cramps. I actually went to the restroom every 2 hours. Not even exaggerating one bit. I'd wake up at 1 am, then 2, and so on. 

I've never had food poisoning so I don't know if that was it, but it certainly felt like it! 5 days later and I am finally recovering. 

All to say... you probably won't have the EXACT same experience... but if you do, something's definitely up. Don't get the breakfast burrito.
author: Joshua C.

description:
Came in with my boyfriend for a late Saturday morning. We waited for about 5 minutes before we were seated. We started off with drinks, I had the Yerbabuena, and he had a michelada. I was scared of how the michelada was going to be because we usually make them at home the way we grew up making them in Mexico, and have a hard time finding similar ones. However this one was great! It was similar, still had some of the traditional taste but tasted like a classier version of a michelada. I had visited Loló before with my friends some time ago, but only during dinner and for drinks. We then had the ceviche and the taco tropical to share. They both blew our minds. Although the ceviche had a lot of tomato, the flavors were so complimenting and extremely delicious. Then we shared the carnitas plate, which came with tortillas de maíz azul, and it smelled like my abuelita's tortillas. The way in which it was brought out to us was genius - very traditional to the way it is served in Mexico. We loved everything that was brought out.

Living in San Francisco as a native Jalisciense has been challenging in terms of access to traditional Mexican food, and Loló was an amazing and nostalgic experience. It was an upscale presentation of foods I grew up eating with my family. It was familiar, yet completely modern and new. I had a wonderful experience at Loló. I really appreciate the chef and the time spent on each dish to create perfection. I can't wait to try what's next on the menu. 

Planning on visiting his other restaurants, especially in GDL!
author: Mimi G.

description: Great food, wonderful service, and a nice, colorful, friendly environment. I recommend the avocado tacos.
author: Joni W.

description: After a Monday evening of indecisive food struggles, we landed on Loló -- and good god am I glad we did. We enjoyed what was possibly the best fish taco I've ever eaten in my life, and I come from LA where one can find a fish taco on every corner. Delicious, lime-heavy guacamole, and a uniquely composed grilled octopus dish made this dinner truly memorable. Thanks for saving our night, Loló.
author: Paddy D.

description: Went to Lolo for a fundraiser - there is a cute private room downstairs - perfect for events.  The owner was amazing and the food incredibly tasty.  We sampled mini chicken tostadas, ceviche, guacamole, chips.  Yummmmmmmy!  I love that this is a local family owned business that cares about the community.  The main dining room was lively and packed with a fun atmosphere.  Definitely recommend for both events and for some of the best Mexican food in SF!
author: Anne E.

description: My friend who just returned from Spain said, "the food here is better".  We ordered a total of 4 dishes plus beers and it was perfect for the two of us.  We even had one leftover pork belly which was amazing for breakfast the next day!
author: Annie R.

description: Found this gem and loved everything about it. The chicken tostadas are a must. The ceviche was one of the best in town. I really enjoyed the tropical shrimp tacos. Different twist. Make reservations could be a long wait.
author: Princess Jasmine J.

description:
This place a gem.

Came on a Thursday nite, packed but friendly and amazing 

Atmosphere:
is amazing, great for a fun date or great time with fun friends. 

We ordered:
- Beef taco! Amazing
- Avocado taco! To die for
- sliders! Most tasty

Drinks:
- windshield, was ok
- the bartender made penicillin #2, excellent
- he also made us a Moscow mule type drink, also amazing

Overall?  This is my fav. Mexican/tapas place today!!!
author: Mary N.

description:
Love Loló.  Delicious cocktails and fantastic tapas-style dishes.  

Be sure to get:
Tuna Tacon - Absolutely amazing mini-tacos with a stick of seared tuna steak.
Crab croquettes - Delightful balls of creamy, crabby goodness.  
Calamari and octopus gorditas - Crunchy seafood ecstasy on squid ink blue corn masas.

Guacamole was good and arrives instantly, so it's great to start munching.  But it's not the best guac ever.  We added a lot of the spicy salsa to it, which added a needed kick.

Be sure to go with a reservation.  The wait can still be 15-30 minutes even with a reservation, but can be over an hour (on the weekend) without.
author: Greg B.

description: Colorful decor and small plates... The walls are textured in an array of print and pattern reminscent of the west region of Mexico (Jalisco to be exact!). And it's always lively inside. We love getting the taco tropical and tuna takon. If there is one request from back in the day when Lolo was located on 22nd street it's to PLEASE bring back the squid croquettes! They were the best...
author: A K.

description: Great cocktails!, awesome food! hand made tortillas and car doors on the wall. what more could you want in a place? book early and definitely make a reservation. this is a happening spot in the mission and one of our favorite places. good for a drink or a 20th anniversary. enjoy!
author: Jeny L.

description: Came here for brunch because I read it was up and coming. Cute little spot in a cool neighborhood. Had a mimosa (it was ok), avocado tacos, and huevos ranchero. Boyfriend got the beef tacos. Enjoyed my food and thought it was very tasty. A tad pricey but it's San Francisco. Would go back.
author: Laura E.

description: I've been here multiple times. Their steak tacos are amazing. Most tacos are very good. Grilled octopus was average for the price. Friendly and quick service.
author: Mei T.

description: Stopped in for brunch one weekend after doing some window shopping, and ordered some tacos. Came out with 2 and they were smaller than I was expecting, but I was surprisingly satisfied. It helped that we ordered chips and guacamole for the table. My sister ordered avocado toast, which also looked yummy. Everything was good, but for some reason I wasn't blown away and it's not somewhere I'd think about returning to.
author: Kathy L.

description:
Fancy mexican food! So good! The decorations in this place has all the colorful-ness of a Kahlo, but with all the randomness and silliness of a Dali. Get the tacos, they're delicious- and you can select a variety so you can try a few at once. 

Get reservations if you can though, because this place gets hoppin' around dinner time (around 7PM) even on weekdays. Weekends are even worse, but if you come early or late than you should be able to beat the rush. If you really can't wait-- just get a drink and come back :)
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
Fun atmosphere | Great location | Delicious Tapas
$$

First time coming here and it won't be my last! 

I made reservations through Yelp during their weekend brunch hours after reading other reviews about possible long waits. The first thing I noticed was the creative and colorful interior of this place! So cool -- baskets on walls, brightly printed wallpaper, car doors, bicycle parts on light fixtures, western belts on barstools... etc. 

Food is delicious!! Here's what we ordered (party of 3) -- 
Beef tacos ($9) x 2
Ceviche ($12) x 2
Kale salad ($9)
Shishito Peppers ($7) 

Kale salad is a pretty big portion. It can easily be split by 2 people and have a third person sample some. 
Generous portion for shishito peppers, too. They're not spicy! One or two may have a tiny kick to it though. 
Ceviche was really good and the perfect amount if you order one other dish with it. 
Beef tacos were tasty, though a little bit oily. You get 2 small tacos, so if you're pretty hungry, I highly recommend ordering another dish or two with it. 

Natalia is an excellent waitress. 
She was very attentive and didn't rush us even when they were closing to prepare for their dinner hour. 

We parked at the Mission Bartlett garage, which was only a couple minute's walk to this restaurant. Valencia street has a bunch of neat shops to check out. Highly recommend this place!
author: Lauren F.

description:
4.5 stars.

When I think of restaurants in my regular rotation, Loló is definitely on the list. It's just soooo good!

I've been eating here since they were located on 22nd Street (now Loló cevicheria), and am extremely sad they no longer serve the dishes that I loved so much-- the octopus tiradito and the Mexiterranean cheese fondue. Those were two of my favorite dishes amongst ALL food that I eat regularly in SF. Seriously, bring those back into my life and I'll bump this review up to 5 stars.

But everything else is still really good:
-CEVICHE: Probably my favorite Mexican style ceviche. It retains traditional flavors but gets amped up with roasted pepper. They give you 3 tostadas that you can break to eat the ceviche with (or eat whole to be more traditional). If you're out of tortillas, no problem; you can still scoop up some ceviche with the provided chips.
-Fried BRUSSEL SPROUTS (*brusselS sprouts, btw): My go to vegetable dish. Perfectly crispy and the vinaigrette adds a nice acidity.

Tacos: 2 of each
-TUNA TACON: Must order. Totally Asian fusion, but seared albacore tuna makes for a delicious taco. The tomatillo sauce in the spoons is also super bomb.
-TACO TROPICAL: Really different because it's tempura shrimp smothered in aioli on top of a JICAMA tortilla. The jicama makes the dish not too heavy and adds a refreshing, crunchy texture to the taco. I don't always order this because I'm happy with the tuna tacon and can only eat so much, but it's definitely worth experiencing.

Other items:
-Grilled OCTOPUS: the purple potato puree makes for a pretty presentation. Not the most tender octopus I've ever had, but I like the garlic and paprika adobo flavors.
-Grilled PICANHA (top sirloin): I almost always opt for steak everywhere I eat, and the steak at Loló is good; medium rare, just how I like it. I also love nopales (cactus) and think it adds a wonderful Mexican flare to chimichurri. However, I've only ordered the picanha once because I'm perfectly satisfied just loading up on seafood. This never happens because I am super carnivorous, but at Lolo's, the tacos and ceviche are so good that I devour them and I'm just too full for anything else.

Drinks: Mezcal and pisco are my favorite liquors, so I definitely recommend the Lorenita (which is pretty much a margarita but with mezcal) and the Fresh Prince (which is almost like a Maracuya sour).

Brunch:
The red SANGRIA is probably one of the most flavorful sangrias I've ever had. The cardamom lends a delicately herbal note to really refreshing drink. I most definitely prefer it to the white sangria that they also offer even though it may be tempting if you're feeling like it's a white wine kind of day. But I guarantee the red sangria is more flavorful!
-Crispy CHILAQUILES: I almost always order chilaquiles for breakfast at any Mexican restaurant. These were satisfying, but I had to ADD EGGS to my order.
-Mexican BENEDICT EGGS: The gorditas made it really filling, and the creamy poblano sauce was delish.

Gosh this review took me forever. TLDR version: If you haven't eat at Loló yet, do it now! You won't be disappointed.
author: Stephanie Joyce D.

description: We had an amazing time here! The food and drinks were both outstanding, and the atmosphere makes it really fun for a vibey dinner in the Mission District. We made a reservation which made the experience that much better, so I would highly recommend reserving a table online the day before you plan to come...
author: Rae S.

description:
Fairly casual tapas place for a slightly but not too upscale dinner. I had a group dinner at the old 22nd St location and really enjoyed it, so was curious to revisit. My brother was in town and I figured Mexican food would be something SF did well compared to East Coast and a treat for him. I looked for a reservation through Yelp and only saw 5:30 and 10 so didn't bother, however we walked in at 6:15 and were able to be seated immediately. It looked like they left half of the seats open for walk-ins so you'd probably have a good chance if you didn't come at peak peak with a large group.

Very colorful, funky and eclectic decor including a wall with paper boats lining it making a unique wallpaper. The bathroom was well kept, clean, and spacious. Service was pretty good, attentive but not too much.

Chips (3/5) - Housemade, standard, enjoyed the green salsa which was more tangy and citrusy.
Brussel Sprouts (3/5)- Pretty standard, you had some burnt crisp parts and it had a firm but cooked texture, not mushy. Hazelnuts added more toasted, nutty flavor and crunchy texture.
Beet Salad (4/5) - One of the more creative dishes, slices of fresh beet were laid on a cotija cheese mousse with pieces kumquat, a great combination of sweet and savory, citrus and cream.
Ceviche (4.5/5) - Very good! You can taste the freshness and burst of flavor. There wasn't that much actually shrimp, maybe 3-4 pieces. Shrimp and fish, chunks of jicama, toasted corn. The kernels of corn are hard and crunchy. Flour chips were great too.
Pork Belly (3.5/5) - Lots of slabs of pork belly, flavorful, but very heavy. I ate about a fourth of it and couldn't finish because of the previous courses and because it was so rich. The texture is more chewy than crispy.  I liked the seasoning served with onions, cilantro, and red peppers.
author: Truc N.

description: BEST FOOD IN THE CITY. Seriously, everything is incredible and decadent. Each flavor is vibrant and the portion sizes are perfect for trying lots of different options in one sitting. Also! The cocktails are incredible. One downside is that they don't take call ahead reservations, and usually there is at least an hour wait. But! There's first come first serve seating at the bar.
author: Deidre L.

description:
The food, staff and the decorations were amazing! So colorful, beautiful and unique. You have to go to and see for yourself.  
The staff were very nice, sweet and understanding. They were appreciative and courteous.  Lots of smiles and did not mind taking our pictures!

Our favorite that day: The Taco Tropical, the Panko Avocado Taco and the Chile Verde Pork Butt were delicious!! 
The beverages such as: Margarita (tequila), Lorenita (mezcal) and the Lolo Mimosa were great and so good! I personally like the Margarita, it was not too strong and not too sweet, and the alcohol was the perfect amount.  It was just perfect!
My friends and I had a great, and fun time.
author: Barbara S.

description: Friends and I came here without a reservation and got a seat at the bar. Surprisingly packed for a Monday night, but now I know to make a reservation for my next visit because I need more of the tuna tacon and octopus in my life. Service was great and drinks were delicious. Looking forward to trying out the rest of the menu!
author: Samantha E.

description: If you like tapas this is the place for you. Lolo is the best Spanish restaurant in San Francisco, way better than Picaro, Esperpento and Contigo. Food is delicious and classy and cocktails have a large amount of alcohol, so you rather be careful; more than one and you'll be too drunk to drive back home. The manager is very friendly and every time we go to the restaurant he takes care of us. This place is a must for anyone who likes tapas.
author: Diego R.

description:
EVENT: Been here twice already! And I love this place! First time... with my BBF and the other time ... I was hellllaaa carving Lolo... so took my Mr.

LOCATION/PARKING: located inside the mission... so parking issss soooo difficult!

SERVICE: Reservations is a MUST! Yes... this place is hella poppin! Especially Fridays and the weekend.. and if you come prime time.. be expect to wait 1 hour ++++++ .. it's no joke! LOL! Checked in... and we got seated really fast! Took our order really fast also! We ordered as we went until we were full! Mmm! YUMS!

FOOD: Seriously, everything here is excellent! Here's what I got.. There's some dishes I didn't take any pics... cause I got too excited to eat! LOL!
(1) Taco Tropical
(2) Panko Avocado
(3) Fish Taco
(4) Ceviche
(5) Lamb Sliders
(6) Pork Belly
(7) Grilled Octopus

DRINKS: Of course... Sangria!!!! Mmm! Love the taste! You can taste the cinnamon!

**MUST GET: ..... EVERYTHING!!!! 5 stars and beyond! Don't forget to make reservations!
author: Mindy Y.

description: Love this place! The food here is excellent and the owner is amazing. We went here a few months ago and he even played with my baby while we ate! The place is loud for kids Andy he wait can be long. We are vegetarians and there were many options! I highly recommend this place for vegetarians.
author: Swetal P.

description: Amazing craft cocktails to start. Had the tuna tacon and can echo other recs on Yelp - it's a must!
author: Danielle P.

description: Good food but the wait is ALWAYS crazy!! Would not recommend attempting dinner here without a reservation
author: Ushma S.

description:
Nothing to write home about...
Small portions and high prices not exactly bad nor good . Trendy atmosphere and just ok. I have high standards as I am mexican and like authenticity.
Chicken tostadas ok.. we ordered the Avocado taco and those were gross it had mayo, would not order that again! Hot avocado with mayo ( I do not like mayo) but hey if you do then order it ! They call it Aoli ( fancy name for mayo mixed with something) 
I can't complain service was great. I would say its nice for drinks and a light meal aka the tapas but charge appetizer prices and not more. My friend had the fish tacos and she really liked them.
author: J C.

description: Great prices. Amazing food. Causal but upscale atmosphere. GO HERE!! This was one of the stops of our three day Portland trip and I am still thinking about the pastas. Yum!
author: Afsana A.

description: Now this is some food! Getting to Lolo was quite a task it seemed, but it was well worth it. We made a reservation which was good, because it got pretty crowded. Some of the most interesting food I have ever eaten, absolutely delicious Jaliscan cuisine in SF. Nice looking restaurant, bar, and decor. Service was really good. Get the ahi tacos, not overly filling, but insanely delicious and perfectly made. I can't wait to go back here!
author: Blake L.

description:
Went for brunch. Food was alright. Portions were pretty small and the taco meat was pretty plain.
The meat was dry and the flavor was pretty plain.
The salsas for the chips were weirdly watery. Didn't have much flavor in them either.
author: Andy L.

description: What an amazing place. I had shrimp tacos ceviche and octopus. My favorite was the octopus hands down. Wow amazing.
author: ed e.

description:
Nestled in the mission of busy Valencia row, Loló is 2 blocks from Dolores City Park. It has a funky environment, automotive doors hung on the wall, folding paper boats art on another wall, and rooster figurines on the top shelf in the kitchen. Aside from the interior space, let's get the chow down.

Starter - Chip and Salas. The chips is fresh, and a nice hit me spot while waiting for our orders. We were given 2 sauce, one tastes like chipotle with a mild hotness, and the other had a sweet taste.

Wife ordered Agua Fresca. It was supposed to be watermelon, but they didn't have any that night. So the other choice is Guava. Wife said it seems like it came out of Kerns Guava Can.
 
Kale Salad - gaja apples, caramelized walnuts, cotija cheese, roasted garlic, shallots and lime vinaigrette.

The kale salad is a bit dry, and this is after mixing all together. The slice gaja apple didn't provide any crunch. The caramelized walnuts added some texture, but it was little to none. Overall, the balance of this salad wasn't there.
 
Tuna Tacon - seared albacore tuna, shellfish aioli, avocados, roasted tomatillo sauce on the side, on flour tortillas.

The seared albacore tuna just didn't taste like "melting of tuna freshness". The avocado is a good size, but it should have been sliced and fan out on the base to build the albacore tuna as the tower showcase. The taste is ok, but didn't really hit the spot.  

Panko avocado taco - oaxaca cheese, caramelized onion, anaheim peppers, on flour tortillas.

This dish is one of the better. The panko avocado on each bite brings a pretty good texture. The sour cream on the side added some moisture to the panko layer.  
 
Special -  fatty salmon, avocados, radish, white corn, with parsley garnish.

Not sure what it is, but the fatty salmon just didn't cut it. We had fatty salmon raw before, and this doesn't come close to the taste.
 
Ceviche - shrimp and rock fish, citrus roasted pepper sauce and salted corn.

Not sure what to stay on this dish. Tomatoes, tomatoes, and tomatoes. There is also jikama diced cube mixed in bringing some crunch but where is the rock fish? 3 shrimp only? I thought ceviche is a balance of fish or seafood, but this sure didn't make it.

Fish Taco - rock cod fried in tempura, handmade corn tortilla, habanero, crema, peanuts and Paquin pepper sauce.

There goes our rock cod fish. Must have save all the meat to prepare for this dish. The crema with lettuce was like a blob and didn't have a clean balance for us to taste the rock cod.  
 
Crab Croquetas -  dungeness crab, ancho pepper, piloncillo soy reduction and garlic mayo.

Where is the dungeness crab? Ah... look, it is on the bottom of the ball. This dish isn't what we thought as there isn't much crab at all!!! Maybe it is because it isn't crab season. If so, change the dish to taylor to the shellfish season.
 
Final thoughts highlight points:
* local in the busy mission area.
* I can see travelers will dig this vibe.
* Price per tasting doesn't balance 
* do not get seated next to the restroom. they should install a door to keep thr smell out and have somone check them.  
* disappointed
* underwhelming
author: Mike T.

description:
Good food . Good for vegetarians as well. 
Loved their tacos,guacamole, shishito peppers. But you need to be aware that these are literally just fried shishito peppers and no breaded or coated with any thing at all. Good for groups but crowded and very noisy. the service  was very good.
author: Jalaj A.

description: Every dish we had was super! From salad to various tacos to brussel sprouts, each flavor was outstanding and felt like a good value. We went early and sat at the bar - seated right away. I would skip the fancy cocktails next time since that really jacked up the price. Only negative about this whole experience is that it was way too loud! I know some research shows that it's trendy but it's a serious turn-off for me. Will go back early, with ear plugs.
author: Lisa P.

description:
Kind of belated, but was on Yelp and remembered the time I went to this place so decided to leave a review..... just because.

Probably about 6 weeks ago my bf & I had a date night, but not surprisingly we didn't really plan. We wanted to go to Beretta initially but they were (also unsurprisingly) totally packed and had over an hour wait list. I know people in SF like to wait in line, but no thanks. 
We wandered around until we spotted Lolo, where I've not been before but wanted to try. Tapas are my shit, so we checked for a table. Because dinner snacking is life. We had to wait again, but the time was manageable, the hostess (she wore some sort of flower in her hair, I believe) was super well dressed and nice, and they text you when they're ready so you don't actually have to wait there.

We got drinks at Holy Mountain (the bar upstairs in Hawker Fare. Check it out, I love it; the restaurant much less so) and when we got the text headed to Lolo. I got 2-3 tapas, which included the shishito peppers, some sort of tuna taco thing, chips and salsa and maybe something else I can't remember. I didn't try the peppers much but bf was very into them. The tuna tacos were good, albeit literally tiny af. Since this is belated I don't remember all the details but I do remember enjoying them and the tuna being prepared nicely- not overdone. The chips and salsa were fine, but aren't they always? It's tapas, sure, but the sizes of the plates not for when you're hungry.
I also had a couple of glasses of red, Tempranillo maybe? 

It was a Friday so the place was poppin'. Super busy and loud, maybe partly because of the space itself. Which btw is pretty cute with loud & bright floral motifs and some boots/kooky decor. Esentially- great for a fun night with friends or a date.
But, I gotta say, maybe we didn't order enough to taste everything or whatever, the bill was around 60-65 bucks for 2 glasses of wine and what came out to maybe a single decent sized portion of food. Not terrible, but definitely over priced, and I won't say I was wowed by the food. It was pretty good, not something I'd fawn over. The service was friendly, all the waiters seemed chill and super hip. 
I'd give the food a 3, but giving it an extra star for good service and really fun decor & atmosphere.
author: Dina C.

description:
First timer at Lolo, and wow, the food was amazing!! It's a great tapas spot with great quality. It's located in the mission, pretty casual, and I would recommend getting a reservation. Not sure how long the wait would be but we already got reservations so we got seated right away. Pretty much anything on the menu is pretty delicious -- especially what I've ordered. No complaints here! 

The only thing negative thing I would say the service could use a little work. We did get sit down right away at the time of our reservations, but the service on ordering food and drinks too a while. Other than that, I would definitely come back again. 

Things I ordered/recommend:
- GUACAMOLE w/ cotija cheese and tortilla chips
- FRIED BRUSSEL SPROUTS w/ Shallots, hazelnuts, late harvest zinfandel vinaigrette
- 'A LA DIABLA' SHRIMP Creamy and spicy cascabel and chipotle pepper sauce, bacon, white mushrooms, white rice (SOOO GOOD) 
- TUNA TACON w/ Seared albacore tuna shellfish aioli, avocado, roasted tomatillo sauce on the side
- TACO TROPICAL Panko and spice-dusted shrimp, topped with a tropical relish and spicy aioli

If you're planning on getting dessert, I recommend getting tiramisu!! BOMBDOTCOM.
author: Jenn L.

description: Was pretty damn. Things were fresh and well seasoned. Price seems a little high for portions. Best gauc ever!! I will be back to try more.
author: Dani G.

description: Excellent weekend brunch and dinner on any night. They're a bit upscale and inventive but very authentic flavors. Brunch standout Huevos Rancheros with a side of carnitas is ooh sooooo good! Don't miss any of the fish dishes and really everything is very good, day or night. Cocktais, muy excellente! Especially anything with mezcal! Or try the Paloma. MMMMMmmm!
author: Richard L M.

description:
Happy I came but would not return unless something changed. Expensive for tapas. Plates are between $8-12, but each only comes with two small items (two small tacos or two small croquetas, etc). They skimp on cheese and sauce, which is sinful for a tapas place. And their descriptions are misleading. Their "quesadilla" was mostly a bed of foraged mushrooms and spinach with a tiny bit of cheese. Their queso fundido looked like it had no cheese.

The food still tasted good and the atmosphere was really fun, but I constantly had the feeling like we were being quietly duped.
author: Andrew M.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants. Their panko avocado tacos & chilaquiles are to die for. Every time I'm in the Mission, I make my friends go here.
author: Megs M.

description:
I'm Loco for Lolo!
What an amazing experience I had here this past weekend, came around 5pm for dinner on Saturday and found the place buzzing with chatter, upbeat music, and the sweet sounds of perfectly shaken cocktails.  Luckily, we were able to score two seats at the bar and dive right into some amazing drinks and food. 

For food we shared: shishito peppers, guacamole, brussels sprouts, avocado tacos, and some version of a queso fundido.  All food is served with homemade chips and salsa.  The salsa was fresh and chips were crispy/not overly salted.  A total standout was the homemade tortillas that came with the queso, warm, perfectly made and you could taste the fresh ingredients in these. We didn't get any of the entrees, but I like to share a bunch of small plates so this was perfect as the starters can be shared between 2-3 people easily and you will be fulllll.  

The drinks were a real standout, amazing balance of flavors and unique combinations.  I am a mezcal freak so the use of mezcal and tequila in a lot of the cocktails had my head spinning it was so difficult to choose.  We had: 2 birds 1 stone, night call, fresh prince, and a last word with mezcal rather than gin.  Deeeeeeeelicious.  The 2 birds 1 stone is a total brunch cocktail with the carrot juice and salted rim I could just have this for breakfast everyday.  The bartenders are innovative and creative so sit at the bar and they can mix you up something off menu if you can't decide (like me) what you're feeling. 

The service here was outstanding.  The three guys working behind the bar were so nice and knowledgeable about the cuisine and spirits offered at Lolo.  We chatted a bit with one of the bartenders and he explained the owners have some other places in Mexico (where we are visiting in a few months) so he wrote down some recommendations for us to go. I got a great sense of camaraderie with the staff here, it is nice to see people enjoying their work and making sure the guests have an amazing experience. I will be back to Lolo soon!
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Came here on Saturday night and this place was packed! Luckily we had reservations. I've been meaning to try this place ever since I walked by and saw all the cool, trendy decor. It's definitely unique and fun! 

Overall, I thought the food was just okay. The star dish was the taco tropical, which probably just made the other dishes average...  We were pretty disappointed with the crab croquetas which just tasted like mashed potatoes... 

Service was just okay also. We were ignored practically the whole night and it took forever before a server even acknowledged us and took our order. I'd say lolo is a really cool venue, but meh, I probably wouldn't go out of the way to come back and eat here again.
author: Janet H.

description: Should try for the nice Ambience and Decent food. Portion sizes are slightly on the smaller side
author: Devansh D.

description:
I LOVE Lolò! This is my go-to any time I'm in the Mission. It can be super crowded, but if you come during off hours on the weekend or don't mind grabbing a drink while you wait for a table, it's totally worth it. Trust me.

First, the service is always great and quick. Sometimes the drinks take awhile, but that's only because they're not easy to make. The servers are on top of things and the bus boys always keep the chips and water flowing. My favorite dishes are the avocado tacos, tacos tropical, ceviche (although it is Mexican ceviche, so not quite as good as Peruvian, but still fresh and tasty) and Brussels sprouts. You can't go wrong with any of these. I also recently tried the grilled octopus and would highly recommend it because it's super tender and grilled perfectly! If you can, make a reservation a few weeks in advance and come hungry. You won't be disappointed.
author: Steph L.

description:
Always such an added bonus when you can make a reservation for weekend brunch! We were seated immediately and someone came by to take our order. We shared the tacos tropical, which was certainly worth the buzz. They were so good with a great combination of ingredients! Then I had the chilaquiles which were good, although I thought they could have done a little more to make the dish more flavorful and interesting. 
I docked one star because I felt like the service went progressively downhill. Our coffees never came and our server didn't check on us during the meal so we couldn't mention it until we had to ask him to remove it from the bill. And we had to flag someone down for a water refill. They have a lot of food runners that keep the meal moving but it would've nice to be checked in on. 
But I'd definitely come back, the food is well thought out and I'd like to try some of the other offerings.
author: Gloria N.

description: Went here for dinner. The tuna tacos rock!!!! We ordered about 6-8 items off the menu. All the dishes were great. The Drinks were strong and had a wide variety of Spanish liquor. If you are looking for a tapas fix in a casual atmosphere this is the place to go. Will definitely visit again.
author: Akshay B.

description: I loved the cornbread and the drinks (v inventive and complementary). But I absolutely hated the tight quarters (my butt barely fit on the chair!). The food was delicious and I wish the space was larger, but it still earns the stars.
author: Caitlin P.

description:
I really wanted to like this place for a casual birthday celebration but it was pretty mediocre. 

Only available reservation for a Saturday was at 3pm, but we decided that's good enough for a table of 5 on short notice. So plan accordingly! 
We arrived early as were not from the city and didn't know how bad traffic and parking would be. We weren't able to be seated so we walked around the cute shops nearby. 
We got seated to a corner spot that normally sits 4 people comfortably, but we had 5 so it was kinda odd to squish 3 people on one side. Especially since we had reservations, I expected a better table. 
This place isn't that big but not the smallest either. Decorated with probably the most random things you could find around the house and to put it nicely, it's interesting.. personally, I'm not a fan. 
Lets get down to grubbin! We ordered the guacamole to start and it was alright, it needed more seasoning. I honestly liked the free starter salsa they provided more. 
We then had the ceviche (yummm, if you love seafood, probably one of my favorite), the chilaquiles (soggy nachos), kale salad (too sour), taco tropical (not your average taco, pretty tasty), tuna tacon (average), avocado taco, grilled beef tacos (beef was very flavorful), and ended with the croissant French toast (which was delicious but very soggy because croissants soak oil). 

Overall, the food is alright, worth a try once, but it's too pricey for average food. 
Be prepared to leave smelling like the place.
author: Vence M.

description:
The only items okay for ordering were the top sirloin and the beef tacos. Everything else failed to impress. This included the pork belly, ceviche, flautas, and some special dish they had for the night.

Aside from them forgetting to put in our octopus order, the service was pretty good and fast. One drink at the bar and a table opened up, so not too long of a wait for a thursday night.
author: Phi N.

description: My son, daughter and I planned in a day in the City visiting a few antique stores and the Botanical Garden.  We did not plan ahead to make lunch reservations, which I would recommend on Saturday, but we stopped by Lolo's around 1:15pm and they indicated it would be about 30 minutes wait.  We walked around the neighborhood for about 15 minutes and then returned to the restaurant and we ended up getting what we thought was the best table in the restaurant, a booth and window seat.  The wait staff could not have been nicer and the food was excellent.  We ordered from a brunch menu, we ordered the Kale salad, huevos ranchos  and the carnitas.  The portions were very large, well displayed and were all exceptional. They also have a good selection of wines and beer and some cocktails.  The place was really packed so I would recommend reservations.  We can't wait to return.
author: renee m.

description: Delicious Chilaquiles and heirloom tomato toast. Excellent and attentive servers who seem to read your minds. Only docking a star since it's pricey, but a good brunch spot. Looks like the bartenders were making tasting drinks
author: Ben S.

description: If I'm going to pay eight bucks for a street taco, this is the place I'm going to do it! It's a fun room, with great decor and an all-day party vibe. Service is adequate, prices are off the chain, and the food is off the chain.
author: Stuart M.
Miko B.

description:
I was looking for a light dinner and perhaps a few cocktails, so I decided to pay a visit to Loló. It was early in the evening and I was alone, so I was able to get a seat at the bar, although I've been here before with more people and had to wait for 45 minutes.

I'm currently going through a shishito pepper phase, so I decided to give those a try, along with the calamari and octopus sope. Loló specialises in small-ish plates, but the portions were generous and fairly priced. The shishitos were a bit under-fried and under-salted, but the sope were delicious.

And now onto the cocktails. I sampled the Two Birds One Coupe and the Bengal Mutiny, both of which were fantastic. The Two Birds One Coupe was a great starter since it wasn't too sweet, and the use of curry in the Bengal Mutiny was fantastic. Plus, the bartenders were very attentive.
author: Jillian K.

description:
Loló never disappoints! Best tequila and mezcal cocktails in SF.  This mission gem has a friendly staff and cool vibe.

The food is modern Mexican, fresh and full of flavor.

You need reservations! Or you can stand and drink for two hours...and wait for a table!  

I love this place...the only reason I haven't Yelped before is its so popular I don't think it needs the business!

Parking is a challenge so just walk or take a lyft.
author: Deedee C.

description:
I was slightly disappointed by the food and drinks. I went during brunch on a Sunday. It was decently busy around the time I went. They got one of our orders mixed up, but they took care of it immediately. 

 I got the tuna tacon, which I thought was delicious, but my boyfriend got the chilaquiles and he thought they were subpar. 

We each got a drink and mine was almost difficult to drink; it was not the best-tasting (I got the Lorenita). My boyfriend got a michelada, which he liked. 

It wasn't terrible, but I probably would not go back for brunch because of the pricing and quality of food.
author: Melissa C.

description: Cool vibe, good cocktails, reasonably priced. I would skip the fried avocado tacos next time but their meatballs were delicious! Reservation highly suggested. I'd go back again!
author: Maddie B.

description: Great atmosphere and food located in the heart of the Mission! We stayed on 20th and Valencia for 2 weeks and found ourselves visiting four times since we enjoyed it so much! Great wine selection and we loved their guacamole and chicken tinga dish! Gluten free friendly and great service! We will definitely be back again!
author: Courteney M.

description:
In a word, amazing! Yes, it's a scene and yes it's hipster, but the food is truly amazing and the staff is the secret sauce. I, for one, believe that people respond to positivity and big smiles! They were warm and inviting and truly proud to work there. In fact, one of the owners was serving and came up to say hello and thanks for coming in. Now the menu:

Brussels 
Crab croquettes 
Birria sliders 
Calamari & octopus gorditas
Tropical (shrimp) tacos 
Taquitos
Flan

The cocktails were original and tasty- the zombie is the bomb and the sangria has a hint of hibiscus that is super refreshing. The peyote IPA is from Baja and is a great refresher. 

The taquitos brought me back to being a kid in San Jose and the shrimp tacos were tasty has hell! 

The decor is super cool and the music adds to the lively business. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation.

They have 3 resturaunts in Mexico so they know what they are doing! We will be back for sure. One of the best 'fusion' Mexican joints in SF!!
author: Lorenzo R.

description:
** BE SURE TO CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD RECEIPT!! **

Food and service aside, I have a huge problem with the business ethics my friend and I encountered since dining here last week.  I usually don't look at my restaurant receipts too closely after dining out, but when I checked my credit card statement, I noticed something was "off" with the final amount Lolo's charged onto my cc.  Someone added more tips on top of what I had written on my receipt!!  I can understand if this was a simple human error and a few keys were punched in wrong when closing out our tab, but to my surprised, it happened to my GF's cc as well!  Something VERY fishy happened to both our credit cards and as much I would like to give the person the benefit of the doubt, this seems more intentional than accidental.  Since we split the bill and both of our credit cards were charged, I mentioned my discovery to my GF and when she checked her cc statement, her final amount did not add up to what she put on her receipt either.  We both tipped accordingly and while service was lacking (we had to ask 4 different people for hot water), we did not discount any of the tips to our server(s).  

While the extra amounts added without our permission were minimal and just a few dollars more, it is the principal that we have issues with.  We certainly understand that good help is hard to find and servers should be compensated fairly for their service but no customer should ever have to triple check their receipts because someone tried to take advantage of a situation.  Something so minimal can easily be overlooked and even if it was just an extra $1 added to every cc transaction that evening, the total can add up to a couple of hundreds of $$ extra in tips.  It's unfortunate that this happened to us but we really hope it does not happen to any other patrons that dine here.

Had this incident not happened, we would have probably given Lolo's another try again, at least for their dessert (the tiramisu is delicious!) but this will most likely be both our first and last time here.  Such a shame too since the GF I was with that evening is the Controller of another restaurant in the city and she enjoys the food scene as much as I do.  She was excited to try out Lolo's since it's been such a strong standing fixture in the Mission and while the food was mediocre + on the pricier end for their portions, we were still hopeful to come back and try other dishes on their menu.  However, this incident has left a bad taste in our mouths.  If you plan on dining here and will be using your cc, please make sure to check your statement to ensure it matches up to the amount on your receipt.
author: Janetto L.

description:
My friend and I randomly stumbled upon this place on a Saturday night after having spent the day hanging out in the area. We put our name down around 6:30 and waited about 30 minutes for a table. We were lucky because after we sat down a lot more groups of people came and had to wait for tables. The hostess told us we had to leave in an hour because there were reservations for later in the evening but we ended up staying for around 2.5 hours and didn't get asked to leave early. 

The food is sort of a modern American take on Mexican cuisine. The décor here is really interesting. There's a mish mash of objects hanging on the walls and there's a lot of bright colors and prints.

Now onto the more important stuff!

Mushroom Empanadas: The flavor was good and the outer layer was fried well. 

Brussel Sprouts: This was my favorite dish out of everything we ordered that night. It was the perfect balance of flavor and crispiness. I couldn't stop eating these.

Shrimp Tacos and Fish Tacos: I remember both of these dishes being good but nothing out of the ordinary. 

Tortilla soup- this dish was the most disappointing one we ordered. It was way too thick to be a soup and was more like a dipping sauce. We barely touched this dish.
author: Mai Y.

description:
I booked this place for my anniversary dinner and I wanted a place with good drinks and food. Every appetizer is so tasty with lots of flavors. 2 of us ended up ordering 5 appetizers, was not able to get over it :)

Drinks were good too and so as server.
author: Rupali M.

description: We ate here a few weeks ago and I never got around to Getting on yelp and posting the review. This is a great little Spanish tapas place. Very friendly and warm staff
author: Jordan C.

description: Great place to get dinner and drinks at the bar. I always order the tacos tropical. Their specialty cocktails are a must!
author: Anne S.

description:
The taco tropical was so freaken amazing!!! I nearly died eating this! Soooooo freaken good! I also had the Mezcale  mule which was so delicious. This place was so good, I almost went back again The next day. Tacos are expensive...about 9 bucks for two. But they are really goood. We made reservation so we were seated right away. Definitely make reservations, it gets busy quick!

Fish tacos are good too.
author: Caitlin P.

description:
So the Mission is bursting with small plate joints and while there are some great options to get your tapas on, Lolo es mi favorito! 

Ambiance- The decor is eclectic and colorful. From the bicycle handlebar light fixtures, the paper boats wallpaper, a wall of plastic dog chihuahuas, and pom pom ball light shades. It;s a bit loud, and dim, and crowded, but honestly that;s the norm for most SF restaurants.

Drinks- While they have a full bar, agave based drinks are their specialty. Mezcal lovers will be overjoyed with their cocktail list. The Fresh Prince is a pisco passion fruit drink that I really enjoyed. The classic marg was solid as well.

Food- I have only been here twice and I left with such a happy and full tummy. The ceviche comes topped with these tasty corn nuts and the diablo shrimp has a creamy dreamy sauce that cannot be missed! I am not ashamed to admit that I dreamed once about the panko avocado tacos. I don't think you can order poorly here. And when in doubt, just ask the staff!

Service- Family owned business with smiley servers and bartenders. No qualms here. They even added an extra taco so that our party of three could each have one. 

Just know that both times I came here and every time I walk by during dinner hours it is PACKED. Rezzies are not required but definitely recommended.
author: Miriam M.

description:
There's no "WE" in food.

But, I'll share since you're paying. Buahaha! Puahaha! Muahaha!

We started off with the Mezcal Mule; I'm a fan of Mezcal so this was a two thumbs up. Next, gin and tonic can't stir you wrong. Finally, the sangria is a MUST!! 

Bites to share:

- Panko avocado taco: Oaxaca cheese, caramelized onions and pepper. Yum!

- Tuna tacon: seared albacore tuna, avocado, roasted tomatillo sauce on flour tortillas. 

- Crab croquetas: garlic aioli, mirasol pepper reduction was an excellent starter. 

- Ceviche: I am a ceviche type of gal. I love the shrimp and rockfish citrus with roasted pepper sauce, corn and avocado.

 An unexpected great find with quirky decoration and fun ambiance. I recommend going here with a group of friends to enjoy the variety of small plates that they offer. Plus, they have such a fun and knowledgeable staff. 

I hope you give this fun tapas place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: Great drinks and small bites, and AMAZING DECOR! It is a bit upscale, so pricey for what you get but A+ Atmosphere minus tables being so close....would be back for sure.
author: Ellie J.

description: Great food will be back. Great service although a little busy at times. Definitely five stars in my book
author: Dominos P.

description: I was impressed by the food and cocktails. I am a vegetarian and there were many small plate dishes for me. Also, the guacamole was delicious. I appreciated that the Brussels sprouts were not overly oily, as they often are prepared at other restaurants. In all, it was a great meal. It was fairly expensive, but that was due to the cocktails.
author: Susan T.

description:
Two really good things about Lolo - the food is delicious, and it is priced just right.

Two things it could do to raise it's average above 4 Stars (the average for an average San Francisco restaurant) - organize the menu by size, small plates and large plates, and upgrade the beer and wine choices. 

I'll be back, anticipating another good meal, and hopefully be able to give Lolo the 5 Stars the food deserves.
author: Cliff L.

description: Food was delicious. Kale salad portion was huge. Would definitely recommend the Brussels sprouts and pork belly. The only reason I give 4 stars is cause I was not a fan of their cocktail selection
author: Paula M.

description:
Good ambiance, nice drinks and great food. The wait on weekend can be a little tiring. Service is very prompt though. Drinks are STRONG. Worth the buck. Food was received very quick .. like 10 mins. Husband and I ordered carnitas tacos to share. They came to build on your own. I absolutely loved the thick corn tortillas. So not the pre made type. The meat was tender and the pickled condiments with the tacos were-great. (I am all about the taco condiments) 
Lastly we ordered a flan for dessert which was good too. 

Will come back for more. Glad we finally tried the place after livjng a few blocks away.
author: Shital R.

description:
I love this place. The food, drinks and ambience are all on point.

Guacamole
Fried Brussels Sprouts 
Ceviche
Pablo Avocado Tacos
Grilled octopus
Flan for dessert

It's all yummy! Margarita and the Mezcal mule also rocked.
author: Karen G.

description:
The hostess is a heaux. We arrived 20mins early for our reservation; she told us to come back at our seating time (totally fine). Waited 20 mins, our seating time came and went, and weren't seated for 15 more minutes. HANGRY!! 

The food was fine; we got the following:
-tortilla chips (tasty!)
-Shishito peppers
-guacamole (small, but fine) 
-Panko avocado tacos (meh)
-kale salad (yummy)
-empanadas (delicious)
-mushroom quesadillas (the masa tortilla was very good)
-Brussels sprouts (delicious)
-margaritas (great)
author: Glinda P.

description: One of the best fish tacos I've ever had. The Jicama tortilla was delicious! Make sure you reserve seating online!
author: Bryant E.

description: Nice restaurant, highly recommend to get the grilled octopus and pair with the house margarita
author: Tob S.

description: Good food, fun eclectic atmosphere, friendly and attentive service.  The food was good but I was expecting the it to have a little more wow and pop in flavor given the Latin theme.  The drinks were on point.
author: Sean N.

description:
Made reservations here for a Friday night and so glad we did - the place was packed! I've heard so many great things about this place, and was so excited to try everything. 

My friend and I ordered fish tacos, seared pork belly, and lamb sliders - everything was SO good. I honestly thought I'd still be hungry after everything, but it was the perfect amount! The chips that they give out probably fills ya up a bit, but decent portions! Sliders were by far my favorite - the meat was juicy and the mushroom sauce was full of flavor. 

Definitely want to come back and try their brunch!
author: Carrie L.

description: Was surprised that a place could be so crowded on a Monday night. Was able to get a seat at the bar after a few minutes wait. They offer complementary nachos and dip. I ordered the Diablo shrimp which made me realize why this place is so popular. The shrimps were soft and the curry was rich and flavorful. Presentation of the dish made it even more appetizing. I left the place feeling pretty content that I chose a really nice dinner spot.
author: Niloy G.

description:
It was Sunday afternoon, so we had the brunch menu.  Too bad, because the lunch/dinner menu looks pretty enticing.

So we brunched it up with the following:

AVOCADO TOAST (2/5)  Our waitress convinced us to get this.  Without seeing the details on the menu, we agreed to order it.  It looked good but it wasn't.  Two things that messed up this dish.  First, it was overloaded with lemon.  Just overwhelmingly so.  You couldn't taste the avocado.  And second, there was smoked fish mixed in with the avocado which was an UNpleasant surprise.  I think it was smoked herring.  Wasn't a good combo for me, and like I mentioned, the lemon was just murdering the avocado.  If you're a lemon head and you like smoked herring, this might be your dish.  But it sure ain't mine.

CHILIQUILLES (4/5)  So, we're talking 2 eggs with chips and salsa verde.  The chips were warm and almost tasted like caramelized potato slices after they soaked a bit in the salsa and eggs.  Nothing wrong with this dish.  Would order again.

TUNA TACON (4/5)  Seared tuna dish, small portion, but tasty and good enough for an appetizing bite or two.

BEEF TACOS (4/5)  My wife's dish.  She liked them a lot but complained about the overpowering lemon flavor even in the taco (it must have been the guacamole on the taco).

I'm almost sure I would have a better experience if we were ordering from the lunch/dinner menu.  The Pistachio Salmon on that menu is calling my name.  I'd def like to come back and give the other menu a shot.
