Seating was a bit tight space-wise.  I didn't like that.

Service was good.  And the decor and wall art was pretty amazing and unique - several car doors were lined up along the back wall (yes, I wrote car doors), men's suit coats were lined up, and plastered against the front entry wall.  

Can you even picture that?  Probably not.  I should have taken a picture.
author: Darien R.

description: Great cocktails. Excellent quesa fundido and amazong tropical taco. Skip the birria sliders.
author: Romain D.

description:
I really wanted to love this place so let me start with the cons and then I'll tell you some pros. 

Cons:
So crowded - made a reservation for 2 and arrived on time and still had to wait 15 minutes just to be seated with a two person table legitimately 1 inch away from the tables on both sides. This seems like a popular date spot but if you are on an awkward first day it's not gonna be any less awkward with random strangers sitting on top of you. 

Service - not very attentive and I'm normally oblivious to that stuff. Our waitress was incredibly dry and took our menus away without asking if we were done ordering (it is tapas so you normally do multiple rounds but she took our menu away after round 2) 

The food- guacamole was great, carnitas was great. The special of the night was a tlayuda so essentially a flatbread with beans, chorizo, cheese, and avocado and it was bland and stale. I thought an off menu special of the night would be tasty and I didn't want more than 2 bites. 

Overall really glad I made a res instead of a walk in, the vibe of the place was trendy and cool and I think sitting at the bar could be fun but just wasn't impressed.
author: Lauren W.

description:
Lolo is a Mexican - Californian (Kale!) fusion restaurant in the heart of San Francisco's Mission district.  A fun place to go with a bigger party and eat family style.
Portions are bigger than most places.
 Picks:
Complimentary chips.

Fried Brussel Sprouts shallots, hazelnuts, late harvest zinfandel vinaigrette - Were done right and pretty big.

Jicima Salad ($10) with citrus garlic and mint vinagrette, cucumbers, sunflower seeds - Refreshing and massive.  Low key dressing

Seared Pork Belly ($16)  mint, fennel, cilantro, red onion salad topped with curried peanuts and kalamata flakes - A little overcooked, but still tasty and fatty!

Grilled Beef Tacos ($12 for 2) onions, hand-made flour tortillas, avocado, habanero sauce - One of the better dishes of the night. Lots of meat.

Grilled Octopus ($28) garlic and paprika adobo, purple potato puree, arugula and kalamata oil - Also a great must get.  Very big portion. Cook puree.


Just OK:
Mojito - A little overdone.

Would not reorder:
None

Overall - Very Good
Food - Very Good
Decor - Very Good
Service - Very Good
Value - Good

Would we come back - Maybe
author: Ellen H.

description:
Amazing amazing amazing food. 

We ordered avocado Taco (out of the world), Avocado toast, and chilaquiles. Everything was perfect. 

Also, service was amazing as well. 

Coming back again!
author: Aaggrim S.

description:
I'm not sure why others are mentioning happy hour: I went last night and immediately asked for a happy hour menu and the bartenders said they don't have a happy hour. 
The sangria was good, but not sure it was enough (in amount) or strong enough to warrant $13/glass. The food and service was pretty good, but I was expecting a cheaper price tag since I was hoping for a real happy hour deal. Regardless, the place was nice, but I'm kind of over the price tags of so many places in the Bay, and the Mission.
author: Sara N.

description:
Always an easy choice for great dinner when out-of-towners are visiting.

RESERVATIONS: Made a few days in advance at 9pm on Thursday for three. There wasn't anything earlier available. 

COST: $163.73 before tip for 4 cocktails, 2 salads, 4 dinner plates, 1 dessert. A very filling dinner for three!

MUST-HAVES: The Fresh Prince (honestly I've loved SO MANY of their cocktails!!), Fish taco, Coconut ice cream (a dessert special, one that I almost missed. Look for a tiny chalk board to the left of the cupboards above the bar). See my pics for additional details!

COCKTAILS
* The Fresh Prince (Capurro Pisco, passion fruit, lime, egg white, orange blossom water. Served up. $11) - 4.5 stars
Delicioso! Love the texture of the egg white, the refreshing tart flavor of this drink. Incredibly well balanced. 

* El Puñal (San Juan del rio mezcal, aperol, poppy liqueur, almond syrup, lime. Served up. $11) - 4.5 stars
My bf thoroughly enjoyed this, and plus it's a gorgeous drink with the flower petals on top!

SALADS
* Beet salad (beets, candied kumquats, crumbled feta & toasted coconut w/ blood orange vinaigrette. $8) - 4 stars
Nicely done, sharpness of kumquats was nice!

* Corn esquites (butter, cotija cheese, crema, lime, piquin, epazaote. $6) - 4 stars
Also great, loved the mixture of spice, sweetness, sour, and the fattiness of the butter/crema to bind it all together.

DINNER
* Fish taco (rock cod fried in tempura, handmade corn tortilla, habanero, crema, peanuts & piquin pepper sauce. $15 for three) - 4.5 stars
My bf would argue to give this 5 stars. Granted the fish & tortillas are amazing. It's just got a little TOO much topping for me, making it just slightly inconvenient to eat (drips everywhere, etc.). The sauce is fantastic too, adds a nice tartness.

* Mezcal barbacoa beef rib gorditas (over organic masa, sour cream, pickled onions. 3 pcs $20.50) - 3.5 stars
Meat is tasty but a tad on the dry side. The masa is a like a crisped sopa. Overall flavors not as complex as other dishes here.

* Grilled octopus (marinated in garlic & paprika adobo, puple potato puree, arugula & kalamata oil. $25) - 4.5 stars
As tender, meaty, and amazing as last time!

* Diabla shrimp (creamy & spicy cascabel & chipotle pepper sauce, bacon, white mushroom,s white rice. $19) - 4 stars
Great sauce, love how thick and rich it is. The shrimp is crunchy. Rice was a tad dry. 

DESSERT
Coconut ice cream (special, $7) -  5 stars
Creamy ice cream, loved the toasted coconut for added crunch. The cookie was incredibly soft & warm. Amazing!
author: Ziyan C.

description: One of my favorite taco places, the food is amazing and they have a jimaca taco that is heaven.  The atmosphere is great but it is popular so make sure to get there early or make a reservations.
author: Anna T.

description: I've been there more than 10 times! Amazing service and food! You must try the taco tropical!
author: Mily M.

description: Went on a Saturday night with my boyfriend, we were seated right away but groups 2+ had to wait. The service was incredibly fast; we received our food within 10-15 minutes of being seated. The waitress was very nice. We tried the fried avocado taco which was DELICIOUS. We also tried the carne asada, which wasn't as good. The meat was extremely rare and didn't looked like it was cooked enough. It's also pretty expensive, but the food is overall great and so is the service. I saw other tables order the elote which looked delicious. Can't wait to come back and try other dishes! The picture is of the fried avocado tacos!
author: Courtney A.

description:
Love this place! Everything about Lolo just flawlessly works. 

First, the cocktails: I had the two birds one stone which is basically a green juice with alcohol in it and a celery salt rim. The flavors all work really well together and it's a very refreshing, unique drink. 

Second, the food: can't go wrong with anything! We were a group of 3 and way over-ordered, so I would say that, when perusing the menu of insanely delicious looking options, to be mindful that the tapas portions here are pretty generous. Standout items were the roasted Brussels sprouts and the beef tacos, which were both bursting with flavor. The carnitas was also excellently cooked, crispy on the outside yet melts in your mouth. 

Third, the ambience: the décor is warm and inviting and is in keeping with the Latin-inspired food. It would work equally well for a date or with friends. It is a little loud. The service is great, friendly, helpful and efficient without rushing. Prices are high but worth it. I'll be back for sure!
author: Christine G.

description:
OMG tuna tacon, avocado tacos and shrimp tacos are SO GOOD!!! I've been here 8+ times and those items, plus some of their other seasonal seafood dishes, are crazy flavorful. 

Not everything is stellar, but since portions are small, you're not stuck with those for long. :) Some meh dishes included a squid ink corn disk thing that sat in my stomach like a brick and a crab with avocado dish that looked pretty but tasted like a north beach tourist trap. 

Ask the waiters for the good stuff- they should be able to direct you to them (and also some yummy cocktails)!
author: Jean L.

description:
This is a very cool place. I was with a friend at S.F and looked for a cool place to eat in S.F. so naturally I checked yelp and this was on the top 10 lists which also seemed great for vegetarians. 
We arrived around 8 pm on Sat. night and it was all booked up (be smart reserve in advance) But the place had such a great vibe so we went to eat and drink a little in a near by location and returned around 10 when it had space so we mostly drank at Lolo. 
If you want a cool place with an amazing vibe , very trendy that serves quality drinks this is it !
author: Tomer N.

description: Never do I get to eat so many flavorful dishes without worrying about dairy! I went here for iftar with friends on a Friday and it definitely has an intimate bar vibe but it's chill enough to chat still. The guacamole is good, the peppers are good, the brusselsprouts  are decent - I like mine a lil softer generally but flavor is good and lots of charring outside which is yummy, the fish tacos are very good in fact I asked for more if the peanut sauce it comes with, and I walked away entirely too full to move! Can't wait to try their brunch!
author: Sarah Y.

description: Drinks were amazing! Food was pretty good too. Make a reservation if you can. My Party and I didn't have one but the host was very accommodating and friendly. She made it work.
author: Tai S.

description:
This is in my top 5 favorite restaurants - I dream about their food and crave it often! They have interesting decor using bicycle handles, buckets, porcelain dogs, old suit jackets - it's pretty unique.

The food is incredible! Highly recommend the Tacos Tropical, Panko Avocado Tacos and Ceviche! They serve this on the brunch/lunch and dinner menu. On the brunch menu only, you have to order the crossiant French toast.. you won't regret it.

Their drinks are delicious - everything has a little twist to it and they incorporate a lot of mezcal. 

The only downside is that it's really hard to take walk ins and better to just make a reservation. It's also hard to get a  reservation for more than a party of 6 but that's because the restaurant is small and narrow but this has never stopped me and I'll continue to go over and over again!
author: Alexandra W.

description:
I'm in love with the LoLo, I don't need no CoCo!?!
Been meaning to try this place for quite some time now and I finally got that chance recently.  First off I love the atmosphere inside LoLo, it's got that Netflix and chill vibe if you know what I mean!?!  Highly recommend you make reservations for this place as the wait time is usually an hour or more on busy nights.  This is also a perfect spot to bring a date as the lighting is dark, the drinks are strong, and makes 7's look like 9's and 10's!?!  If you didn't already know, this is a Tapas place so most of the food here is small plates, but like I always tell my playas quality over quantity!  Anywho let's breakdown some of the food I ordered:

Chips and Salsa (complementary) - the dark green sauce is must try, o so good! 
Brussel Sprouts - fried deliciousness, the only way I ever eat my veggies if they are fried...lol
Empanadas - so much flavor, the mushrooms and seasoning was unlike anything I've ever tasted.
Beef Gorditas - the Barboca was cooked to perfection.
Oxtail Tostadas - the meat was typical, nothing special
Bean Stew - overpriced and it wasn't very good
Taco Tropical - the shrimp and sauce was to die for in these tacos!

Now LoLo's isn't the greatest Tapas place I've been to, but I would definitely return to try more of their dishes.  I feel like this place caters for towards the Latin side of tapas, but the I'm kind of spoiled living in San Jose I get to taste the best tacos this side of the bay so I'm picky.  If you love modern tapas restaurants, you should definitely peep this place out!!!
author: Deep S.

description:
Good stuff, but definitely short of greatness.  Food and drinks menu both look great and are very creative.  The drinks themselves are great: good bartending.  The food was pretty good, but a bit hit-and-miss ... some options were really well made, others were merely good.

Quality of dishes was a bit low for the price.  I appreciated the creativity and new spins on familiar dishes, but the food just fell a bit short.  I'd go here again, but I'm not going to rush back -- the Mission is full of equal or better options that are cheaper.

Super loud.
author: Adam G.

description: Definitely adding this to my regular brunch rotation! First off, I was very into the space--it's hip, but not too serious. There were classic car doors on one wall, and paper boats on another. In terms of food, they give you chips and salsa right away; that's always a plus. I had an order of the taco tropical, which was delicious and super unique: tempura shrimp in a jicima tortilla. The tacos are more of a tapas dish, so order accordingly. I also had the croissant french toast, which was really good. It came with creme fraiche and fruit on the side, though I was a little disappointed with the presentation. I had a sangria to wash it all down, and though it was a bit fruit forward for my taste, it was still really good.
author: Benjamin A.

description: Great food very good service my friend had made a reservation didn't have to wait when we arrived!  My favorite drink was LOLITA
author: Gladys G.

description: The ambience is really cool. Shrimp tacos are absolutely delicious! The drinks could be better.
author: Chaitra K.

description: Have been here multiples times on dates, with friends and with family. I always order a spicy margarita and the tuna tacon (its a must try)! The tacos are delicious and the atmosphere is funky and quirky. Everything about this place has great personality and the food reflects that. There are a lot of trendy, expensive Mexican places in Sf but this one is special and always worth the wait.
author: Hadley B.

description:
This is among my top picks for four or six person group dinners in the Mission. 

Price point is pretty reasonable and portion size can be easily adjusted based on how hungry different people are at the table. Many of the highlight foods (tuna tacon, the tacos) come in twos so if you're a group of three, there is the awkward "who eats the last one" that I think is more easily avoided at Asian communal style eating. 

Very good diversity of vegetarian and gluten free options if you have "those" people in your party. (Friends of mine who fit this category: you know I love you.)

Little bummed the drink prices jumped from $10-11 to $14-16 - but hey, I guess all is fair in love and SF rent prices?

Reservations definitely recommended; waits are pretty long if you don't have one.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Brunch!!! Chilaquiles was amazing & chile verde pork butt is super tasty! Will definitely come back again
author: Melissa B.

description: This is my "go to" for great Mexican in SF -- casual and lively this place always delivers great food and drinks -- the Carnitas are  excelente (seriously order them). Margaritas are fresh made and it's hard not to have more than one
author: Darryl N.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE.  Every bite of everything I've had there has been delicious, fresh, beautiful. I've sampled many dishes but some favorites are: the guacamole, brussel sprouts,  queso fundido, panko avocado taco, empanadas, chicken tinga tostadas, AND my fav: taco tropical.  Makes me hungry just to write about it.

The service is great, the atmosphere is lovely, the presentation of the food is beautiful. . . .I have been back many times since my first visit last year- it's definitely a new SF favorite!

My only complaint is that they aren't open for LUNCH or on Mondays!!!  
 : )
author: Hoo.asked. U.

description: Such a cool atmosphere! We ordered the avocado tacos, pork belly, ceviche and the empanadas. Without a doubt the ceviche again- it was amazing. If you've ever had an avocado taco, you know the texture can be way off but These were great- awesome flavor and texture (crunchy and smooth). I could live without the pork belly and the empanadas weren't anything super special. Overall, awesome place. Especially if you don't know what you're in the mood for! Not a huge menu but big enough to satisfy whatever you're craving. The hardest part is deciding how hungry you are because everything on he menu sounded delicious.
author: Amanda P.

description:
I like this place because it's open late and serves food that isn't hamburgers or pizza at 1am. I come here on nights I'm in the city and don't want to go on a hunt for late night food on the weekend. The place is cute, the food is good, and the drinks are great. 
I really like how many cocktails they have and the attention to detail on their drinks, the bartenders are attentive and you can tell they take their drinks seriously. The ceviche is good, but I wish they'd give more chips. That's pretty much how I feel about the whole place, the food is decent, but the quantity is lacking. My friend had the steak and must have came with one tortilla. She loved that they were handmade so she asked for more and they charged us. It's pretty expensive given what you're eating; tacos and such, but I'd still go there over Mel's or some other dinner food for late night. I've never been in the day time so I can't speak  to that. My review is for late night dining.
author: Selina K.

description:
Update: I have now been to Loló multiple times for dinner, and have quickly found their dinner service to far surpass their brunch! Amazing seafood, amazing drinks. Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in SF! I recommend it to all of my friends, family, coworkers, random people...

Here are the dishes I have found to be their most interesting and my favorites, in order of appearance on the menu:

- Taco tropical
- Tuna tacon
- Seared pork belly salad
- Calamari and octopus gorditas (I order this every time)
- Grilled octopus (I also order this every time - I have a squid and octopus obsession)

Other than those listed above, I've had the flautas, beef tacos, carnitas, ceviche, guacamole, and fried brussel sprouts. You really can't go wrong with any of it, everything is very high quality, awesome flavors, I just find the list of my 5 favorites to be the most unique and interesting for my tastes.

All the meat and seafood is tender (which is very hard to achieve with octopus particularly), and it at least tastes fresh (I have no idea if they use frozen or fresh, but it's all prepped amazingly well).
author: Kristen T.

description: Overall it's a nice dining experience, the decoration of the restaurant is absolutely creative and beautiful. Food is delicious, really recommend their tropical tacos. However, one small part of disappointment is the portion of the food is slightly small, but overall i enjoyed my meal
author: Tiffany T.

description:
I went here for brunch, and was victim to terrible service. The waiter was slow to acknowledge my table's presence, and asked if we wanted appetizers. The brunch menu did not have a section labeled "appetizers" or anything close, just "brunch". We ordered an appetizer (Shishito Peppers) before ordering our main meal, and it took a while for that simple (minimal preparation) dish to be served.

When we were finally served, the waiter took our order for main dishes...accept for mine. He assumed I wasn't going to order anything (from eavesdropping on our conversation, when I said "I wasn't super hungry"), and walked away after he took the other orders at my table; so I had to flag him down. From there, it took about 35-40 minutes for our food to come out. We asked another waiter/server about the status of our food, and the food came out shortly. The food served was cold, the fried shrimp in the tacos and the potato mesh on the side of the egg sandwich. 

After we were served, no one stopped by to check-in at our table, asking how the food was, etc.. The waiter did stop by to pour our water again, but did not say anything. The fastest service we received was from the busboy, who circled the restaurant like a hawk. As soon as I finished my last bite, he swooped in to clear my plate. This was fine, but it seemed like we were being rushed. The waiter was also quick to drop off the bill, but only dropped off the bill. Again, did not ask about our meal, or offer a dessert or additional drink option; nothing.

We were all disappointed with the food and service. As we clearly had no familiarity with the menu, it would've been helpful if the waiter pointed out "these are the appetizers", and give some guidelines on portion sizes. If he overheard me say I wasn't that hungry, he should've heard the other two at my table say they were starving. The egg sandwich was a good portion, but the Taco Tropical dish was quite small. The poor service impacted our ability to enjoy the food, which tasted fine I suppose, but this was a very bad first impression.
author: Maxx M.

description:
Unlike Tacolicious who had to pay $900,000 in court settlements because they abused their workers. They were denied meal and rest breaks and had their wages improperly withheld

But this little gem is owned by a Mexican woman, not a corporation like other places. I met her when she was helping decorate the restaurant, she's very nice and welcoming. 

The place has great food, ambiance, and decor....... going there is just so much fun!
Nothing like a good Mexican restaurant, with that Latin flavor and energy to ease the days.
author: Sara J.

description:
We made 6:30 Thursday evening reservations weeks in advance for a party of five. We were running late, but in an Uber en route to the restaurant. Per common courtesy, we called before our reservation time to let the hostess know we were running late but on our way. The hostess let us know if we were any more than 15 minutes late our table would be given away and hung up the phone. She never asked for the reservation name or number in our party. We arrived before our 15 minute cut off and it will took 5 minutes to be seated at our table (two tables put together that we barley fit into).  

Each of us ordered an alcoholic drink as well as 3 appetizers to share. After we had finished our drinks and appetizers we had to flag down the hostess to order our main course. Overall, the food was ok, but nothing worth the price being charged. The margaritas were to put it bluntly...absolutely terrible. Strong and bitter. Hands down the worst margarita I've ever tasted. 

Halfway through our dinner, the waiter came to check up on us and we asked for another round of drinks (no margaritas this time). We waited quite a while, but finally got our drinks and a few minutes later our check. As we had just got our drinks we did not pay the bill, and the waiter came over again to move our bill to the middle of the table (a sign of asking us to leave). 

Overall, we were never asked for our main course order, slow drink orders, terrible margaritas, and then were rushed to pay our bill and get out (full restaurant but not wait line). Service was garbage and I will not be back.
author: Sierra L.

description:
Not a pleasant visit this time around,
Had a table for three, and ended up waiting an hour an a half when hostess estimated 30 minutes. Hostess was not really friendly and kinda brushed us off when we asked for the wait time. 
We sat at the bar while we waited for our table. The male Bartender wasn't friendly as well!? Which became even more annoying as the night progressed. 
We finally got our table and took awhile for us to order but that's ok, the food is worth the wait. 
We got the 
tropical tacos
Carnitas/pork belly tacos 
Ceviche 
Octopus/ squid gorditas 
Diabla shrimp
The gorditas was hard to eat.. None of us really ate that dish, the masa had a fishy after taste and the masa itself was way too thick. The octopus and avocado on top were tasty tho.. And....... The dish came out looking like dark poo, in my opinion. 
The tropical tacos & diabla shrimp was my favorite!! The taco had a crispy, fresh jicama "tortilla" which was fun, delicious, and balanced great with the battered shrimp. 
The diabla shrimp was soooooooo good, it's kind of a hybrid.. Not really a soup but a real saucey dish. 
Ceviche is always delicious and fresh. 
Pork belly tacos were also very very good! 
Overall, I wouldn't wait 2+ hours for a table, so def make resos in advance. Also, the bar top isn't too bad if you do need to wait (they give you chips & salsa)
author: Maria C.

description: Not Impressed: Overpriced for poor customer service and unfriendly waitstaff.  Food was lacking in flavor, drink was terrible, and the bill was fat. Don't mind spending $$ if its worth it, but this place was less than desirable. not a fan.  Upside is the place is decorated cute!
author: Melissa C.

description: My go-to place in the city for brunch! I have not had a single item on the menu that I didn't like. Great food/drinks, fun decor, and friendly staff
author: Alisa A.

description: Very nice quirky interior, and delicious beautifully presented food. The portions could be bigger I think, but it's my personal choice. Me and my date were in a rush, so we didn't have a chance to explore the menu better and try the desserts. I wish we had more time! Very nice restaurant, would want to visit it again!
author: Aly B.

description:
This place ranks among the top restaurants I've stumbled upon in SF. My bf and I were looking for a late dinner place (10:30pm) and were wandering around Mission for a place to eat. We found Lolo on Yelp and were happy to find they had open seats!

The tacos are probably my favorite here. Probably can't go wrong with any of them. I think there was a hawaiian one where the taco "shell" is a thin piece of radish--my favorite. So unique and the ingredients just taste so fresh. We also got some other items but sadly I can't remember the names :( but basically anything we ordered was good! Mojito was also well-made. I need to go back!
author: Tiffany E.

description:
Loló's never fails! I had an especially great experience last night. My mom was in town for the night, had seen Check Please almost a year ago, and wanted to try Loló's. The only reservation was at 9:30pm, which is a bit late for her. Reservations are hard to get last minute, so I wrote a note asking for an earlier reservation if possible. Luckily the hostess (wish I remembered her name) sent a message saying there was an earlier time! 

We arrived early, but the hostess greeted us warmly and recommended the most delicious cocktails. Our reservation ran a bit later so she comped (is that the spelling?) us guacamole and chips. Dinner, as usual, tasted fresh and bursted with yummy flavors in my mouth. I highly recommend Loló's, and must try the Calamari and Octopus Sope! The best sope EVER!
author: Stephanie T.

description: This place is delicious day or night. Brunch the chiliquiles are great (wish they had chicken or streak). The tuna tacos are off the chart.  Friendly beautiful vibe to hang out with friends or romance
author: Sean H.

description:
All you need to know: fried. avocado. tacos. Seriously so good.

The other food I've had here is pretty tasty too, especially the shrimp tacos. They also have a rather extensive drink menu--will definitely be back to try some of the other cocktails! 

The vibe here is nice as well, with colorful decor. It's a good spot to take friends coming to visit SF, or for a date night.
author: Lauren T.

description:
I was really looking forward to my reservation based on yelp reviews. Decor is creative, (paper boats mural, metallic car door installation on back wall, chicken wallpaper in restroom wait area) festive and bright. With that much attention to decor I expected I would be overwhelmed by food flavor, but in the end I felt a bit cheated. 

Perhaps things started off a little poorly by the fact they waited too long to take my drink order. And then waited too long to take my food order. Especially when it was the start of the evening and the tables were just starting to fill up. 

Fresh Prince cocktail was ok. Grilled artichoke was cold. (The server did apologize and send it back and it was better 2nd time around). The grass fed beef taco was also just ok. Nothing flavorful enough to make me come back. 

Instead the overall experience made me wonder if I should have declined my restaurant reservation text an hour before my meal (although I did think that was a convenient option text 1 to confirm 3 to cancel). 

I did think the decor was a hoot - made me smile and puts you in the mood to celebrate, maybe it was just an off night but I think they should put a little more of the attention to detail in the kitchen.
author: Lisa D.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday night and it wasn't too crowded. I was seated right away. This place was super bomb! The food is a little on a pricy side but it's very well worth it. 

I started off with some chips and guacamole. I was super hungry so I was glad that it came out immediately. Then I got the carne asada. It came with half a chili pepper filled with cheese and chorizo. Very tasty. 

The service was also on point! The server was super nice and checked in every once in a while. Lastly, the vibe is pretty cool. Good place to come for a date or with a small group of friends.
author: Do P.

description:
We come to Loló for a late lunch on Sunday. Be aware, there is only a Brunch menu available. Even so, they had our favorites from their sister restaurant in Guadalajara, Mexico, Anita Li! 
Highly recommend Los Tacones (ahí tuna tacos with avocado, sweet and spicy sauce on a wheat tortilla) and the tacos de camarón (battered and lightly fried shrimp with mango salsa on a jicama tortilla)
Recommend trying dinner over brunch since more of their signature and authentic Mexican options are available.
author: Angelina G.

description: Definitely worst trying if you've never been. the restaurant has a great vibe, the decoration is very cool & the food is very good! Don't know why it took me 4 years before trying it.
author: Meryl H.

description:
I've been here twice. For the first time, service was great because it was brunch/lunch time on a weekend.

I love the interior and the food. It is delicious! Prices are reasonable for the type of tapas restaurant it is. 

HOWEVER. The second time I went was a Monday evening around 7. I was so disappointed at the service we received. We were greeted kindly(thank you!) But the waitress and servers were so rude; they were condescending, they had this passive aggressive attitude/vibe, and everything made us feel unwelcome. 

I completely understand if the restaurant is busy, and you need to clear tables and get diners through, but there was a table next to us that was empty and open for any incoming guests. I'm just a little baffled at the difference in service we received. 

What happened? Why are the waiters/waitresses so rude? 
Does the quality of the food/cool mission vibe justify treating diners so condescendingly..? 

3 stars; 2 knocked off for the way we felt after leaving the second time
author: Gloria Z.

description: Wonderful eclectic decor and beyond yummy food. I remember the fish dishes being exceptional. Make your reservations fast!
author: Kinjal N.

description: Easily the best tacos I've ever had. This place bumps every night and the bar never leaves me wanting. Everything fresh, everything hand made, everything good. You can easily tell they have passion and love for their guests and their ingredients. Want to change your life? Get the Paloma with mezcal. You're welcome.
author: Tom K.

description: SOO cute in here! Loved the decor, drinks were fantastic and the staff were all great too. Was walking the down the street and happened to stumble in here.
author: Charlotte A.

description:
The food is delicious and served in the perfect portions so you can get a few things to share. We tried the ceviche, tostadas, and quesadillas. We took a little break and had the horchata mousse which was topped with cherries, still dreaming about it! 

The staff is incredibly accommodating and super friendly. They checked in in us once in a while and made sure we had all we needed for a lovely meal.
author: Brenda A.

description:
The food was great - I got the avocado taco, fish taco, and shishito peppers. They were all delicious! The bar staff was entertaining to watch and fairly attentive. 

My one complaint is that I found the hostess to be a bit unpleasant. I was a solo diner and wanted to use the restroom while I waited for a spot at the bar to open up (which was first come first serve and very very busy - I ended up waiting for an hour), but the hostess refused to keep an eye out for a seat for the 3 minutes it would've taken me to use the restroom cause she was too busy hostessing. I get that it's first come first serve... but it's a bit frustrating to think my hour long wait for a seat at the bar could've been extended to two hours if a seat opened up while I was in the restroom. If she had time to schmooze with customers throughout the restaurant for 2-3 minutes each (which she did a lot), she could've made the effort to help me not miss my chance at a seat. 

The first come first serve seating at the bar is also a poor system generally. It's sort of a matter of luck if you're standing close enough to the spots at the bar that open up. And some people sat at the bar for hours without eating... which would be fine if there weren't people who were waiting to sit. Just treat it as walk in seating for dinner, keep a waitlist, and separate people who want to just drink into an area that isn't possible seating for diners.
author: Taly M.

description:
I LOVE LOLO!

1 - DRINKS - The Fresh Prince is so good, its the yummiest cocktail I've ever had. 2 Birds 1 Stone is good too but is a bit of an acquired taste, probably from the celery bitters. Bartenders here know what they are doing!

2 - AMAZING SERVICE - I have worked in the restaurant business and everyone here is super knowledgeable, helpful, and really good at their job. Tip them well, they deserve it!

3 - FOOOOD - Lamb sliders are a must try! Probably the best thing on the menu and people just dont know cause they often come here for tacos. With that said, best beef tacos in the city and tacos tropical is good too!

4 - Decor - It is so much fun to eat here because the whole place looks so cool, love the dogs and mens coats used as upholstery!

5 - CHIPS/GUAC/SALSA - all fresh and super tasty!

I heard the mexican vanilla ice cream is super good but i never have room for dessert, try it!
author: Kimia M.

description:
3.5 STARS

Our party of three originally wanted to go to Lolo Cevicheria, but our stop before dinner took a little longer than than we thought. Since Lolo is open later, we decided to go here instead. It was Thursday, August 13th around 10:15pm. We walked in without a reservation and were seated right away.

Food:
*Fried brussel sprouts: shallots, hazelnuts, late harvest zinfandel vinaigrette ($7)
*Corn on the cob: cotija cheese and cream ($6)
*Shishito peppers: lemon olive oil, maldon salt ($7)
*Taco tropical: panko and spice-dusted shrimps, topped with a tropical relish and spicy aioli, on jicama tortillas ($10)
*Ceviche: shrimp and rock fish citrus roasted pepper sauce and salted corn ($12)
*Carnitas: with organic handmade corn tortillas, roasted tomato sauce, guacamole, pickled onions ($17)

I enjoyed the shishito peppers the most. They were blistered nicely and had a good salty sour contrast. The ceviche had bold citrusy flavor, but I didn't like the addition of the corn. The carnitas were really good, but a touch dry for me. I didn't eat much of the sprouts and the tacos. I remember them being okay. The dish I would avoid would be the corn. There was an over abundance of cream that didn't add anything to the dish. I thought this would be like street corn, but it wasn't. Not good at all.

Drinks:
*Sangria: pinot noir, vodka, poppy liqueur, cardamom, served on the rocks ($11)
*Nightcall: scotch, el silencio mezcal, creme the violette, amaretto, served on the rocks ($11)
*Cheap trick: altos reposado tequila, chile ancho liqueur, vanilla bitters ($11)
*The windshield ($11)

The drinks were the highlight for me. I started with the Nightcall which was a dark boozy drink with an element of sweetness. I asked our server what I should get next and he suggested the Windshield. I need to order this the next time I'm here as that was my favorite drink! Not sure what was in it, but it was dark, boozy and not so sweet, which was exactly what I wanted.

Service was great! Growing up in a restaurant, I used to hate it when people lingered in restaurants when they were the last party. Unfortunately, I was that party! But the staff was great. We never felt rushed. But we did try to hurry and finish up our drinks as it was getting late.

I feel like I may have ordered the wrong food items for my tastes. Looking back at the menu, I would have ordered more tacos, maybe empanadas and the steak. I think I would have enjoyed those dishes more. I'll take it as an excuse to go back?
author: Elena N.

description:
Make sure you reserve for the one on Valencia St. in SF. The food is tapas style. Mixed art and a wide selection of tequila/ cocktails. It does get crowded so I would recommend reserving a seat online. NO RESERVATIONS OVER the PHONE. You either must do it online or walk in and accept the wait time. You are able to head to the bar as you wait for your table to be called. The team will text you once your table is ready, keep your phone on loud. 

My girlfriend and I have been BIGGGGGG fans since we began coming here 2 years ago. We always say we need to write a post (finally doing it after all this time!).

Honestly let me start off by saying there are two main components to why we love this location so much. 

1st: 
with all HONESTY it is all because of the hostess VIRI (I hope I spelled your name correctly). She makes the entire ambient much better. We usually visit this establishment on Thursday night, we do it sporadically but it seems to always land on Thursdays haha. Anyways, to explain the seriousness of how well she does her job and just how awesome of a human she is  (without us truly knowing her)- we have left when we did not see her at the door. He presence is felt and completes our experience when we dine. 

2nd:
The PANKO AVOCADO TACOS are extremely delicious. They do not lack in flavor (satisfying your pallet in every single bite) nor in consistency. I am particularly sensitive to spice and I can not stop ingesting them. It is unfortunate that they give you two tacos per plate however, we do leave with a full stomach. We enjoy the KALE salad that has the right amount of lime zest to it as it is fresh and light. Anyone who goes must try both these items.
author: Kiansu And Laura R.

description: We always enjoy a night at Lolós! Lively atmosphere, great cocktails, great service and delicious food. Make sure to book way in advance.
author: Maggie S.

description:
***MISSION FOOD CRAWL STOP #1***

my cousin was visiting from out of town and wanted to do a food crawl in sf, so my other cousin (who has lived in sf for over 20 yrs) put together a "food map/itinerary" in the mission district for us cuzzies to spend the afternoon.

this was our first stop, or rather, the first stop when i joined the family since i came up to the city a bit late, and my cousins had already ordered a colorful array of mexican cuisine for us to try:

+tuna tacon: yes intentionally spelled "taco," these were flour tortillas topped with seared albacore tuna, shellfish aioli and avocado, with roasted tomatillo sauce on the side
+kale salad: gaja apples, caramelized walnuts, cottage cheese, roasted garlic shallots with a lime vinaigrette dressing
+grilled beef tacos: beef, onions and avocado atop flour tortillas with habanero sauce
+2 sunnyside up eggs on a bed of fried, shoestring potatoes (can't recall the name of the dish)

although this was meant to be more like tapas vs a full meal, i felt like there was so much food for the 5 of us!

the tuna taco was really fresh, and just slightly seared, so partly cooked, and partly raw, and meshed well with the aioli, avocado, and tomatillo sauce...it wasn't too spicy, which i appreciated!

the kale salad was amazing!  the green were super fresh, walnut raw (which i prefer over roasted), apples thinly sliced (almost undetectable had i not been searching for them), cheese sprinkled sparingly (so as to not overwhelm the other ingredients), and dressing on the lighter side.  although i had a hard time tasting the roasted garlic, i loved everything about this salad and kept reaching for more!

service was pretty good, swift and accurate and bill was brought to us in a timely manner.  the restaurant itself was very nice, and surprisingly spacious, considering how small the entrance was, and in the very tight mission district.

definitely a great place to dine if you like higher-end, organic mexican food.
author: Ellen L.

description: Amazing food! I loved literally every dish we got here. My favorite was the avocado tacos. Our waiter told us one girl ate seven orders by herself and I believe it. Also loved the cornbread!
author: Prajakta J.

description: This place is very colorful and cute!!! We ordered the avocado tacos because it was different. You will not be disappointed. The avocado is deep fried with a layer of crunch breadcrumbs or something. Each order gets you two tacos. They provide chips and salsa. The salsa dips were liquid and I prefer the chunky version, so I did not eat too much of it. This place is also very crowded and the tables are crammed together. Our waiter was so busy, I had to flag the hostess to get service started. Overall, it is a good place to try new things, and with a group of friends, it is very fun.
author: Vivian X.

description: Very cute. Very busy. Pork belly was cooked perfectly. Great staff and good drinks. Get in early to avoid waiting.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
So in love with this spot - how have I never been here before is my question! 

I came here for brunch recently on a Sunday without a reservation and had heard how busy it gets, yet somehow got a table for 2 as soon as I got there, a few minutes before it opened. No complaints there. This place, first of all, is adorable. Such a great vibe and filled up very quickly. 

I ordered the margarita to start, which was SO freaking good. For food, I decided on the Huevos Rancheros (after about 20 minutes of looking over the menu since everything sounded amazing!). Once again, how have I never been here!? 

Will most definitely be back...can't wait to try dinner here!
author: Ilana B.

description:
We were a party of 4 who arrived five minutes early for our 9pm reservation and found the restaurant packed - and our table ready!   We were waited on almost immediately and our food and drinks were served quickly.  The Octopus and Tacos (Tropical and Beef) were excellent; I've rarely had octopus so tender.

The margaritas and Pacifico beer were tasty!

Service with a sincere smile -- something you rarely find anymore.

We'll definitely go again!
author: Drew K.

description:
Lolo's, how do I like thee now, I really used to, and let me count the ways: (1) The drinks have always been the star of the place; (2) The service is always good (and this does not include hostess, poor lady seemed stressed out sitting you down at 6:30 pm).

My disappointments: (1) It's like dining in a college town, the noise level is way way and you cannot have a good conversation; seemed like the Google Bus just dropped everyone early; (2) too much cell phone usage around you; (3) the pork belly could have been crispier; (4) the guacamole is way too salty, the chips were definitely not restaurant made; (5) the crab croquettas were lumpy, you can barely taste the crab, and the sauce was too sweet; 
(6) I expected the beet + kumquat salad, well, to taste like beet and kumquat, but you lost me on the cheese-way too much.

Sorry Lolo's, you were really really good when you were at the older location; your welcoming smile and tasty tapas seemed to have been lost with your new crowd.

PS, since everyone is in love with the Decor, too many dogs on the walls; all I can think of when I look at them is the song "Who Let the Dogs Out."
author: Ernesto T.

description: Really a 4.5. Let me just get to the point on this one I cannot stop dreaming about the fried avocado taco! After I left Texas I thought nothing would compare, well Lolo you have changed me. Avocados is perfectly warm, soft, and has a crunchy fried batter all at the same time. The sauce perfection. Now the ceviche you added cornnuts and give me a huge offering of this saltiness goodness I am over the moon!
author: Morgan S.

description:
The food was fantastic but unfortunately they lady at the door that took bookings was really rude and made me not want to come back to the restaurant again. 

We got to the restaurant and didn't have a reservation. She told us we could sit at the bar as it was open seating or we could wait an hour for the table. We waited an hour and when we came back we had to wait another 30 mins to be told "just sit at the bar" we explained we waited an hour and a half for a table and she was just brushing us off. There was a empty table and we asked could we sit there and she said no. We decided to eat at the bar as we waited so long so eat. The area were were given was clearly for one person but she told us both to squeeze in. 

Then 2 minutes after we sat down a couple that came in after us that didn't have a reservation either were told they could have the table we asked to have. 

The waitress was just so rude and I definitely won't go back. And unfortunately the star rating reflects that.
author: Laura C.

description:
I was very, very impressed. Typically not a fan of fancified foods that I can find in amazing hole in walls and but Lolo does a great job with renditions on traditional tacos, guac, etc. 

That octopus was by far the most tender I've ever had. So much so that I can't believe it's only braised, then grilled. There must be something else! Give me secrettttt. 

How many times do you tickle an Octopus to make it laugh? 
Ten.....tick...les............
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
The BEST Mexican place I've ever been to. Their crab cakes are INSANE. Awesome margaritas too. 
Definitely check this place out!
author: Ninad A.

description:
Definitely a decent tapas place. Street parking is difficult but thank goodness there is a parking lot nearby. Prices are a bit steep but it beats driving around looking for parking. My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday at 8ish. And we got seated right away.  Majority of their tapas are different tacos.

We tried a variety of things such as Tropical tacos, tuna tacon, pollo tostada and carnitas. 
Tropical taco and tuna tacon were so good. The shrimp was lightly fried and delicious. And the tuna was delicious. 

The carnitas was a bit dry but it was decent. I would say nopalito has a better carnitas. The pollo tostadas was also ok as well. It was decent but it wasn't anything to write home about. 

Overall, this place is decent but it's a bit pricy. I would come visit here again but maybe on a weeknight when parking probably wouldn't be as bad.

Total for 2: $60
author: Stella J.

description: Lolo is simply one of the best Mexican restaurants in the Mission. I recommend sharing a couple of small plates and fish tacos. I can't wait to go back again!
author: Laureniu D.

description: We were very disappointed by the food here.   The decor is cute but the food tasted like prepackaged microwave food.  The ceviche was pulpy and sour.  Nothing tasted fresh.  Greasy and flavorless empanadas.  We have eaten lots of high and low end Mexican food so are not novices.  Definitely do NOT recommend.  A big disappointment. N
author: Rebecca G.

description:
I've been hearing about how Lolo on Valencia, with its colorful decor, is such a cute, fun place that I decided to try it with a friend for brunch. There was no wait when we walked in around noon. Since Lolo has opened a new cevicheria in their former space on 22nd, I thought they specialized in ceviche and ordered one. While the shrimp was fresh, the darker brown rock fish pieces were off-puttlingly fishy compared to the white pieces. The ceviche was also too acidic; the citrus juices overpowered the fish (except for the fishy pieces). I told our server the fish was fishy but he didn't understand.  Another server came by near the end of the meal to ask how everything was so I mentioned the fishy ceviche again. He offered to have the kitchen remake the dish, but we didn't want to try it again. 

We did like the taco tropical (panko fried shrimp with jicama as the tortilla) although we were surprised by how small the two tacos were when they were served. The kale salad portion, on the other hand, was huge. The table next to us had the tuna tacon and huevos rancheros, I believe, which looked good.

After leaving, I recall that I have eaten at their old space on 22nd a long time ago and thought the food was average. My friend likes this place for their drinks so maybe it's better at the bar.
author: Diana B.

description:
This restaurant is GREAT all the way around.....from the food to the service.  What an amazing time we shared with our friends celebrating our 38th Wedding Anniversary.  Thank you Lolo!!!!
Love the boxer decorations around the restaurant too.
author: Debbie K.

description: Great ambiance, tasty food and delicious cocktails. More on the pricey side.
author: Sue V.

description: Amazing place!!! The tuna tacon is a must have. This restaurant definitely lives up to the hype. We were very impressed! Best cocktails in town.
author: Mariya N.

description: Stay away from the tasteless guacamole.  It came cold, with a brown film on top and tasted blah!  Loved the agua fresca (sandia) and the arugula salad.  Tried the birria sliders (good sauce on the side) and the tacos (meat was tasty). However there is much better food for Latinos elsewhere.
author: Frances M.

description:
How have I never written a review for Lolo! I have been here more times than I can count. Especially late night on a Friday when I am craving a taco in the city with a few girlfriends. Their food is amazing and their margs are even better. 

They serve you a green and red salsa to start with some free chips. Now free chips aren't rare in SF, but let me tell you, other cities will CHARGE you for chips and salsa. It's a travesty. Anyway I digress. Their guacamole is super creamy and delicious as well. I think their entire menu is pretty awesome but I will go ahead and recommend my two favorite tacos. Taco Tropical and Tuna Tacon are the stand outs. Taco tropical is essentially a panko dusted shrimp taco but is not on a tortilla shell exactly.. it's on a tortilla shell shaped jicama slice. I know. Mind blown. But trust me it's really delicious. The next is tuna tacon, which is albacore tuna seared off to perfection. It's quite good. 

Honorable mention to the panko avocado taco. It is realllll good and I wish I could replicate it at home. Lolo is a really great spot in the mission that is a great place to kick back with some friends. Their décor is quirky and fun. Definitely embodies what the mission district is all about. Go here with some friends and order stuff to share, you won't regret it.
author: Shannon H.

description:
Reservation: scheduled same day online but it was a Monday night. When we came there was a 25 minute wait.

We ordered:
Margarita- classic staple
Guacamole - kind of bland
Ceviche - loved the flavor the sweet deep fried chips added 
(Craveable) Taco tropical - amazing so many complementing flavors
Beef sliders - served in a French dip format. Sauce is amazing and complements the sandwich perfectly 
Tuna Tacon - good love the garlic mayo sauce
author: Cameron M.

description:
Loved: Carlos our server, the cocktails, especially Latina & Oaxacan), & queso fundito with mushrooms.  
It was ok: $28 octopus dish, steak dish - very juicy but kind of chewy.   Atmosphere was fun and festive like a beach bar in Cancun ( looked more high design on the website).
Didn't love: hostess not greeting & seating us 15 min after reservation time, most of the food (chips with watery salsa, the recommended tuna tacon - weird teriyaki sauce and mushy texture). And the dead  flowers in the bathroom and drove me crazy. 
We were very excited to try LoLo but probably wouldn't go back except to meet friends for a cocktail.
author: Robyn T.

description:
Cute decor, fast service, interesting waiters/waitresses, and great place to people watch. As one of my last few nights single, one of my girlfriends and I came here think we can drink up a storm.

THE DRINKS ARE DELICIOUS! ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! I finished the entire drink in one sitting!

Now the food....one thing I've noticed is in the mission area, all the restaurants have a common theme: they must love their lemons! Most of their dishes are either very TANGY/tart, or just plain salty. The presentation and food was cooked to perfection, but it's just a bit too much TART that it overtakes the favors! One great example is the guacamole! It had so much tartness, that I couldn't even taste the avocado! 

Would I come back? Probably if I want to get drunk off of their super delicious drinks:)
author: Josie H.

description: This was.an awesome restaurant with anazing decor. Make sure to have reservations because it's packed with people from the moment they open till they close. We loved all the drink and food options and there is so much stuff to choose from everything tastes good so you really can't go wrong. If you're in the Mission District definitely stop by this place and give it a try.
author: Cheryl P.

description:
My friend and I made reservations for 1pm on a Sunday, though reservations weren't necessary. The restaurant was busy enough that passerbys wouldn't question it being good, but there were still plenty of open tables.

I love the general vibe of this place. Lively, hipster/eclectic/quirky with good food.

FOOD: Yummy! Ingredients were fresh. The dishes didn't need the aiolis or sauces that they came with in my opinion, so I'd recommend asking for those on the side. Definitely recommend the PANKO AVOCADO TACO! If you're a ceviche person, their ceviche is pretty solid too. Unfortunately, their menu changed at some point and the pistachio salmon and octopus carpaccio that were popular dishes among Yelpers aren't on the menu anymore :(

PRICE: Pretty reasonable, mostly ranging from $8 - $12. The portions might seem small with the taco dishes only having 2 tacos, but they're surprisingly filling. My friend and I ordered 4 plates, which came out to be about $50 after tax/tip.

ATMOSPHERE: Lively. There's bar seating, booths and tables that are relatively close to each other. Bright with lots of light and high ceilings. Lots of bright, colorful, patterned wallpaper and cushions, and very eclectically decorated: suits on the back cushions of seats, a wall of car doors, slightly creepy hanging hand/glove art and dog statues everywhere.

SERVICE: Attentive without being intruding. Our waitress gave us time to look at the menu and checked up on us once or twice. Food came out reasonably quickly. The servers were good about clearing the plates as we finished dishes to give us more space on the table and also asked to make sure we were enjoying the food.

=====

-CHIPS & SALSA (complimentary) - 2/5
For a nice Mexican restaurant, their chips and salsa were rather disappointing. The chips were very average and both salsas (red and green) were pretty bland. 

-PANKO AVOCADO TACO ($9) - 4.5/5
[oaxaca cheese, caramelized onion, anaheim peppers, red onion]
Ordered this because it's on 7x7's Big Eat list for 2015. Honestly, I was a little skeptical about it being on the list and wasn't expecting to enjoy fried/breaded avocado, but I was pleasantly surprised! Contrary to my belief, the taco didn't feel heavy or unhealthy despite the cheese and fried aspect. The avocado was soft and silky on the inside and had a slight crunch from the panko breading, and the cheese was perfectly gooey.

-CEVICHE ($12) - 4.5/5
[shrimp & rock fish, jicama, salted peppercorns, citrus roasted pepper sauce]
I really enjoyed this but I'm a little biased towards loving ceviche in general. It comes with only 4 large chips, but the complimentary chips they give before your meal work very well for eating the rest of the ceviche. The jicama and corn added a nice crunch and texture, the shrimp and fish were fresh and the citrus sauce was light and refreshing. The only problem I had was that there were only 2 shrimp in our ceviche!

-TACO TROPICAL ($9) - 4/5
[panko and spice-dusted shrimp, tropical relish, spicy aioli, on jicama "tortillas"]
Asked for the aioli on the side since my friend and I generally don't like our food drenched in sauces. The tacos were really nice and light without any sort of aioli or sauces, which I personally preferred. The tomato and pineapple relish added a touch of sweetness and the jicama tortillas were a unique touch - absolutely loved them! I didn't care for the breading on the shrimp though; it was kind of thick and took away from the lightness of the rest of the taco.

-TUNA TACON ($10) - 3.5/5
[seared albacore tuna, avocado, shellfish aioli, roasted tomatillo sauce on the side]
These tacos seemed very popular amongst Yelpers, so naturally we had to order them. Unfortunately, my friend and I both found the tacos to be kind of disappointing. We asked for the aioli on the side and I'm glad we did. Even without the aioli, I could barely taste the tuna. The piece of tuna wasn't very big and the flavor and texture of just the avocado overpowered it. Not a bad dish, but not special.
author: Jessie L.

description:
We were in a tapas mood and wanted to check out Lolo.  I heard that it can get really crowded so we made a resi, but when we got there it was pretty empty!  Quickly after getting seated, the restaurant filled up and by the time we were done, there was a crowd and line for the tables so I guess the resi wasn't a waste.

DINNER
*Brussell sprouts
*Taco tropical
Tuna tacon
Some squid ink thing

The service was great and food was fantastic.  Will definitely be coming back
author: Lyn C.

description:
Over rated! They used way too much lard in their dishes. Went their for brunch and they were out of the chicken torta.. Boo.
We ordered steak tacos, ceviche, eggs with chorizo. I asked if they had any homemade sauce and they brought me back something that tastes like tabasco... Wtf. Your charging $12 for 2 tacos a la carte and can't get more creative with the sauces?? There's better Mexican food in this city. Pass on this spot until they get it together and bring some flavor in their dishes.
author: Mira P.

description:
Service was attentive, on point (I requested menu item changes-I.e. cheese on the side and they were precise with everything), food was delicious. 

We got 5 plates to share for 3 people, perfect amount. We ordered the kale salad, brussel sprouts, guacamole, grilled octopus, carnitas. Everything was delicious; possibly best fashion of brussel sprouts I have ever had.

We made a reservation through Yelp which was a good idea. It was crowded and loud but it still felt intimate to me. 

I highly recommend and am personally looking forward to going back to try other things.
author: Gaby K.

description:
Excellent food. Excellent. Came here on a very busy Tuesday night. 

5 stars for food. The Kale salad was perfect. I highly recommend. The light dressing with lots of flavor and the candied walnuts make you forget you are eating kale. We ordered the guacamole with chips - also excellent.

Our entrees were the Ceviche and Diabla shrimp. Both sauces in the dishes were so good I had to keep myself from picking up the bowls and licking them.

2 stars for space/seating. The seating/noise space is slightly awful. We had an ok table squeezed between two other parties. I could hear the valley girl sitting next to my boyfriend better than I could him. Her dinner date next to me literally almost elbowed me. I uploaded a photo. This is *not* a good date place unless you are able to grab a set at the bar.

Overall, I'd recommend coming here early and sitting at the bar. There was way more space and with the higher seats its not as noisy.
author: Jessica C.

description: Best creative Mexican food ever! Tropical tacos and calamari are delicious. Nice service with friendly people there. Totally nice try!
author: Chuqiao L.

description: Had brunch there on Sunday. Food was great, atmosphere (Mexico in the 40s) fine, music was a little loud for conversation, but my wife and I are old and recognize youth likes to talk loud nowadays. One criticism; Coffee was bland, just like in O'Mexico (where instant coffee/hot water is typical). A touch too authentic?
author: J T.

description: Absolutely love this place. Went there today for brunch and shared several dishes with my friends. We ordered the Tropical Tacos, molletes, guacamole, chilaquilles, and ceviche. Every single bite was well worth it and delicious. The service was great. For being so busy the food came out quickly and the waitress was very attentive. Will definitely go back again.
author: Paola P.

description: Thoroughly enjoyed my brunch here on Saturday! The staff was A+. My husband and I shared a meal, and decided we should probably order one more. Food came out quickly...but not too quickly-if you know what I mean. The decorations inside are so cute and enjoyable to look at. All in all, this was a pleasant visit! Be sure to get their early on saturdays for brunch, we were the first at the door at 11:30, and the place was full by noon!
author: Alisha K.

description:
Went to this cute mission spot on a Tuesday evening to catch up with a friend. Thanks to all the reviewer before me we made reservations and it was a good thing we did because the place gets packed! 

The chips and salsa were delicious and complimentary, the waitress also asked if we wanted guac and I said sure, not realizing that it was actually a menu item which was kind of a bummer. We ordered the brussel sprouts, avocado tacos and the taco tropical. While I wasn't the biggest fan of the brussel sprouts, the tacos were incredible! So much flavor and the jicama tortilla is unlike anything I have tasted before. 

The decor is so cute, each wall was uniquely crafted and gave me major inspiration for my own room. 

Overall good food, good vibes and great service! A definite win in my books.
author: Rachel N.

description:
Maybe I've been spoiled with good Mexican food in SD but these tacos were just okay. I do love the decor of this place though, it wasn't very Spanish but more of a fun spontaneous collection of items. 

On a busy Saturday night we were able to be seated at the bar. They didn't have a big craft beer menu (I'm used to SD having like 30+ on tap...) but I did see an IPA and got it. My friend got the Sangria and he said it was very sweet. 

Food items 
-Ceviche: I absolutely did not like the corn nuts in the ceviche. Corn nuts are hard to bite into and didn't go well with it. The ceviche was okay...definitely had better ceviche, this one was way too bland and not enough Mexican spices. 
-Panko avocado taco: It's just a fried warm avocado in panko, I don't know how I felt about this, but I remember eating and just thought of like mushy baby food. 
-Fried fish taco: The fried fish taco was decent, nothing memorable though.

My friend who works at Twitter said the kitchen staff there makes better tacos than Lolo... and that's coming from a Mexican too. I guess you can say we were both a little disappointed when we left.
author: Lisa W.

description: Great, simple Mexican with a modern take. The menu isn't hugely extensive but for a quick and simple dinner this restaurant was tasty and had some great margaritas. Convenient location in the center of the Mission. A bit noisy and tables were tight but overall we enjoyed dining here.
author: Josh M.

description: Everything was very tasty. Liked the brussel sprouts and Kale, which is normally not what I'd even order. Overall, great place to-go!
author: Camila G.

description:
Avocado should never be heated. But I tried the deep fried avocado taco because it came highly recommended. It tasted rotten & otherwise bland.

The guac was offensively small. Maybe, just barely maybe one avocado worth for $8. Needed salt and citrus.

The quesadilla was bland.

The kale salad and the Brussels sprouts were good.

The ambience is fun.

Overall too expensive for what they're selling.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
Another 3rd date dinner date spot (reference previous review about eating and dating). The date was meh but the food was delicious.  I recommend the fish tacos and the a LA Diabla Shrimp. The shrimp dish tasted like a fusion of tikka masala and Spanish flavors which worked well for me. Please note, I do love my Indian food. Also, if you're into passion fruit like I am then you must try the Fresh Prince cocktail. I didn't try any of the other cocktails because I had 3 Fresh Prince. I can't say no to a cocktail with passion fruit in it especially one that's named after one of the best shows ever.

The bartenders are also very attentive. I was doing the most and poured a ton of their hot sauce on my shrimp and almost passed out. The only drinks available to me (water, the Fresh Prince, and a Mezcal shot I had not taken) could not cure me. I wasn't even being dramatic- just taking turns between the 3 drinks and somehow the bartender noticed and came to the rescue with wine that countered the heat. 

I would come back again with girlfriends and sit at the bar or another 3rd date and NOT sit at the bar. The bar seating is a good place to people watch while you eat some delicious food and enjoy strong cocktails with your girlfriends. They do get packed so plan accordingly.
author: Pawanpreet G.

description:
San Francisco meets Mexico, falls in love, and has baby Lolo. Thats the best way I can describe it. There were many times where I was left in awe over the food creativity. You can fulfill your cravings for Mexican delights like corn cakes, birria, tacos, ceviche, aguas frescas, flan, and many other small plates. If you grew up in Mexico or have traveled to Mexico, you will appreciate this place so much more.

5 stars for their service, quality of food and presentation, and overall experience.
author: Cari M.

description:
Im in love with the Lolo. Its true. I've been twice in the past month and Im already dying to go again. Yup it was that good. The decor, atmosphere, and set up here are all just additional pluses on top of the amazing food. is great. I really love the creative walls and decor. The servers were all so friendly and attentive.

The first time I went we sat at the bar and I had such a great time. The second time we had a table and the server was so helpful in suggesting veggie items for my strict veggie dining partner.

Ive tried:
the Brussels sprouts- so so yummy to snack on with one of the many yummy cocktails sangria, beer or wine.
Black bean tostada- this was warm and crunchy and oh so tasty
Shrimp in Diablo sauce (not sure of the actual name)- SO this was the highlight of my meal because I actually hate shrimp but have been dreaming about this dish since I ate it. Thank you Lolo bc after many many years Ive found a shrimp dish I actually love! The sauce in this dish is literally crack.

I cant wait to go back and try more dishes. I would def be devastated if the shrimp dish is not there though.
author: Hetal P.

description:
Great interior design, food, and drinks.

Highlight of the night was clearly the Taco Tropical! It was the most refreshing taco I've ever had. Instead of a tortilla, they use radish to wrap the taco fillings. It complimented so well and I just want to go back to eat more as I write this. Other things we order were the Tuna Tacons,  Empanadas, Brussel Sprouts, and Cavichi which all turned out great.

In terms of drinks I got the Mezcal Mule because of the pretty presentation on Yelp, though it didn't look exactly the same but it sure tasted delightful. 

I definitely would come back!
author: Kathy L.

description: Such good tacos!! We tried a variety - tropical, fish, tuna, and beef. Everyone agreed the taco tropical is the money maker taco! Instead of a flour or corn tortilla, the outside is a thinly sliced radish that beautifully complements the shrimp and garnishes. A must try if you visit Lolo! The only complaints we had were that the guacamole is bland and simple, not worth the price. But everything else is delicious!
author: Judy M.

description: Been to Lolos twice during 2 different visits to SF.  My recent visit was at their new location which I thought had a nicer layout than the previous spot.  I love the food here, simple yet great tasting.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  I love Lolo's cause you can stop by for a good drink and chips and salsa or stop by to catch some great dinner.
author: Leo J.

description: It's been 7 1/2 years and I've finally been back. I honestly don't understand the prices or why people are willing to pay them. Two tacos, a small bowl of roasted peppers, a few spoons of guacamole and a beer $40
author: Manny F.

description:
Pros: 

Cheap drinks 

Cons: 

Food! Lol 
 I'm a foodie and I don't think this place deserved a 4star for the food compare to any local place like lolinda or its sister bar el techo. 

The Brussel sprouts are rated well but I've never had something so flavorless! They were just bad! 
I would go back for the cheap drinks again but never for the food!
author: Ghazal P.

description:
Decor is so fun!!
Food was delicious and not too bad in pricing. 
We tried the guacamole, brussel sprouts, beef tacos, tuna (tacos?), cerviche and the grilled octopus. 
Everything was delicious. 
Grilled octopus is a bit pricy, but delicious and soft.
author: M J.

description:
First of all, the menu had no price on it. You simply order everything without knowing the price. 
We ordered the Fried Octopus, which had only TWO arms. Extremely yummy but it turned out to cost us $25. 
The waitress also recommanded the chicken taco. Chicken was very dry.... We had the ceviche as well but it was super duper sour to a point that my nose started sweating:( 
We came in only cuz we saw the reviews on Yelp. However, I figured that the pictures for Lolo are all taken professionally. Other pictures I found on here by customers are from 3-4 years ago and the course doesn't even exist on the menu no more. Be careful..
author: Melissa H.

description:
Beautiful quirky Restaurant.  Love the interior.  The food is delicious.  We had a range of tapas to share and were happy with all of them.  
Staff is very friendly and helpful.
All around a great experience :-)
author: Kerstin F.

description: Nice atmosphere! Very cool place to get drinks and appetizers. Their tacos are delicious. It is also very convenient to make reservations. However I am not a big fan of their ceviche
author: Sara-Fleur S.

description: Restaurant has a great vibe and atmosphere. Decor is cool. Staff were really friendly. Had corn, empanadas and shrimp tacos... all good. The tuna taco was average
author: Zaineb D.

description: Viri  is  Amazing  every time we come here we get nothing but the VERY BEST service. The food is Amazingly good  the ceviche is ALWAYS ON  point. I can go on and on about how good this place is you must try it for ur self to see what I mean.
author: Ely Y.

description:
Came by on a Saturday night at 6:15 without reservations and was able to get a place at the counter. Had the beet salad, fried brussel sprouts, and the grilled skirt steak (split with my wife).   All were really good and especially liked the beet salad and the skirt steak.  Loved the dressing on the beet salad (I did not know beet salad could taste so good) and the the skirt steak had a wonderfully rich flavor. 

Ended with a delicious and unconventional tiramisu. It came out in a bowl with a smaller bowl filled with a dark mexican chocolate sauce. While there was no coffee flavor (which makes it hard for me to qualify this as tiramisu), it was wonderful, so who cares!

Nice interior and attentive wait staff.
author: Bob F.

description: Small but tasty portions for $$$ prices, deliciouus tasty drinks.  Expensive $85 brunch for two. Been there, done that and now on to something better.
author: N R.

description:
Decided to come to Lolo for lunch last minute and was able to get a Saturday lunch reso easily. The guacamole was tasty and the avocado tacos were really good. The ceviche (shrimp and fish) was not that great at all. Had a "fishy" taste, maybe it needed to be marinated longer? Definitely won't order that again. The shishito peppers were just ok. My boyfriend said his steak tacos were "the best steak tacos" he's ever had! 

Service was fast. Decor is um interesting...we will be back :)
author: Trinity K.

description: Food was excellent. Loved the ceviche & Taco Tropical. The cocktail menu was quite sophisticated. The place had a really cool vibe as well. The hostess was exceptionally friendly and welcoming. Overall great experience.
author: Mike J.

description:
Terrible service but okay food. We had reservations for five and were seated. Our server did not arrive for more than 15 minutes at which point he acted as if it were an imposition to take our orders. He disappears for the rest of the meal and when asked for refills on coffee, sighs and fills our cups halfway.  He then disappears for another twenty minutes until we request our check. 

I would not go back. It is pricey and service is poor.
author: Mariza W.

description:
Are you a pescatarian?  if yes, is there a Tuna Tacon from Lolo in your mouth right now?  No?  Then get your ass over to Lolo now because there really isn't anything else you should be doing on this planet right now OTHER than eating one of these.  It's probably my favorite taco on earth.  Yes, EARTH.  It even beats the pork belly fusiony ones I've had elsewhere.  As is often the case with fusion tacos, the sauce does a lot of the work here; in this case it's an unagi based cream sauce.  Pure magic that you will be mopping up with whatever else you happened to order.

On the last visit, they were out of the Tuna Tacon, and our bartender (the one with the epic 80s aviator glasses) recommended Avocado Tacos.  WOW.  We expected these to be good because, well, they have avocado, but they were great, as the avocado was perfectly fried!

In the same league as the Tuna Tacon is the diabla shrimp, which is a bit like a spicey latin tikka masala; I assure you this is a good thing.  That is served with mushrooms, just enough rice, and a little bread.

Now, I know I know I know you're going to order the Taco Tropical because it's supposedly the Most Famous Thing Here.  But you can really skip it, since it's not even in the same league as the Tuna Tacon.  Our server, who recommended the tacon, also recommended the grilled octopus, which was tasty and super fresh - but also rather large and expensive.  We would've gladly taken half as much for half the price - since we somewhat used it to mop up trace amounts of the Tuna Tacon sauce anyway.

On a recent visit we also tried the calamari octopus gordita, which was "good" - there was too much "shell" (it looks like a puck) but the sauce was great.

If you're ordering drinks, the one you want is the Ramos Gin Shrub, which is supremely well balanced, and not too sweet despite containing watermelon and basil.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Might be one of my favorite place to have ceviche in SF
They wait is long but the food is really good
Their lamb, tuna, ceviche and guac are great
author: Jad A.

description: We went here for brunch and the dish I ordered was so bland.  It was some sort of a huevos rancheros dish, which anywhere else I've ordered has been very flavorful.  However, I couldn't taste any sort of spice or salsa.  It was literally tasteless.  Very disappointing.
author: Michelle C.

description: What a lovely, whimsical place! I was blown away by the interiors, the community feel and the amazing food and so many gluten free options. I look forward to going back again.
author: Ashima S.

description: The food comes in "gourmet" portions so you'll have to try a selection of items to eat your fill. Very busy on a Thursday night so if you're looking to meet new people this wouldn't be the worst place to go.
author: Rowan C.

description: Great new Guatemalan restaurant. Incredibly fresh and delicious ceviche. Sometimes a bit of a wait. Well worth it. Staff is fantastic. All the food choices are fantastic.  The only downside, the drinks. A bit overpriced on the wine for a moderate wine and a short pour.
author: Bill B.

description:
We were able to sneak in here as a walk-in this past weekend...what a pleasant surprise!

The fried brussel sprouts were pretty good, but I am finding that once you have had one fried brussel sprout, you have pretty much had them all.  It was what I had expected, which was good, but not anything I haven't had before.

The kale salad was excellent and came as a pretty large portion to share between the two of us.  It was fresh, not bitter at all, and the perfect, healthy lead in to dinner.

The fish taco, though a bit messy, was delicious and rivals some of the better fish tacos I have had.  The flavor really pops in your mouth and if it weren't for the large portion of food we ordered, I would have gone back for seconds.

The avocado taco was also a pleasant surprise and was delicious, but it may have been a bit too hyped in previous reviews--I have not had dreams about that taco as expressed by a few others.  It was good, but not something I would crave.

The highlight of the meal was the squid.  Prepared, served, and seasoned perfectly with arugula, a bean spread, and an olive tapenade.  The squid was so soft, you almost couldn't tell it was squid--possibly the best squid dish I have ever had.

Lastly, we had the carnitas dish.  We were a bit full by then, but appreciated the pork, which wasn't over salted as many carnitas dishes are.  Combine that with the guacamole and the pickled veggies, and it was an enjoyable dish to close out the night.

Sorry...no room for dessert :-P

The environment was a little crazy, and we were able to eat at the bar in front of the kitchen where we got to watch them prepare the food.
