The wait staff is friendly, but things were so hectic, we had to ask for things (water, water, and water) quite a few times to get what we wanted...so the service could have been better, but if you eat there, you'll see how crazy it gets and how some things can fall through the cracks.

Happy Eating!
author: Bradley H.

description:
Dinner for 4 on a Tuesday night.
Thanks to my friend for booking the reservation 1 month in advance!
It was also Dine Out for Life night, a percentage of the proceeds went to HIV/AIDS Foundation. Good stuff!

Food and drinks:
4/5 - Fried Brussels sprouts - $7
4/5 - Panko avocado taco (2 per order) - $10
5/5 - Taco tropical, this has fried shrimp with a Jicama taco shell  (2 per order) - $10
4/5 - Carnitas taco plate (pickled onions, guacamole, red salsa, with 4 homemade tortilla shells) - $17
5/5 - Fresh Prince cocktail (like a pisco sour but with passion fruit, lime, egg white and maybe chopped basil)
5/5 - Heat Wave cocktail - my friend had but I had a sip

Definitely great food and will return. Comparisons:
Marlowe's Brussels sprouts - I liked better at Marlowe's, but Lolo's was pretty good as well.
Cocktails - Lolo's drinks was on par with my top cocktail place, Trou Normande.
Carnitas - Lolo's was better than El Techo's. Lolo's condiments made it special.
Pablo avocado tacos - I haven't seen these in other restaurants yet, definitely try it if you want something different!
author: Mary H.

description:
I want to love you, I do! Your decor is SO vibrant and colorful. I just want to stare at every wall all day and ask myself WHY! this is so random but so cool! 

The upsides: the drinks are tasty! I had 2 Mezcal drinks..the watermelon juice one was my favorite.

The downsides: The food. Man, I really wanted to love you. But I've been here twice and both times we didn't think much of the food. The portions are tiny, the tuna tacon was ok but really small. 

The carnitas plate was dry, the corn on cob was good but just somehow not as good as the ones on the streets! 

The fried brussel sprouts were good. 

I think my favorite thing I enjoyed was the fried avocado taco. 

It's a great place for drinks and a fun atmosphere since it's open late and the decor is so cheerful, but for amazing tapas, it's a-ok.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Omg this place is sooooo damn good!!!!!!!!!!!!!!


Get their fish tacos, Ceviche, Brussel sprouts, & veggie poststicker (not really sure the name..ask!)
author: Na A.

description: Great unique flavor super good, we have a lunch with a great friends, drinks excellent!
author: Elida C.

description:
I've walked by here several times during brunch hours and there always seems to be a long wait. Luckily for us today we checked around 12:30 and there was no wait for a table for two!

I really like the decor of this place. It's quite spacious and can accommodate a lot of seating. Service was friendly and prompt.

We ordered the crispy chilaquiles and another egg and ham dish in mole that I forgot the name of.
Both were very tasty and sparked our interest to come back to try other things on their menu including coming back during dinner as well.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
LOVE this place! It can be loud, but other than that it's amazing!

I don't even like avocado and their avocado tacos are the best thing ever!! I could eat nothing but those every day. However, I've never had anything on the menu I didn't like. Brussels Sprouts, Guacamole, great margs, octopus, everything is fantastic!

I recommend reservations, but if not they'll take your number and text you 10 minutes before your table is ready you can go walk around or better yet get a drink down the street.
author: Erica C.

description:
An underwhelming experience. We got the taco tropical and the avocado toast. Lolo really knows how to make their food look good. Unfortunately, the food did not taste as good as they looked.

We started with some complimentary chips and salsa (red and green). The chips tasted fresh and the red salsa had a nice little spicy kick. I wasn't a fan of the green salsa though as it was too sour for my taste.

The taco tropical was a solid dish. The shrimp tasted great and the sauces complimented the shrimp very well.

We ended the meal with the avocado toast, which unfortunately was just not good at all. I'm not sure if it was an off day, but the toast just tasted bad. Usually I'm a fan of big servings, but it was honestly quite painful for me to finish this toast. The avocado toast tasted how one of those Chinese fish markets smell, and those fish markets smell pretty bad. The trout flavor was just way too fishy. It was like they sprinkled ocean water on this dish. I'm sad that this dish had to lower my rating of the restaurant so much, but honestly I was just not a fan at all of the avocado toast. If I just had the taco tropical, I think I would've given this place 4 stars.
author: Daniel N.

description: The food is absolutely delicious, and the service is great. I highly recommend the ceviche and the fish tacos! It is a little pricey, especially in regards to their drinks, but overall it's a great restaurant.
author: King W.

description:
We usually go to La Mar in SF as being one of our favorite restaurants in the city.  

LoLo is a smaller scale restaurant however it does have anything than a restaurant like La Mar has. Delicious Peruvian ceviche, nice staff and a great feeling. 

I would definitely return and recommend this restaurant to anyone. 

Enjoy!
author: Claudia D.

description:
Decent, lively neighborhood place for Mexican-inspired tapas. As in the huitlacoche, which came with requeson-stuffed wonton ravioli, the dishes and flavors are presented in a way that isn't necessarily 100% true to what you'd see in Mexican home cooking, but is nevertheless accessible to American tastes. If anything, be prepared for an unexpectedly spicy kick. Some more adventurous dishes, like the spicy uni tostada, meanwhile, just didn't rise to the occasion.

Drinks are decent, and service is fast and on point. Overall, the prices here aren't unreasonable, although bear in mind that the portions you get are somewhat small even for tapas. Overall, an OK choice.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for years- glad I was finally able to check it off my list! Especially since they appeared on 7x7's foodie list for 2016! 

Anyways, we ordered the Panko avocado taco (recommended dish from 7x7), the seared pork belly, diabla shrimp and sangria. I liked everything we ordered but especially liked the sauce for the shrimp! Mmmm.

Sangria was great but they don't offer carafes... What's up with that Lolo?! 

Staff were constantly checking in, removing empty plates and so on. Bathrooms were clean as well (but only one stall so women you will be waiting in line).
author: Mandi W.

description: Unnecessarily pretentious staff, and the food was mediocre.  Not worth the wait or the $$.
author: JoEllen D.

description:
Oh Lolo, how I love thy Lolo!

My friend and I came here. We are massive foodies. Point made to start:) 

I had made the reservation for here on the wrong day, but the hostess took care of us very quickly to ensure we got a table. Love that!!! 

We had to wait by the bar for our seats, but we got some drinks, and twenty minutes later we were seated at the other bar where we could eat, catch up on life and enjoy! 

We order the flautas, grilled octopus, ahi tacos and the tiramisu for dessert. They were all spot on! I suggest them all! 

The service was superb and friendly. My friend said it was one of the best restaurants she had been to in SF! Which is a total WOW, because she is a MASSIVE foodie critic. 

Walk, run, skip...or whatever to get here and try this greatness. You won't be sorry! 

Bon appetite!
author: Sonia A.

description: Little spot if you are in the mission. Drinks to the food.... bartenders are amazing and friendly. Really like this spot.
author: Kalyana K.

description: Wonderful vibe, great food, and very nice bartenders. Thank you for serving us great menu items, from dinner to dessert. A+!
author: Nara B.

description:
Lolos huevos are wut upppppp. 

I could drink that saucy sauce. And those friojles estan en fuegooooo. That sangria? Ain't like no other.

Don't go here so there's more for me bye.
author: Nicole M.

description:
What a weirdo spot this is. The decor is...eclectic. Suit jackets plastered onto booths, toy puppies jutting out of one wall, paper boats made of Latin magazines adorn another, and chandeliers made of vintage bicycle handlebars are just a few of the many oddball decorations. We loved it.

I came here for dinner with a couple friends and we ordered a ton of stuff. We started with a few cocktails: a margarita, a shipwreck, and a ramos gin shrubb. All delicious.

For tapas we got: 
-Panko Avocado Taco
-Grilled Octopus
-Guacamole
-Ceviche
-Taco Tropical
-Seared Pork Belly Salad

The panko avocado tacos and the grilled octopus were out of this world tasty and fun to eat. I didn't care much for the tacos tropical nor the pork belly salad, but I appreciated the creativity of the dishes.  

We left completely stuffed and happy. Service was great. I'd absolutely come back.
author: Jeannette N.

description: Always a good experience. The fish tacos are awesome, the Mexican zombie cocktail and the ink calamari are all really good. I think you cannot go wrong here, everything is good, the pork belly, the julito's comeback, did I mention the fish tacos?
author: Mauricio C.

description: Totally worth the wait as we hadn't made a reservation, but worth making a reservation! Really yummy food and great service
author: Philippa G.

description:
YUM! Five stars in my books! :)

I came here for my birthday brunch with my friends. We had made reservations early afternoon on a warm Sunday and were seated right away. Very interesting and creative decor all around the restaurant! 

Grapefruit Mimosas: Very refreshing and delicious. It actually comes with a slice of grapefruit too! Would be back for some more! :)

Mexican Benedict Eggs: Came with two eggs over fried organic corn gorditas and refried beans. I was surprised at how big the portion was. This dish was the least of my favorite as it was not amazing to me.

Tuna Tacon: MY FAVORITE! The seared albacore tuna was DELICIOUS and FRESH. Each order comes with two tacos. Highly recommended ordering. :)

Avocado Toast: Also, super delicious, except the toast was a little bit hard. Instead of slices of avocado, the avocado is made like a guacamole. Very creamy. What really surprised me was the smoked trout mixed in the guacamole. It was a perfect combination! 

Carnitas: We originally didn't order this dish until we saw the table next to ours had ordered it. Cute set up of how it was served. Big portions and very flavorful carnitas! Loved how the carnitas were not dry; however, I didn't like the tortillas that came with it as much. When we ran out of tortillas, we ate the carnitas with the chips and it was a much better combination to be eaten with.

Prices are very reasonable. Service was excellent during brunch time. We even got our chips refilled two times. Definitely will be back for more when I have my tapas cravings especially when I'm in the area. :)
author: Philana C.

description:
Five stars all around. We sat at the bar and tried several of their inventive cocktails. My friends and I probably ordered 5-6 appetizers and loved them all. We also did the steak entree as an appetizer. 

The drinks were really well made and had good balance. The food was also very well done. We had tuna tacon, taco tropical, the kale salad,avocado panko taco and the empanadas. 

The food arrived promptly and service was good. Will definitely go back.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Yum yum! I like this little tapas place. The decor is eccentric and interesting. Dog statues everywhere hah. 

Had the Lorenita--the mezcal had a nice smokey taste but the citrus made it sweet and smooth.

Get the Tuna Tacon! Deliciously marinated tuna in a taco. Didn't think it'd be that flavorful and delicious but it was! I would definitely get that again. 

Crab croquetas are also very delicious and moist and the calamari sopes are also good. Some squid ink in there with the blue corn masa. It was goood but I still think the tuna tacon was my favorite of what we got. The carnitas was delicious but I was very full at that point. It was wrapped in banana leaves but I feel if it was cooked more in it, it would have a more infused flavor.

Overall, fun place and tasty bites!
author: Natalie M.

description: Quite interesting and unique decor, but the ambiance and overall experience at the restaurant was great. At a tapas place, you don't expect huge serving sizes, but portions here were bigger than expected. Food was very good, lots of vegetarian options. I really enjoyed the shishito peppers! Also the Michelada (basically a Bloody Mary but with beer) was quite good- which is not necessarily true for a lot of places in SF. Highly recommend!
author: Vineet J.

description:
Very eclectic and exciting restaurant in the heart of Mission.  Went here for wednesday night dinner. Reserve a seat as this place is pretty busy even on weekdays.

Tried the following drinks -
Mexican Zombie - Very nice, fruity and relaxing.
The Latina - Very refreshing. Good for people who like cocktails and minty flavours.

The following food items
Taco Tropical - This is why people come here! Amazing tacos. Serving size is small but its very flavorful. Very similar to the tacos in Austin, TX.
Panko Avocado Taco - Really nice vegetarian option.
Calamari and Octopus Gorditas - So-so,my least favorite dish of the evening. I like seafood but I'd stick to the tacos as they make that really well.

Perfect date-night spot especially if your in the mood for something different :)
author: Debjani B.

description:
Great restaurant! My wife and I came with our twin boys on a Saturday afternoon at 2.30 pm. The menu is nicely done and we really enjoyed the food. Ceviche was nicely done and fresh, the Guacamole was tasty and the pomegranate seeds add a nice touch. I had the avocado toast which was ok (the bread at the bottom was too hard to eat) and my wife had the beef taco. They were so good that I ordered some for me. Kids had the egg sandwich and they loved it. 
The cocktails were delicious and nicely done. 
The restaurant has a super good vibe and the service from Katira was very efficient. 
This is for sure a restaurant where we would go back.
author: G R.

description:
Great place for happy hour and dinner. Came here on a weekday with my friend and the tables filled up quick. Parking can be difficult around this area. 

The tacos were so yummy! The fish taco was served in a thinly sliced potato sheet instead of tortilla which was something I've never had before. The highly raved taco tropical was also a hit! The sauce topped it off! The ceviche was fresh and the crispy wonton like chips was a great. The carne asada was pan fried to perfection, super tender and juicy!!! The stuffed pepper on the side of the carne asada plate wasn't that good though it had a weird aftertaste, my friend and I took a bite and didn't eat the rest. But everything else was delicious! 

They also don't pick up the phone during work hours so make reservations online!
author: Jenny D.

description:
"A-OK" is the best way to put it. Lolo defines the "new Mission" and I am not the biggest fan. We got a couple drinks which both were good, but nothing special. The beef taco was good, but for the price, I could've had 6 elsewhere. The ceviche was pretty good also. I liked the decor and music a lot, but you need a reservation to come here for sure.

I will try to give this place another try with someone who is a huge fan, maybe I did not order the right things.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Loló is the kind of restaurant I get excited about going to.

Me: A Loló regular (been there a dozen times)

Food: Upscale + authentic Mexican with picture-perfect presentation and high quality ingredients. I always order the Taco Tropical to start and for brunch, any egg dish will hit the spot.

Drinks: They're known for their artisanal cocktails (brunch or dinner).

Ambiance: Eclectic decor you'll love to stare at. There are seats made of car parts, dogs with sombreros, a wall of paper boats and more inspiring art you'll discover at every glance.

Best time to go: Great for brunch and dinner. Reservations are competitive last minute, so either plan ahead or get there at a slow hour (you will be seated right away if you get there during the first hour of being open for brunch or dinner).

Must order: The Taco Tropical! It's almost a rule for me to order it anytime I'm there. It's also great for sharing, so I recommend it as a starter.
author: Sarah Z.

description: Fun atmosphere and interesting takes on traditional mexican. The different fish tacos are super flavorful and perfect at lunch.
author: Cesar R.

description: Loved everything we had there. I had the avocado toast and it was lovely. Trout on the toast was just perfect but most importantly, the way they had poached the bread in olive oil was a surprising twist.
author: Aneeta N.

description:
My friend and I walked past this place one Sunday morning and decided to try this place out instead of the place we were originally headed to. We were greeted at the door and brought to our table quite quickly.

Once we sat down and decided on our food and drink, it took a long time to get someone to come take our order. Our waiter came over. . .and was not very nice from the get-go. He was very standoff-ish and quite rude, but I didn't think anything of it at first. My friend and I had both ordered orange juice, and we both took sips of our drink. HOWEVER, they had served my friend spoiled orange juice. Though mine was fine, his juice had started to ferment and was carbonated due to this. Not cool. So we had them swap out the juice for another one. Again, our waiter was not very nice about it and had given us some bullshit excuse. 

Our food came out and it wasn't anything special. We got the chilaquiles and huevos rancheros. We finished eating and wanted to get the bill so we could leave. Our waiter had seen that we were finished with our food, as he had been walking in our area and stopped by the tables next to ours several times. But he did not acknowledge us or even look our way. We had been trying to get his attention for at least 15 minutes and then he had snubbed us when we said excuse me while he was standing at the table next to us. 

I don't know what his problem is, but we will not be returning. Honestly, the two stars were just for the decor.
author: Stephannie S.

description:
Loved our meal!
Apps: shishito peppers (do not miss these - the smoky flavor is fantastic with your cocktail, beer, or whatever you are drinking), Brussels sprouts roasted  with hazelnuts (to die), and guacamole. 
Shared: lamb sliders with mushroom sauce (even the rolls were fabulous), carnitas (the pork melts in your mouth), and beef tacos (tender and flavorful steak with a delicate sauce served on the side). 
I had a mezcal mule and really enjoyed the flavor. It was just the right amount of tart/not too sweet. My daughter had the "two birds one stone"  and described it as "refreshing". 
The decor is fun. One wall is decorated with car doors, another with flower-filled straw handbags, there are ceramic dogs over the bar and front door. Adorable. 
I live in NY... Next time I visit SF I'd love to come back to this great spot!
author: michelle g.

description:
Great music, good vibes, awesome food. Definitely my new go-to dinner place to take my friends to when they visit me in the city! I can't even remember everything I ate when I came, but I do remember that everything was amazing! Highlights included the ceviche, pork belly, steak, and octopus.

I recommend making reservations, as I had to wait about thirty minutes for a table on a Saturday night. Even if you have to wait, however, I guarantee it'll be worth it! Will come back again soon!
author: Trisha V.

description:
Stopped by for lunch/brunch on a Sunday morning and got the avocado toast as well as the taco tropical. I wasn't much of a fan of the avocado toast--while it came with generous portions of avocado, it had pieces of trout that didn't seem quite fresh, exacerbated by the capers that highlighted these fishy flavors. 

The taco tropical was a unique take on a traditional taco, using a large slice of daikon radish in place of a tortilla. While I thought there was too much relish piled on, I thought the flavors worked and liked the crunchiness the panko brought to the shrimp. 

Overall, the restaurant itself is cute and decorated very nicely, but unfortunately, the food was quite mediocre.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Goods: pork belly (recommend 3-4 dish for 2 pp)
Parking: found free street parking 7pm Wednesday
Line: do a reservation a day in advanced
Service: very attentive, energetic, polite

Came here on a date with a lovely lady.  Arrived half hour before so we walked to the book store and back.  Got seated fairly quick at our reservation time.  

Dim lighting, close atmosphere, unique decorations on the wall.  

Food came quickly when ordered.  We had brussel sprouts, beef tacos, crab croquetta, and pork belly.  The pork belly was out favorite.  And the size of the plates were very appropriate.  

Thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  Felt we had our own area and was served well.  

Recommend it for a date or small gathering with close friends.


(Had trouble getting internet connection)
author: Simon L.

description:
We went to Lolo for our anniversary dinner. We had to make reservations 2 weeks in advance, but it was worth it. 
The atmosphere is very welcoming and cheerful and the food is delicious, sharing style. 
I recommend the beet salad, very tasty.
author: Juliana S.

description:
GOOD EATS AND DRINKS
(5 stars)

Instead of working out, working late, or going to bed... There is always time for good eats and drinks.

The mixologists are on point with those cocktails. Do not pass up the menu. They fine tune the cocktails to make them very enjoyable. The food is tapa style so expect small plates but enough to share (if willing). 

SANGRIA - yum! Wasn't the thick deep red wine and fruit you typically see. It was clear, similar to kool-aid punch. Light in flavor, not bold, however the buzz hits very well.

LA DAMA - yum! Prettiest drink ever. I'd get this a lot "that would be a drink you order". Pink, "fufu", sweet and creamy, and a flower on top. YES!! I am all about beverages with flowers. It is VERY much me.

CHIPS AND SALSA - nice crunchy chips and not oily. They provide two kinds of dipping sauce... Red and orange-red. Spicy, just a little but nothing overwhelming.

CRAB COQUETA - four pieces. Dungeness crabs. Great flavor and texture. After two pieces I was getting full, the filling is very filling. Recommended.

TUNA TACON - two tacos. OHMY! this was SO good it made my eyes roll in the back of my head. Please, slap me back to reality. Well executed piece of tuna on a tortilla drenched with amazingness. The orange sauce was the perfect pairing for the tuna and the soft tortilla. The tuna was not fishy and you can tell it was fresh. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. 

Will I be back? You don't have to ask me twice.

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description: Tacos Tropical and carne asada was SOO good. Drinks are strong, vibe is chill though a little loud fot a romantic date. Great food, freat drinks.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Truly a diamond in the rough kind of place. The decor was warm and fun and food and service were great!

I came with a friend who has a gluten allergy, but that was not a problem here. Lolo offers a great selection of tapas that are gluten free.

For the two of us, we ordered 4 items and were stuffed! The brussel sprouts were nicely roasted, the hazelnuts offered a nice earthy tone and texture to the dish. My favorite was probably the octopus. It was perfectly cooked and the arugula and potato puree offered a nice bitter and sweet note to the dish. Definitely a place I'd come back to. Only problem was that I was too full to order desserts...
author: Swan L.

description: Adequate, but certainly not special. I would agree with a previous reviewer who commented that the hostess was very welcoming and gracious but the server was inattentive and scattered/overwhelmed. The tables were tightly spaced, leaving the server's butts literally in our faces when they served the next table. For our anniversary dinner, which the hostess knew about, it would have been nice to have been treated slightly special. Yes, the tropical fish tacos were delicious....but over in one bite, and not worth our huge bill. The rest of the food was meh.
author: Michele K.

description:
YUMMMM. I feel like you can't go wrong with anything on this menu and everything is so reasonably priced. My 3 friends and I ate here, split 8 tapas, spent about 30$ per person, and were comfortably full. 

Highlights were definitely the tacos. They made my mouth so happy! I would definitely recommend this place to other people.

My only blegh was the decorations were a little too eclectic to the point where they clashed. One of their booths is decorated with XXXL men's suit jackets and I kept thinking the women sitting in the booth had these wrapped around their shoulders. 

Their food though makes up for any beef I could ever have with the restaurant.
author: Angela L.

description:
OMG yum yum yum yum!!!!

First, I give it props for the fusion twists.
Second, I give it props for the hipster decor.
Third, I give it props for the delicious cocktails.

Lastly, lets give an encore to the food.
The Fish Taco on Jicama is amazing, as well as the Lamb Brioche Sliders.
The crab croquettas were also good. similar to a potato ball. Still fairly relative to latin cuisne. (cuban potato balls)

I have to come back here to try the brussel sprouts and empanadas.
author: Jackie M.

description:
Wish I had the chance to try this place out. Made a reservation over a week ago for 3 people at 9 pm. Arrive at 9 and the server greets me and says it shouldn't be more than 10 minutes because my take is waiting right now. The entrance Isnt big so I stepped right outside the door. 

I watch a table on the left get up and leave and then I watch her seat a group that just walked in randomly after me. She comes back after seating then and looks a bit shocked when she sees me. Then has the audacity to ask me if my whole party is here...yet... they were standing right next to me. 

Then as if she was doing me a huge favor and didn't just seat a walk in group at the table I reserved,  she says im going to get you this great booth. The booth she gestures to still had drinks on the Yankee and fishy even have their bill. After another 10 minutes wait she asked if we wanted to sit at the bar.  

Unprofessional,  made reservations for no reason and she should have just apologized instead of thinking we were stupid and trying to play it off. 

Went across the street to Dosa for amazing service,  food and drinks.  Too bad because I was looking forward to Lolo and was hyping it up to my sister and friend.
author: Jannies L.

description: The service is excellent. They seated us quickly and the waiter made sure we were comfortable. My favorite dish that we tried was the mushroom empanada. I also really loved the avocado taco! The ambience was nice and interesting but it does get loud in the evening!
author: Divya V.

description: The ceviche was delicious. The two birds one stone wasn't overly sweet on a warm day. The boyfriend had the breakfast burrito, but felt it was too greasy. I'd definitely come back for drinks and brunch and that ceviche! The restaurant had a very laid back fun vibe. I didn't feel out of place in my work out clothes, but would feel equally comfortable in heels and a cute romper or dress for Sunday brunch.
author: Aleyna S.

description:
A total gem!  The staff, the food, the feel of the restaurant were all so yummy and welcoming. Be sure to try a cocktail, they excel there too. 
I highly recommend the octopus tacos and ceviche.
author: Carrie C.

description: Great place when you can get a reservation. I started going here when they are at the other location. I'm sad the other restaurant closed down. Lolo you are great. Can you reopen the other place where I use to be able to walk in and get a seat?? Why did you close the other location??
author: Robin K.

description:
Came here for brunch. I wasn't expecting much, but but the food was good. Service is a bit slow and off. Our waitress asked if we wanted certain items first and we said yes, but everything came out of order anyways. Had to ask for straws twice, but it never came so we went to the bar to get it ourselves. 

For the food:

Salsa and chips on the house-delish! I didn't know we get that so I ordered the guacamole with cotija cheese and it was really good. Creamy and flavorful!

CROISSANT FRENCH TOAST Maple syrup and mixed berries-this wasn't bad, but basically it looked like a smashed croissant and they dipped it in egg. 

SHISHITO PEPPERS Sautéed in olive oil, maldon salt-love these little suckers

TACO TROPICAL Panko and spice-dusted shrimp, topped with a tropical relish and spicy aioli-the shrimp was crispy and the sauce was really good with this. 

AVOCADO TACO w/ SMOKED TROUT-perfection! Who doesn't love avo toast.Pretty good portion.
author: Karen H.

description:
Great service, unique atmosphere, and good eats

Some of the standouts are the ceviche and the grilled Octopus over purple purred potatoes (which I thought was pretty great) but having the tiramisu was close to a religious experience hahah!  The tiramisu is served in little bowls with chocolate on the side (never seen it served this way) and it was really really good.  One portion can be shared by two but trust that you'll be fighting over the mascarpone/cream mixture.  Some of the things I'd pass on next time would be the razor clams which I thought were a bit lost amongst the cheese/chorizo mixture. Also I prefer my salsa chunkier but that might just be personal preference.

Everybody here from the hostess to the servers were very friendly and attentive.  Even though there was a bit of a wait and people were constantly trying to get a seat, we never felt service hurt or were rushed by any of the staff.  

I'd recommend everyone who likes Tapas bring a friend, make a reservation and please have some tiramisu.
author: David P.

description: Great food, great service. One area of improvement is to have the ability to manage reservations. Had a reservation for 9.45.. got seated only at 10.10. Need to figure out how to manage the book.
author: Vignesh R.

description: Delicious tacos and drinks! Beautiful interior and good service.
author: Astrohfiziks A.

description: I tipped more than 20% for "so-so" service (I usually round up from 20%) and found that an additional $1.00 was added to my charge when I got my credit card bill! I wrote clearly $36.00 and was charged $37.00.  Not a lot of $ but felt taken advantage of.
author: Kathy C.

description:
EDIT - after reading this review, the owner actually contacted me and said he'd look into it; that counts for something!  (I still haven't actually eaten there, but I will probably give it a try sometime!)

---

Thoroughly obnoxious hostess. I understand that Mission Hot Spots have a wait; but it doesn't excuse rudeness when you grossly underestimate a wait time. (and really, how difficult is it to estimate? Seems predictable. I think the underestimate is probably intentional to make the place seem HOT!!)

No thanks! 

If you enjoy smugness and attitude, this is definitely your spot! But otherwise, steer clear.
author: Anna D.

description: Overpriced not so satisfying drinks. I was expecting sooooo much more from a $12 Sangria and house margarita. Nothing to write home about when it comes to cocktails.  The Tuna tacos were excellent.  Appetizers  were as expected. Food runner was on his phone unless he had food in front of him. Where's the manager?
author: Vanessa G.

description: Awesome find in SF. We loved the ahi tuna tacos. Highly recommend you order many of the dishes and share!
author: Beth N.

description:
4.5 stars for the congenial staff! You can definitely get cheaper Mexican food in the Mission but if you want something more refined with a fun, lively atmosphere you will lolo mi' LoLo!! LOL 
Service at the bar was a bit lax but super friendly. If you don't believe pigs can fly, try the pork belly with a side of house made tortillas OMG! The octopus came highly recommended but it will have to wait until next time. The guacamole was a little flat and required a lemon spritz and some salsa for my taste. However, the peanut salsa was sublime and the brilliant cacahuate more than made up for the dull aguacate. So much for my translations, get to LoLo and figure the rest out for yourself. I'll be a regular. Hasta la vista en LoLo.
author: James G.

description:
I came here with my friend for dinner on a weeknight. The wait wasn't bad at all, and we were promptly seated. 

We ordered four plates to share among the two of us. The chips and salsa they bring out to each table were great. I was a big fan of the chip basket. We ordered the fried brussels sprouts, ceviche, ahi tuna tostada (their special of the day), and the guacamole. The fried brussels sprouts were great - the zinfandel vinaigrette and the hazelnuts were amazing. The tuna tostada was also good - the perfect crunch with well-marinated fish. The guacamole was standard guac, but I did like the added touch of cotija cheese. The ceviche was the least memorable in my opinion. I like seafood, but the fish in the ceviche was not tender enough for me. I also thought the citrus flavor overpowered everything in the bowl of ceviche. I did enjoy the peppercorns, though.

Definitely coming back here!
author: Steph V.

description:
In the trendy chic gentrified area of the mission on Valencia street. Went for my birthday dinner. The interior was colorful and fun with dim lighting. The drinks were tasty, strong and unique with an extensive mezcal and tequila list. Wasn't focusing too much on the prices since it was my birthday but I think the drinks were around 13-15 which is sort of pricy! 

In my opinion they brought the food out too quickly. I prefer a tapas places that knows how to slow down the pace of bringing the dishes out and let you sit back, relax, and enjoy. 

I wouldn't really call it mexican food, even though most of the stuff on the menu was somehow a taco. Nonetheless, the food was tasty. Not award winning food but definitely felt happy/satisfied that I went there on my birthday. They brought me a happy birthday mezcal shot which was also really nice.

5 of us left the place each having paid 40 bucks (including tax and trip) for a drink, and several shared tapas (I think we ordered 7 dishes and the 5 of us). I left very satisfied but not stuffed (better to leave that way, in my opinion).

I would say they could improve on their calamari dish and the seared tuna taco.
The brussel sprouts were tasty, the guac was good, and the ceviche was fresh.
The tropical taco was tasty as well and the deep-fried crab something (I forgot the name) was really nice too.
author: Victoria T.

description: Loved this place! Delicious food, fun ambiance, and superb service. We definitely plan to come back!!
author: Erika M.

description:
Searching for a last minute brunch spot in The Mission is no easy feat! I came across Lolo and thought tapas with cocktails seemed like a perfect alternative to your typical mimosa brunch. It was a wonderful choice--got to sample so many tasty dishes without committing to one thing!

Reservations were easily made via Opentable. Seriously restaurants, please utilize this feature! It's so much more convenient than calling and I can forward reservation info to my friends if they get to the restaurant before me. 

I loved the bright, quirky decor in here. There's an entire wall decorated with origami hats and chandeliers made out of bike handlebars! Talk about eclectic. This is definitely a more intimate restaurant. I was able to grab a spot for my party of 3 on a Saturday morning and avoided the busier lunch rush. 

My favorites:
+ Brussels sprouts...in love with the tangy zinfandel vinaigrette with toasty hazelnuts
+ Empanadas...fresh mushrooms enveloped in a cheesy goodness
+ Taco tropical...great spicy aioli sauce and I was amused by the innovative use of daikon wrapper
+ Crab croquetas...consistency was almost like fried potato puffs and they paired well with the aioli sauce. Just wish there was more crab meat!

Get your drink on:
+ Mezcal cocktails..a different twist on the margarita using organic Mezcal
+ Agua fresca...like a refreshing tropical vacation in your mouth

Tips:
- Make a reservation, it does get busier around noon
- Service slowed down during the lunch rush, so it's helpful to give a gentle reminder to the waitress about what dishes you're waiting on

I braved the rain and wind for a few blocks and wouldn't hesitate to do it again, especially for those empanadas!
author: Bonnie Z.

description: Came here for Easter brunch and got a table with a very short wait. Food was excellent: loved the ceviche and the chile verde pork! The margaritas are very good too. Service was great! Love the salsa verde! Will be back!
author: Cynthia N.

description:
Lolo's moved to an expanded location a few months ago, just a block away from it's original spot. Their new location is super cute and often crowded. I had visited Lolos prior to the move and recall it being overrated, I admit this was my second choice since beretta had a 2+ hour wait. 

I returned tonight and was pleasantly surprised by the food, especially because many reviewers noted the quality having gotten worse since the move. I was especially impressed by their popular tacos tropical which were flavorful and fresh at the same time! And the best part was that the dishes were reasonably priced. 

* TACOS TROPICAL ($9) - 5 STARS:
Panko and spice-dusted shrimp, topped with a tropical relish and spicy aioli. The aioli was creamy and flavorful in all the right ways. The jicama was a tortilla replacement that added crunch and freshness to the taco. What a surprising but delicious taco - I could eat this every day. 

WONTON RAVIOLI WITH HUITLACOCHE AND REQUESON ($13) - 1.5 STARS: 
Huitlacoche and requeson stuffed wonton ravioli with basil and arugula sauce and pine nuts. The arugula sauce was way too bitter for me and the filling didn't match the ratio to the wonton ravioli. 

GRILLED GRASS-FED ANGUS BEEF TACOS ($12) - 3 STARS:
Grilled kobe beef tacos, hand-made flour tortillas, avocado, habanero infused radishes. This tasted mostly like a regular taco that you could get at any of the mission taquerias except the flour tortillas were noticeably fresh and delicious when topped with the complimentary salsas. 

TUNA TACON ($10) - 3.5 STARS:
Seared albacore tuna, shellfish aioli, avocado, roasted tomatillo sauce on the side. This was my second favorite dish of the night, which tasted similar to the taco tropical, except it was filled with a block of tuna instead of shrimp and on a flour tortilla. 

Affordable wine, complimentary chips and salsa, a variety of solid tapas, Lolos is better than I remember! I can't wait to come back for their popular croquettes, lamb sliders, desserts, and artisan cocktails!
author: Jess C.

description:
Lolo would have received 5 stars from me based on food alone.  Which is why it is so unfortunate that this 2 star review stems from our service and overall experience.

My group arrived at Lolo at our reservation time, 8 PM.  We were told it would be "just a few minutes".  This turned into about 25 minutes.  I usually can sympathize that certain tables love to hang out and hold up tables.  However, we continually saw staff sitting at these cleared tables chatting with their friends.  This was the beginning of the end for us.

Once we finally were seated, it was another 10 minutes before anyone greeted our table.  We did not even receive a "Hi guys, I'll be with you in a minute," there was no interaction.  We kept watching servers and busboys fly by our table.  Then once our waitress came over she expected us to have our drink and food orders ready and did not provide a chance for us to ask any questions.  We quickly placed our drink order and a few small plates.

The food came out very quickly and was DELICIOUS!  Seriously some of the best food I have ever had.  I loved the octopus, the flautas, the guac, the diabla shrimp, and tacos.  Seriously everything was so good and not one complaint regarding the food.  Another downer was that we had all of this yummy food, but no drinks. We had a clear view of the bartenders shaking up margs all night, but ours took quite a while.

Although my drink was delicious, my friend ordered something that she didn't quite love.  When she offered to just order something different, the waitress seemed very personally offended and then "forgot" to ring in her next order.

Overall, nothing was coming out at the right times and constantly being ignored or feeling like an imposition is not fun.  Honestly, I wanted the food to make up for the lack of service, but we just could not get past it.
author: Allison P.

description:
Atmosphere: Overall, really liked the atmosphere.  Our booth was next to a poll so it was difficult for one side to enter/exit booth.  Keep in mind when submitting reservation.

Service: Not the fastest service but I was there at 1p on Saturday and it was pretty busy.  Reservation of four and two friends arrived early and ordered.  Took our server about five minutes to realize we sat down and we're ready to order.

Food: absolutely wonderful.  I thought their dishes were perfect combination of flavor and spice (keep in mind I'm more of a mild to medium spice).  Food was delivered very quick!
author: Cory L.

description: Aaaaamazing...Everything that I have tried here has been great. Favorites have been the shrimp tacos and the queso dip.
author: Adam H.

description: Read the reviews about making reservations first, so I definitely did that before coming here. It was packed! Even with reservation it took forever to sit down and order. Food came much later and they either messed up my calamari, or it was just badly prepared. The calamari was super tough, almost like jerky. Overall, lolo's a fine place that's just not worth the touble.
author: John O.

description: I have been here probably about 5 times now and always enjoy the food. The service is great and the hostess is always very friendly and works her butt off. Fun drinks too!!!
author: Theodore S.

description: 3 STARS for the loud high-pitch yeller two girls sitting next to us.  The food was 4 starts and the service 4.5 starts.  However, the tables were so close together (like a 1.5-2" next to each other). "The owner wants to maximize the space" as we were informed by a hostess.  The people next two us were completely unaware of their surroundings.  We couldn't enjoy the meal and had to run out of the table.  Most likely won't be coming back.  This was Tuesday night.
author: Viktoriya Z.

description: Wow.  Food and service was fantastic.  Had the best fish tacos ever!!!  Can't wait to go back. again.
author: Dennis W.

description: Delightful environment, delicious food, so I'll definitely be going back! My friend took me to this place because it's one of her favorite restaurants. From the moment you walk in the decor is tons of fun and the hostess was super friendly. She said our table would be ready shortly but when she realized the guests were still lingering after closing out she brought us the drink menu so that the drinks would be ready when we sat down. We ordered the kale salad, empanadas, and panko avocado tacos. Delicious! The salsas that came with the chips were also amazing because one was slightly sweet and the other one was tangy. I left feeling comfortably full and not regretting my poor life choices which is rare for me when it comes to food.
author: Arelys V.

description:
I've been here twice. Here are my thoughts:

1. It gets busy, even on a Tuesday night when I was there last. Hit it before 6 pm to increase your chances of scoring a space at the kitchen table. I personally enjoy watching my food (and everyone else's) being prepared. 

2. It gets noisy. I would rather sit at the kitchen table, then sit in the regular tables. Of course, this only works if you don't have any more than two people in your party.

3. The food is good. Dishes I'd order again:
*kale salad
*portobella empanadas
*brussel sprouts (lost count how many the chef prepped last night)
*octopus. I can't remember what the dish was called, but it was pink and green and tasty.

4. The mezcal bar menu is excellent, particularly the Mezcal Mule and the Gin and Tonic. 

5. Service is good. We were never forgotten.

6. Fun Fun Fun atmosphere. I love lively, energetic places with good food and drink.
author: Virg Y.

description:
Yumm Yumm Yumm. The chips and Salsa are really why I come here.
Its also super cute and the panko avocado tacos are amazing and
I havent really had anything else like them here in SF.
I highly recommend for a morning after brunch ;)
author: Amanda B.

description:
LOVE. I went on a Wednesday night and had reservations for 6PM. The reservation is a must even on a Wednesday! Right after we were seated, there was a line outside the door. I can definitely see why. 

We ordered the Tropical taco, Romaine Lettuce salad, Pork belly, ceviche, lamb sliders, and Mexican vanilla ice cream for dessert.

The BEST dish of the night had to be the Tropical Taco. They came as a pair in soft shell tortillas. It is a tropical flavor blast in your mouth! 

The Romaine Lettuce salad is quite refreshing after eating a dish like the pork belly and lamb sliders. I thought the pork belly was just okay. My mom makes a better pork belly dish. And the lamb slider was bigger than other sliders that I've seen. It was just okay too. 

The Ceviche is ceviche and this was delicious. 

DESSSERT. I always have room for dessert. The Mexican vanilla ice cream with churro cinnamon sticks and caramel. It was huge and way enough to fill two people. It hit the spot! 

I would definitely come back :)
author: Priscilla T.

description:
THIS PLACE IS AWESOME

The ambiance is very fiesta-like: loud latin music with fun/colorful decor everywhere. I will say that if you know you want to dine here, MAKE A RESERVATION WELL IN ADVANCE. I ended up waiting with a friend for over an hour, thankfully the food was well worth the wait, but we came very close to calling it quits during the wait.

The food...WOW. So much flavor, it was unbelievable. I'm a guy that likes to stuff his face, so during the wait, I noticed all the tapas come with two portions, so I was very skeptical. We ordered the guacamole, taco tropical, pork shoulder, carnitas, and lamb sliders. All of which were delicious, minus the lamb sliders. But the lamb sliders might've been a little distasteful for me, due to the fact that I was pretty full at the time. I found it to be a little on the heavy side, but I'm sure I would've devoured it had we received the dish at the beginning of the meal instead of the end.

If you're looking to order cocktails and you like whiskey, order The Player.

My only criticism is that regulars get preferential treatment, which I feel is wrong. The only reason I know this is because I can speak spanish and understood what was being said when this guy started chatting it up with the lady working, as if she was his sister or something. 

Overall
- MAKE RESERVATIONS
- Great Ambiance
- Great Food
- Cocktail to Order: The Player (if you like Whiskey)
- The sliders are a little heavy
- The young hostess is beautiful, haha.
author: Aaron C.

description: First time going and I loved it! Ambiance is so great. Very quirky decor and fun lighting fixtures. But above all, the food and drinks were fantastic. I had the Bengal Mutiny cocktail and it was soooo good. We also ordered the guacamole, quesadillas, tuna tacon (my favorite) and the carne asada. Everything was cooked perfectly. The only complaint I have is that our waiter only stopped by to take our order and drop our check. Our table was never crowded with dirty dishes but it was always a bus boy coming to drop our food or clean the table.
author: Sydney N.

description: Fantastic Mexican restaurant, beautiful decor, great service and amazing food with lots of vegetarian options! We had the soup, jicama salad and empanadas which was excellent. Hip trendy restaurant with great music. It is not easy to find a great Mexican restaurant, Would come back again and highly recommend.
author: Mihir M.

description:
Came here on a Monday night- was surprised by the number of people who were here! In a sketchy-ish part of the mission- did not feel very comfortable walking here from the bus station at around 6pm. Very eclectic decor, makes for a fun atmosphere- would recommend this place for dates rather than larger group gatherings.

Overall, all tapas we ordered pretty good. Very nice waiters/ waitresses, bartenders, etc. However, my pet peeve about tapas places is always the fact that the food is expensive and the servings are small! We ended up paying around $80 for 6 tapas plates + 3 agua frecas. 

Tapas, in order of preference:
(+) taco tropical.
served on daikon like vegetable instead of a traditional tortilla
(+) mezcal bbq gorditas
blue corn masa pockets are very well done and perfectly thick; fits the amount of toppings well.
(+) fried brussel sprouts.
your hated vegetable as a child turned delicacy. 
(+) tuna tacon.
good, but nothing special- think "tuna tower" from osha thai
(+) pistachio crusted salmon.
most anticipated (and expensive) plate we ordered, but disappointedly the least distinctive! 
(+) croquetas.
very heavy, not what was expected. 1/2 is all you need if you must try.

try also the pineapple agua fresca as mentioned above.
author: Patricia K.

description:
Love this restaurant. Every item we had was exactly as the ingredients were mentioned in the menu, and amazingly delicious. The service was great and so friendly. Multiple servers and employees gaged us for conversation.

So now the food:
- flautas were delicious. Very airy, classy chalupa with the perfect texture of cheese.
- fried Brussels sprouts: definitely my favorite. Crunchy and soft at the same time 
- fried avocado Panko - how did they batter it so well?!
- bean rancho soup - so creamy and tasty! Had a sweet savory taste to it. 
- beet salad - not gonna lie, my least favorite because it was very acidic but still delicious.

5-star service and flavor.
author: Raakin H.

description:
I've been here for dinner, but this was my first time for brunch. I was impressed. We had 2 plates of tacos, the chorizo scramble, the pork butt, the chilaquiles, and the huevos rancheros on the table. Everyone loved their food!

A few of us had cocktails: mimosa, bloody mary, and the carrot juice drink, which was a surprising crowd favorite.

Will definitely be back!
author: Andrew K.

description: This place was recommended by someone who knows I love food and it sure was great! The restaurant gets loud (Sat night around 8:00 pm) but the moose is not bothersome when food and drinks are great. We had tacos (carne asada) for the kids, margarita mezcal and traditional margarita for the adults, we also ordered octopus and queso fundido. Is Mexican with a twist but still Mexican and great flavor.
author: Mary A.

description: Came here with some friends to grab a cocktail as we waited on the rest of our group. Cocktails were very unique and tasty, but a tad on the pricey side. That being said, they're worth it. Loved the decor of the place as well, once again very unique. I'd come back the next time I'm in SF and looking for a well crafted cocktail.
author: Summit P.

description: Fantastic. One of my favorite places in the mission for Mexican food. Carnitas, carne asada, tuna tacón, tacos, Brussels sprouts, the list goes on. Everything is great and will keep you coming back.
author: David S.

description:
This place is so cute, very eclectic decor and a lively atmosphere. As for the food, it's less traditional Spanish tapas and more Latin style fare. We had a vegetarian with our party of 4 and this place has tons of veggie options, and they're also very good. 

We shared the corn, the ceviche, guac, taco tropical, the pork belly, flutas, mushroom empanadas, and the horchata mousse. Everything on the menu was good, the standouts were the corn, the tacos, and the empanadas. 

All in all, a great experience and I'll definitely be back. I was fortunate to make a reservation because the place gets packed and we saw a lot of people coming in trying to get a table.
author: Alice W.

description:
We love the decor here. They have such a unique and style, we can deny and admire their sense of decoration and believe it or not, it makes their food taste even better, when you look around and eat their food at the same time. 

   And their foods are pretty good also, I can't say it's real Mexican food. It's more like a fusion but definitely good. 

    The only complain ( or maybe two ) is the price and the portion of their food. I would say ... their price is a bit high, consider the size of the portion. So if you come here and want one meal disc with a great prize to fill you up. We are in the WRONG PLACE. 

   I would say this is more like a trendy place that young people come and meet and hang out and drink and go though at least 4 -5 orders, just to ease their hunger.... 


   Well, i would say, try this place, it's fun but i am not sure this is the place where you will come every week for your main dinner meal....  it's too expensive, too small of a portion to make it regular dinner place....
author: Dom G.

description:
Ate here for dinner with a bunch of friends and we  had a good time. Only comment is this place portion size is quite small so you end up ordering a bunch of different plates to munch on. 
I don't remember what we ordered but it was sky since there was 6 of us. This place could get packed too so we were seated outside which was kind of cold. Not to mention the bums all around walking by , asking for $$ and all we can do is share our food but they instead they refuse to have it. 
Anyway,this place is good but I have had better tapas in other places in the city.
author: Claudine V.

description: First time trying this place... my reason why on the 3 stars is the service. I would put 2 or even 1 star but I'm being NICE here. The food turned out to be good and delicious... the problem turned out to be the host! When visiting San Francisco, I was recommended to a couple of spots and this one being on the list. Of course, when going out on a weekend, it can get busy and you would need to wait to be seated. Totally fine... what I'm NOT fine with is being pushed away and not treated equal just as those who were walking in after us. Yes some parties did have reservations but others that came in hours after we were waiting to be seated, were seated right away. I was curious and asked about our situation and why did the party who came in over an hour just got sat before us. The HOST was hesitant and mentioned that they had a reservation... she tried to show me the list and told me the name. The name she said was not on the list!! I'm not a complainer and don't like to shut down people or leave a bad review but to be treated like this, lied too and pushed away isn't great customer service. When listening to the host, she would talk to me as if I was bugging her, acting very highly. But when it came down to people she knew, she treated them as royalty! Like I said, food was delicious but my experience was very disappointing and it was unprofessional. I'm being nice here.
author: Crystal M.

description:
Overrated for sure. Husband and I stopped in on date night. Started off with cocktails, which were decent. I'd highly recommend the "two bird one stone" actually. But starting with the chips and salsa, uf. 

The green salsa was really tart, like almost unbearably so! The corn we ordered was swimming in crema, when I am used to my Mexican corn slathered in mayo, lime, chili and cotija. The corn was also steamed/boiled, which was disappointing. The rest of our food, avocado tacos and flautas were also subpar. The taco had that same too tart salsa in excess, but would have been delicious if used in super moderation. And the flautas were just insipid, and the cheese was burnt to inedible at the ends. 

If we were to come back, it'd be for the drinks but not really. Sad day, everything looked so promising!
author: Archana P.

description:
Yeah, its loud. The later on you get, you need something like the "cone of silence" from the old GetSmart comedy series to communicate...or at least sign language. Great selection of small plates to share and inventive cocktails. Decent wine list. Beer list so-so. The Octopus was better than what I experienced while traveling in Greece...which is high praise indeed. Its a dish that tends to be rubbery when poorly prepared...this melted in my mouth like a filet. Even if people go "eww"...order it. You'll change minds.

Carnitas were beef instead of pork but didn't miss the distinction. They were excellent. The only miss was the jicama and orange salad. Jicama should not be the focus of any dish...its there to add crunch and is visually appealing. But twenty pieces?
author: Joe F.

description:
We showed up late without a reservation for dinner at Loló last night. The host was near the door and saw me trying to lock my bike, and offered to help out with the process - a great first impression. 

They were busy but we were able to sit near the door for roughly 15 minutes waiting for a table. The host was very accommodating and made sure that we were well looked after. 

After a short wait we were seated. We ordered 5 dishes to share, as well as drinks. The service was prompt and the food was great. The beef tacos and the pork belly were two of our favourites, provided you like coriander! 

The menu is a refreshing change with a great selection but not an overload of choice. The prices were on the high end for this type of dining but completely justified.
author: James M.

description: We started with the Taco Tropical, then we kept ordering, After three rounds of tapas, we were full. The menu is so creative, combining healthy and delicious meals that will keep you wanting more. It was fantastic.
author: Scott M.

description:
Had Saturday brunch here and loved all the tapas! As my daughter stated "there is a flavor explosion in your mouth with every bite!" We had the ceviche, super fresh and citrusy; the avocado toast, almost an entire avocado on each one; the pork butt on shoestring potato, crispy and ooo so satisfying; taco tropical, the most delicious mix of flavors and textures! More variable type of crispness than I've ever had in one bite (esp the unique jicama tortilla)

Can't wait to come back for dinner someday!!
author: M Y.

description:
It's rare for me to go to a restaurant, especially a tapas eatery, and be OK with ordering anything from the menu to share. Blame my picky palate on a "meat and potatoes" upbringing? Or maybe some people are more open to going into a meal relatively blind? Though my eating has become much more adventurous over the last few years, I usually have a "type" of dish and stick to it.

Not at Lolo. Everything sounded so good! Yes, I was especially hungry. Salads for lunch have that effect. Even if I went in relatively content in the stomach region, I'd still eat (and drink!) a boatload here. 

First and foremost, the drink menu is perplexing... in a good way! It's hard to pick one cocktail to start. Do I have a traditional margarita? What about the Lone Wolf? Or I could have a glass of rose? Settled for something in the middle: Started with a mezcal margarita at the beginning of the meal and ended with a glass of Syrah. Just enough booze to mellow out and enjoy a Wednesday dinner.

Here's just a few dishes that our group of 7 enjoyed:
+ GUACAMOLE
+ SQUID IN BLACK INK CROQUETAS
+ FRIED BRUSSEL SPROUTS

As well as several house specialities that night. One dish, whose name I somehow forget, consisted of octopus, bacon and beans. It was heavenly, my favorite of the night! Just goes to show you that going slightly out of one's foodie comfort zone can be a good thing.

Is Lolo good for groups? I'd say so! The restaurant is pretty large by SF standards, but definitely call ahead and reserve a booth. There's a clean/large bathroom for patrons, and I noticed they play island music inside (something like a rainforest CD from The Nature Store or maybe one of those Muzak stations for spas?) to relieve the jitters from those shy bladders out there. 

Definitely plan on returning, would be a wonderful spot for girl's night out or date night. In fact, if I were trying to woo someone into liking me more, Lolo is where I'd take them! Drinks will loosen you up and small plates force you to share. Also, it's a great opportunity to figure out whether or not your +1 is willing to try new things... See where I'm going with this?
author: Abby S.

description: Great meal and great service. We started with guacamole, ginger beer and some tasty white wine. I highly recommend the fish tacos, empanadas, kale salad (surprisingly light) and fantastic flan. The corn tortillas were authentically delicious and the corn on the cob was also a hit. The atmosphere and decor are hip and welcoming. The service was excellent-- the hostess and all the servers. I could go on and on. We'll be back!
author: Judith B.

description:
Excellent food, drinks, and ambience.

Went there for Halloween night and had a great time. What we tried

Margarita, n a couple of other cocktails we tried were great
Avocado tacos excellent 
Mushroom empanadas- best we have ever had
Veggie quesadilla was good as well
author: Ken G.

description: Delicious small plate Mexican. Kale salad and Brussel sprout salad's were excellent. The octopus the pork belly with mint Fried corn and Marston empanadas were very good. Good atmosphere but a little noisy and tight
author: Rob U.

description:
Shoutout to Yelp reservations for making it super easy to book a spot! Delicious food - even though there are only 2-3 pieces an order, it was enough to fill me up. 

We ordered the fish tacos, empanadas, and flautas. Would say the fish tacos and empanadas were my fave. Delicious cod with delectable sauces, and the empanadas were crispy and savory.

Also worth a stop just to check out the décor. If you want to see a wall of just car doors with no explanation, this is the spot.
author: Anna X.

description: The ambience at this place is awesome. The service is good and the drinks are good as well. The only reason I give Lolo 4 stars instead of 5 is that a lot of the food is just SO fried and SO cheesy. Way more than traditional renditions of some of these dishes to the point where it's almost not edible. While I understand this may just be a matter of preference and perhaps the restaurant intends for this, I enjoyed my experience at Lolo a little less because of how much oil and fat there was in every single dish.
author: Anushka M.

description: Incredible food that caused an audible response when eating it
author: Doug R.

description:
Yay! I finally tried this place, and it didn't disappoint!

My friend and I have gotten into the habit of having dinner together to celebrate both of our aging. This year, we decided to go to Lolo. Actually, I gave her a list of options and she picked Lolo. SO glad she picked it!!

We met up around 5:30, and didn't realize Lolo opened at 6. Was all good, as the neighborhood is now a place you can wander around a bit. When we got back at 6, there was already a LINE! Yes, a LINE at 6PM! But it was a relaxed line, and we made sure other people who were there before us got seated first. Because...its polite.

We were seated near the back, right near the restrooms. Normally, I would be a bit peeved by this, but the space was done in a way that didn't have bathroom-anxious people waiting right next to us. Awesome!!

Our waiter was super nice and helpful. We could only decide on a few items, and asked for his recommendation. He suggested their new menu item, a salmon al pastor taco, and we agreed. He also suggested 4 dishes for the 2 of us...which we did need to order another. We eat healthy, ok??

The food:
Beats: Delicious and super creative. The cream cheese looked like bits of fat on a delicious beat steak. If you're a vegetarian, you'd go crazy over this dish. I don't tend to eat fat on my steak, so it was a little strange for me not to carve out the cream cheese. But don't carve it out. Its delicious.

Shiseido Peppers: Roasted peppers. Salt. Amazing. They're NOT spicy, despite being peppers. They're just delicious. I could eat 3 plates of those things.

Tuna Tacon: on the menu, they warn you about it being raw, so I expected it to be a lot more rare than it was. It was still delicious (though I had expected more tuna flavor). 

Salmon Al Pastor: SO good. We didn't know, but we were evidently the first customers who got this dish. And it was SO good I'm surprised not more people had it. The salmon was fully cooked (no tuna tacon!), and the flavors were great. It WAS on the sweeter side, but I assumed that had to do with the pineapple sauce-thing they had on it. While we were leaving, the owner (or chef? Manager? somebody...) asked us how it was. He seemed so relieved to know we loved it!

Finally, the 5 add to our menu: Sopes with pork chin and oyster. It was really good, though the oyster was a little too giant for me. If you really like oysters, this is delicious for you. The oyster was the size of a child's hand. Seriously.

The ambiance is really cool. I'd recommend it for a first date, actually. If the person becomes dull, you can look at  or discuss the cool stuff on the walls. The waiters were STELLAR. Seriously. We were never low on water, and they changed our dishes quite frequently! All their staff were super friendly, and netted a significant tip from us. =)
author: Lily W.

description:
My cousin and her boyfriend took me out last night for a belated birthday dinner and I'm glad they picked this place. It was AMAZEBALLS!! Its a friendly neighborhood joint and I will definitely be back when I'm around the mission. Anyways! It's a quirky, fun and down to earth atmosphere that serves... TAPAS!! Uh yes, my type of place. They don't have a crazy extensive menu either, so order a bunch of plates and enjoy with a cocktail. I will say that I didn't enjoy my Bloody Cesar though. It wasn't spicy enough and kinda sour. My cousin's drink on the other hand was delicious and refreshing. 

About the food... Empanadas are awesome. Lamb sliders are even more awesome. Carnitas are good and so are those grass fed angus beef tacos. Taco tropical was also amaze balls. Instead of a traditional tortilla, they use jicama. They fried the shrimp perfectly and dressed it well. Bow chicka wow wow. Best believe I'll be back.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
Great Atmosphere - awesome vibe. The Tuna Tacona was the BEST! Service was on point. 
We had the Kale Salad, Tuna Tacona, Fish tacos and the Pork Belly.  YUMMY YUMMY Appies! 

Make resos!  It is a busy place!
author: Kelli K.

description:
Loved it!
Two of us went for lunch relatively hungry and ordered 4 small plates plus one dessert and we were more than full when we left.  The favorite was the tuna tarcon--just amazing.  The least flavorful were the carnitas but after eating the tuna, shrimp and brussel sprouts, everything else would have paled in comparison anyway regarding flavor!  We finished with their version of ice cream sandwiches which comprised of small, soft almond cookies with espresso ice cream in between  and then covered in a melted bittersweet chocolate sauce.
Service by the waiters was topnotch!  The ambiance is mellow yet filled with vibrant colors and random artifacts--really interesting artistic choices!

TACO TROPICAL . . . 9.00
panko and spice-dusted shrimp, topped with a tropical relish and spicy aioli

TUNA TACON . . . 10.00
seared albacore tuna, shellfish aioli, avocado, roasted tomatillo sauce on the side

CARNITAS . . . 14.00
carnitas with organic blue corn tortillas, roasted tomatillo sauce, guacamole, pickled 
onions

FRIED BRUSSEL SPROUTS . . . 6.00
fried brussel sprouts, shallots, hazelnuts, late harvest zinfandel vinaigrette
author: Thomas D.

description: Food was delicious and staff so friendly, but the drinks needed a tad bit of work. Also the price was just too high for the food.
author: Josie L.

description:
This morning I awoke the happiest I'd been in a very very long time. There was something about the sun shining that made my heart happy until I was greeted by a Lolo's waiter. 

With his name remaining unknown, he took our order, friendly, typical as usual until he eyed my Souvla salad placed, shoulder aligned on the right side of the table. It wasn't long before he motioned his manager and asked if my salad (which I was nibbling now) was ok for me to eat. Quickly, the manager replied and the waiter very clearly delivered the message to us, "Sorry guys, you cannot be eating outside food in here.". 

Now, why am I giving my all time favorite restaurant, of which I rave about to my visiting friends, a one star rating? Because in the midst of our current political and geological disasters, SOMEONE managed to ruin and prohibit the consumption of a neighboring colleagues food EVEN THOUGH, myself and the individual with me, had ordered a generous amount of food. 

My heart sunk, my appetite faded and my loyal love for Lolo crumbled. I felt sickened that in a city of liberalism and love, capitalism still prevailed. I was reminded that individuals will always be money motivated and towards people unsensitized. Unsensitized in a way that the consumer's needs and desires will not be met if it costs the business money. I understand that, but could it be that a business for a second not worry about money, but in the people and doing what is morally correct? In setting the scenario more, it wasn't like there were stomachs of individuals ligned outside the door to eat. It was casual, hip, cool like any other Lolo brunch day. My intent in ordering Souvla and then going to Lolo was because my accompanying individual wanted Lolo and although I did too, I also wanted a salad from Souvla. Now, would it have hurt the waiter to allow me to eat my salad in peace and enjoy our brunch? Undoubtedly, it hurt Lolo because they just lost a loyal customer.

I am not proud to say that I had two chips of guacamole while I allowed my friend to eat, that out of rage I thought of cursing the waiter and its manager and that my sunny day ahead was ruined.

I am sensitive and you should be too with these things because we're living through an anthropocentric revolting history! If I thought my feelings were hurt and my power as individual undermined- the right to eat- imagine those who fear life, not because of the animal kingdom, but because of people. 

I want people to know that if it's not hurting them, and that if as human beings it's the nice thing to do, allow it. People need to be more relational and uniting! This was just a small piece in the puzzle of hatred we are living. I forgive the waiter and his manager. I thank the other waiter who was more than willing to try and make our brunch better, but I hope that my post is read and understood that these things go beyond just trying to eat an outside salad at Lolo. 

If you've read this far, thank you.

Selena
author: Selena O.

description:
YUM! 

My friends have always suggested to come here and was considering having my birthday here, but ended up elsewhere. However, this is a pretty good place. Damn. 

I ordered a bellini because you know sometimes, you need a drink. Bellini was decent, not the best one I've had, but then again, my favorite version is frozen (from Fat Tuesday). 

Regardless, I came for brunch to try their panko avocado taco. Fried avocado, onions and peppers in a taco. So good. When the avocado is fried, it's got this great crunchy outside, but then the inside is warm, gooey and silky.  Definitely a great dish to share and get. Free chips and salsa - always great!

The people next to me go the taco tropical and tuna tacon which both looked really good. Will have to try next time! 

Overall, cute little place. Very nice surroundings, beach scenes on the walls. Decent service. 

Protip: Get in early. Seems like they fill up quickly. But I went myself at around brunchtime and it was easy to be seated.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Highly recommend the fish tacos! 

A lot of people on a Friday night. I went at around 7pm, and the wait was 45 minutes. There's several bars/lounges close by, so I grabbed a drink with my friend while we waited. Space between the tables on the main floor at Lolo's was only a couple inches, so you're literally sitting next to the people at the next table. I like the boisterous, crowded atmospheres, so I didn't mind the closeness. There are some individual booths, but those get taken up earlier. There's also bar seating, but was full when I got there.
author: Leanna R.

description:
This delightful Mission tapas restaurant is just steps away from Esperpento one of my favorite tapas joint. What makes Loló  different is the culinary combination of Mexican and Turkish influence on the creative small plates. The chefs do a brilliant job mixing cross-cultural cuisine and spices, creating a completely solid dish that gives you a great dining experience.

Though the restaurant itself is quite small and very hard to move around without bumping the person seated next to you, but I can get over that since I really enjoyed the food here.  The wait was not too long! Service is quick what is not to love.

The Whimsical décor, including wallpaper made of Mexican lottery tickets, lends an unpretentious feel to the fine dining experience. 

Small Plates that stood out:
Octopus Tiradito ~ my favorite dish thinly sliced octopus, then topped w/ chili and sea salt. Carpaccio style was slightly chewy with a mildly smoky and citrusy taste. A must try!

Taco Tropical ~panko crusted shrimp w tropical relish and spicy aioli I savored each delicious bite!

Tuna tacon ~ was also a really pleasant mix of flavors. The guacamole was perfect and I loved the blue corn chips left me wanting more since it was only two pieces.

Lamb Sliders ~ were fabulous - tender and bursting with good lamby juices

Huitlacoche and Requeson~  a clever Mexican-Italian fusion substituting wontons for  pasta with pesto. The earthy huitlacoche and pine nuts helped round out the dish, and the sauce smooth, buttery and rich.

Empanadas ~ it was nice and light not heavy at all, flaky crust with an interesting blend of mushroom and oaxaca cheese

Angus Beef Tacos ~ subtly spiced, beef was tender making this one tasty taco!

Loló is not pretentious, not too noisy...it is an ideal place to sample the innovative, fun, fusiony approach to high-end cuisine that defines SF's food scene. Not too good for big groups but definitely a place to go for fun dates and small cozy gatherings with friends. Solid 4 stars!
author: Maria M.

description:
This is a late review about a year late to be exact. Came here one day while visiting the city for a couple quick bites before our sushi dinner reservations. Let me just say that the three things we ordered were delicious. Hand made tortillas with queso fundido, which is basically melted cheese with whatever goodies they decided to add, we also had a bowl of guac which was fresh and well worth it, and lastly some delicious fish tacos. Everything here was done right, I wouldn't label this a Mexican restaurant because the kitchen had a well assembled staff that represented middle and South America. This place is unique it every aspect and the decor just adds that extra plus to it! 
Check this place out you won't be disappointed!
author: Irvin S.

description:
We came here on Saturday July 2 at 7.30 pm. We had reservation for 2. It was about 15 minutes of wait in spite of the reservation but the lady who greeted us was very nice and apologized repeatedly and even gave us the cocktail menu to check out. Full credit to her. 

And then it went downhill. A lady came and took our order. My friend's food came but none of our cocktails showed up. My friend was nearly done eating when our cocktails made an appearance. 

And then we waited and waited. Twenty five minutes and Nada. My friend was done eating and getting bored for a while then. It took me quite a bit of effort and histrionics to get attention from one of the waiters and when finally I asked about my food, he said there was a mixup and my food will now be made. Again wait and then my empanadas and flautas were brought and dumped on my table, literally. 

Terrible experience. I had heard much about this place but the ride, ill behaved servers at this place ruined it for us. We are never coming back here.
author: Rocking V.

description:
I've been here twice, which is big for SF considering I live on the other side of town and there are SO many options in the Mission. 

The thing about Lolo is that your final bill always shocks you since everything seems pretty moderately price. The portions are small, so if you get two tacos, you get just that. Two tacos, no frills. 

The food is delicious. I was actually pleasantly surprised by my Mexican Benedict, it was just perfect.  

Also the sangria, adding cardamom to the sangria is the best thing anyone has ever done.
author: Anoo L.

description:
This place wowed me with two things. The crafty cocktail and the tacos. Fusion and fine dining try too hard to reinvent the wheel with their fancy combinations....truth is...it's just not good sometimes. 

The black mojito was unique. The 'Tropical Taco' was divined...a well balance of flavors, texture, and ideas. A fluffy fried shrimp on a thin slice of jicama as the tortilla. It just came together so well and its definitely non traditional.  The pineapple salsa and spicy sweet aioli brings the flavors together while the jicama and shrimp has this complementing texture of crispy and crunchy and yet the contrasting of hot and cold, Hearty and refreshing. Ahh I just love it.  

The pulled pork sandwich was good too. But still can't get over the taco.
author: Helen L.

description: Great tacos and small dishes. I would eat everything on the menu! Good casual place - whether weeknight or weekend. Beef and shrimp tacos were great. Brussels sprouts too.
author: Lily L.

description: My friend and I came here for brunch one Sunday afternoon to have a good meal and catch up as we hadn't seen each other in a long time.  What a cool, colorful, cheerful place to hang with your friends and family.  The ambiance gives the place such high energy, and the food was tasty to match!  We completely enjoyed our meal together.  I felt a little rushed to leave our table towards the end, but I guess we were there for quite awhile getting all of our girly talk out of our systems, haha!  That's ok, I forgive you.  And I will be back!  This place wasn't featured on Check Please! for nothing!
author: Maile N.

description:
