Kicked us out because we're the ONLY African-American people in the restaurant. With now warning we were rudely asked to leave. The Restaurant and Merchants Association would LOVE to know this. We spent the entire time there ordering multiple rounds of food and drinks. 

~Response to Jorge (3/22)

Jorge - thank you for reaching out. I couldn't sleep last night because I was heartbroken that such an event spoiled me and my friend's beautiful evening. My mother integrated the lunch counters in North Carolina. People screamed racial epithets, spat at her, threw snakes on her and had dogs biting at her heels. I didn't know that as a daughter of this freedom fighter, I would be in a less hostile, but yet similar situation with the same outcome - we were forced to leave.

We arrived at ~6:30 to lolo after reading fantastic reviews. There were a number of places to choose from, but lolo stood out. The host, a petite Latina with dark, long thin hair sat us next to the wall at a table for two. There were only a handful of people who were there. We were seated directly next to the bar where the servers walk under that counter which you could lift up. The service was excellent at first. The food delicious. 

As they were tapas, we continued ordering throughout our entire stay there. The tacos tropicales were especially good, so we ordered two rounds, the soup, ceviche and drinks along the way. As the evening grew on, the waiters came multiple times to clear our plates, but we weren't finished with the guacamole or ceviche and were still nibbling. 

The same hostess whom I described above with very slight features came over at around 8ish (same time i posted my review)and abruptly asked us to leave or move to the bar. We asked why and she said the table was reserved. There was no reserved sign on the table nor were we told when we were seated that there was a reservation at that specific table. If there had been, we would have never sat there because we hadn't seen each other in a while and wanted to catch up.

We told her that we were not finished as we were just about to order another round. I looked around and the place was packed. There were no signs of other people leaving as everyone looked like they were having a great time, laughing and catching up with their friends - just like we were.

We were stunned and I asked her why did we, the only African-Americans, were the ones out of the entire restaurant who had to leave. She kept saying that the table was reserved. I asked her why she didn't tell us or simply ask other people to get up especially since we weren't finished.

Everyone else was either white or Latinos, perhaps. She screamed at me that she was a minority, didn't like my attitude and that I was out of order for calling her out on her clearly targeted racist behavior. I told her to be nicer to people and we left shaking our heads. 

We discussed how the complexion of the Mission had changed and how 'there is no place for us [African-Americans] here in SF.'  We are professionals who are well-established, connected and embrace all cultures. Clearly, with an experience like the one we had last night, we were so hurt by that. 

Isn't our money the same? Aren't we allowed to enjoy our friends after work, over good food and conversation? The answer is yes, but just not at lolo.
author: Priscilla J.

description: Sadly, this restaurant is unwilling to answer a telephone at 6pm, and yelp consistently yields "oops something went wrong" whether the a reservation is attempted for same-evening at a displayed available time, or a future evening any available time ergo spent 10 minutes vainly trying to book a table. If they are arrogant enough to avoid contact with customers so assiduously, then the world would be better served to see them close and a restaurant that functions to customer's convenience and needs replace them. Avoid, waste of time.
author: Joe F.

description:
Made a reservation on a Wednesday night at 6:30pm. We were losing the parking game and after circling fruitlessly in the general vicinity, called them and they told us they would hold our table for a little longer. When we finally made it there 25 minutes late, they had our table waiting, which was rather generous of them, since the place was packed and a wait for a table for four was 30 minutes. 

We ordered wine right away-- it's right next to the dinner menu. Later we realized their cocktail menu was separate and actually looked pretty interesting. I wished we'd seen that first. Next time! Because there will definitely be a next time here :) This place is great for hungry people in general and surprisingly perfect for three hungry vegetarians especially. 

What we ordered and our general thoughts: 
The beets and kumquats goat cheese salad with coconut - Loved the kumquats, otherwise pretty typical. 

Fried brussel sprouts (with hazelnuts and zinfandel vinaigrette) - Good, but found the vinaigrette a little too acidic for our liking. 

Panko avocado tacos - Delicious. Comes with pickled onions and is actually perfection. 

Queso fundido - Also delicious. Their corn tortillas were like corn masa blankets I wanted to get swaddled in and eat my way out of. 

Mushroom empanadas - One of our party loved them, another felt the empanada crust was "too flaky and not chewy", whatever that means. 

Flautas with queso fresco - good. Certainly a well executed flauta but those avocado tacos are a hard act to follow. 

Fish Tacos - only one member of our party had these and she ate them pretty quickly so we're surmising they were damn delicious. 

We would definitely come back. We would try to the quesadillas and the tortilla soup and probably order the avocado tacos and queso fundido again. We would also try their brunch-- they do reservations, which is always a plus.
author: T K.

description: My wife and I hit their brunch this last Sunday off of a referral from our Bartender at The Marker hotel. He hit the nail on the head! Great food, great drinks and cool vibe. It was hot and I don't think they have AC but it was worth the sweat! Tuna tacos were outstanding. We were having to much fun and forgot to receive an explanation behind their style of food but it was really good. The place was packed. The crowd was cool and probably hip beyond our years but no one made fun of us! Might be a little pricey for some pocket books but their quality is high and I think it was worth the value for us I dropped over $111 which included drinks. Our first time in The Mission District. It is funky. Has lots of cool privately owned shops, restaurants and bars. Great place to kill a Sunday.
author: trent J.

description: Came here for brunch on a Saturday and place was pretty packed and better to get your reservations as early as now.
author: Team M S.

description: If you are around Dolores park (5 min walk) or even Painted Ladies (around 30 min walk) - this place is a true San Franciscan reward for you!  The eccentric design, high ceiling, chatty table full of locals is low key and super welcoming!  Don't forget to make a reservations, parties of more than 6 refer to their other location (Lolo Cevecheria).  On our last visit, we ordered their wonderful super fresh ceviche, carnitas, roasted pepper, avocado toast with smoked trout (highly recommended) and an omelette and shared tapas style! The service is usually very super fast, regardless of the fact that the house is packed.  The flavorful drinks of the house are definitely worth a try.  The extra spice around the rim is not something that I am too crazy for- so heads up!
author: Megan K.

description:
The food was delicious.  Each dish was better than the previous one.  We had ceviche, tostadas and quesadillas and the roasted brussel sprouts and still had room for dessert.

The staff was friendly and attentive.  It was the first time for all three of us and we left making plans for when we would return again!
author: Judy M.

description: I don't come here as often as I should, especially since I live only 2 blocks away, but when I do it's for their brunch offerings of panko avocado tacos and one of the best avocado toasts I've ever eaten. Thick olive-oil poached toast comes loaded with avocado, smoked trout, capers, sun-dried tomato and meyer lemony tartness all mixed to a chunky guacamole-like consistency. Me gusta.
author: Greasybones V.

description:
No wait when arriving at 6pm on a Saturday night! Such a cute spot with eclectic decor... I think someone described it as Andy Warhol meets Mexico-spot on description!!

Our dinner for 2 was amazing!!!

Here's what we ordered:
1.) guacamole to start
2.) taco tropical (soooooo good)
3.) tuna tacon (WOWOWOWOWOWOW)
4.) flan for desert

You might look at the portions as if they're not enough, but wow Lolo's is truly about quality not quantity! We were so glad we finally got to try this place, left perfectly full & can't wait to go back to try more!!
author: Geraldine R.

description: I went there for dinner on a Thursday night and had to wait an hour for a table but it was totally worth it. Great service, cocktails, food, and ambiance. I would definitely go back.
author: Emma N.

description: Fun atmosphere, food was just okay.  We were there for Sunday brunch so the full menu might have been better.
author: Kelly S.

description: Decent Sunday brunch. Make reso on yelp. Service was goodish. Food was just ok - Chilaquiles were not delicious sadly. Lolo mimosa - amazing.
author: Gernaut A.

description: The drink "El Tierno" is one of the best drinks ever. Fish tacos and the fondue with mushrooms are awesome as well.
author: Laura Isabel O.

description:
Not in love with the Lolo just yet, but I will say, it's pretty good. Though this is more of a 3.5 Stars than 4.

Parking was a madhouse! So be warned... We drove around for 15 minutes before finally finding parking, but once seated inside - the stress leveled out and we were able to soak everything in. It was a nice ambiance, but kind of hard to take cute snapshots so basics, be warned - it'll take a lot of work for that instaworthy photo.

Onto the food, we ordered guac, ceviche, taco tropical, tuna taco, and beef taco.  Originally we wanted to try croissant toast also, but was warned that we may be ordering too much food - so feeling judged, we decided to cut something and those extra calories were let go. 

Guac - was standard, but the size was big enough to share. Wouldn't order again.
Ceviche - was yummy! Lot's of flavor and came with whole shrimps. The fried chip they came with was good and crunchy - I dig that.
Taco Tropical - omg this was so eye-opening! After the first bite I had forgotten all about the stress that was parking and I was heart-eyed ready to proclaim this as my new favorite spot. It was SO good and refreshing. Taco shell was made of what seemed like a thinly sliced radish (like the ones they give you at kbbq) and all the flavors just popped in your mouth. I'm ready to come back and keep an order to myself.
Tuna Tacon - Not sure if something just didn't vibe with me and this one, but it was like I was on the biggest HIGH and then it came crashing down. Not a fan of this one, it tasted a little weird IMO. Would not recommend .. but seems like everyone talks about this one so maybe try at your own risk.
Beef Taco - had lots of beefy goodness, though I can't say it blew me out of this world. Tastes like a regular beef taco - but it was meaty and had a charred grilled taste which I like. May or may not order again, depending on what other things I wanted to try.

Overall I had a pretty good experience, it's a little big over the hump of mediocrity - mainly because of how damn delicious that Taco Tropical is. MMM. I saw alot of things on Yelp photos that looks bomb as well, so if I do come back - I'll aim for dinner instead of brunch.
author: Ngan T.

description:
Delicious tapas style dining!  I got the taco tropical (panko-crusted shrimp with tropical salsa and spicy aioli) and brussels sprouts with shallots, hazelnuts and a zinfandel vinaigrette.  Both dishes were filling!  And off the bat you get chips and three types of salsa.

I also got their pina colada which had horchata in it.

I would love to come back and try more off their menu!  Reservations are definitely recommended.. this place gets packed.
author: Vira P.

description: Had the panko avocado tacos and the flautas. The tacos are unbelievable, and I'll definitely be back for those! The flautas were a bit disappointing as they had too much cheese. The cheese ended up overpowering the dish, which made it less enjoyable. Overall, the restaurant had a great ambiance. Make sure to reserve a table in advance because the place is packed even on weekdays.
author: Divya A.

description: A great lil place. The ambiance was great too. Drinks and food was good but it was a splurge.
author: Gloria L.

description: The decor is beautiful and unique. drinks selection includes delicious bloody mary's. Be sure to sit at the bar to witness the drink-making in action!
author: Ayesha I.

description:
First time here today. We made reservations for brunch. They even sent a reminder an hour before to confirm the reservation.

The service was very warm and friendly. The environment was fun yet very accepting of our 7 month old daughter.

We were a party of 3 (not counting our daughter). We tried the croissant French toast, Mexican eggs Benedict, chorizo scramble, taco tropical, and had micheladas. Everything was delicious. The french toast was  very unique and worth trying. Although, I still think the best french toast is still at NOPA :)

Ambiance is pretty chill. You fee relaxed and enjoy the liveliness while still being able to have a conversation.
author: Vibhor C.

description:
Wow what a experience!
First thing you notice is the interior design is so trendy cool!
The food is very good. My favorite two dishes was the:
- Panko-crusted shrimp tacos (first food item on the menu)
- Shrimp diablo (a spicy creamy sauce)
I am definitely going back to try more!
author: Shobeir S.

description:
This fun and inviting restaurant never fails to delight. The cocktail menu is excellent and pleases both the palate and your mood;)
The food is consistently excellent. The Brussel  sprouts are wondrous, just let them cool off a tad before diving in.  The tacos Tropical crush!  Whether you are in a hurry to catch a ballgame or pacing yourself at brunch, LoLo' caters to your needs. Can't say enough great things about this place. 
Owner and Executive Chef Jorge has created a family and neighborhood  go to spot. He has caught lightning in a bottle on Valencia! Love love love this place.
author: Colleen M. Q.

description:
My friend from out of town came to visit, and I decided I'd take her to the Mission. Originally, I'd planned for something classic Mission like El Farolito, but when I asked her what she wanted, she said, "I just want to eat somewhere clean," and I realized I'd have to give our dinner a little more thought.

A co-worker who lives in the Mission ended up recommending Lolo, and since neither of us had ever had tapas before, we decided we'd give it a shot. 

The place itself is adorable. Every wall has a different pattern, and decorations are so cute and quirky (I sat against a wall of origami sailboats). The food was wonderful as well! We started with the heirloom tomato salad special, and this dish was easily my favorite. The tomatoes were so fresh, juicy, and sweet (tasted just like summer!), and the cheese beneath was soft and spreadable, and it made me wonder why heirloom tomato salads are typically served with such solid, rubbery cheeses in the first place. Next, we had the taco tropical -- each bite was full of flavor, and it was such a great twist on shrimp tacos. We also really enjoyed the fried brussels sprouts and chicken confit tostadas.

I'm so glad I had my first tapas experience at Lolo; I only wish I could have brought more friends along to try more tapas!

Edit: I have since returned for brunch, and it is AWESOME.
author: Kelly R.

description:
I wish I could give you 5 stars lolo! The food is delicious, very authentic, with their own twist on every traditional dish they serve. The cocktails are amazing, well crafted! The waitresses and bartenders are very welcoming. But why 3 stars? 

On my last visit I saw 2 cockroaches next to my plate. I'm not grossed out by bugs in general but I was eating and the cockroaches were making their way across the table. 

I def hope they do something about it! Such an and amazing place!!
author: Yedid G.

description:
I was really excited for Lolo to open this second location because I LOVE the original (just a few blocks away), but this place is underwhelming. 

It's feels and tastes much more westernized - not as authentic as the other location. The crowd is also a lot more trendy at this location - a bit too loud and entitled for my taste. 

The food here was pretty good but nothing memorable. 

I'd definitely recommend the other location, but can't say the same about this place.
author: Julia O T.

description:
Definitely coming back again for the tuna tacon! 
We tried the taco tropical, tuna tacon, crab croquetas, & lamb sliders. Everything was really good, though my favorites were definitely the tuna tacon (taco with a slab of seared tuna, avocado & aioli) and the lamb sliders. I also really liked the taco tropical (taco with panko & spice dusted shrimp). However, if you only want to order one taco dish, I would pick the tuna tacon over the taco tropical.
author: Cici A.

description:
Absolutely delicious. We ordered the taco tropical (which I believe was served on daikon rather than a conventional tortilla?) and the tuna tacon. Both were amazingly full of flavor and I could taste the fresh tomatoes, mangos, and jicama in the first dish. The tuna tacon has the right amount of tuna and it felt like I was eating butter! Now I need to be a pro and dissect their secret sauce. :) 

Will be back again to try any other specials on the menu. :)
author: Katrina T.

description: Small, cozy, and intimate. Uniquely decorated. Delicious small plates.
author: Sabrina S.

description:
Fantastic food and cocktails. The menu is full of great options. Everything ordered had amazing flavor. You can't go past the grilled octopus and the tacos. 

This place gets busy but maintains a great vibe, far better to book a table ahead.
author: K M.

description: Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in SF. It's one of the more upscale Mexican restaurants in the Mission. A fun and relaxed vibe, beautiful decor, delicious food and strong drinks - what else could you possibly want? I love sitting at the bar or the chef's counter. Taco tropical is my favorite, washed down with a margarita.
author: Heidi L.

description: Delicious, we came here for new year's and the steak plate was delicious, I also remember there being some sort of paste dish with shrimp(?). Loved it. Will be back. With my mom.
author: Yvonne C.

description:
With the move to the new space I didn't even realize I had been to Lolo before! Wow, what a difference a few years makes!

My friend got reservations and when 2 of us arrived a bit early we were able to get seated while we waited for our third.

I think we ordered: brussels sprouts, kale salad, ceviche, fish tacos and chicken tinga tostada. Everything was super delicious. If I had to choose a favorite it would probably be the tostadas but brussels sprouts a close 2nd. 

One of the girls in our party can't have dairy. Our waiter was very accommodating and helped ensure our food came out as requested.

Service was friendly and my only complaint is that they kept trying to take our food away when we were planning to finish it all :)
author: Rachel E.

description:
Mixed experience:

Had to wait for our reserved table, reservation request was not made, food was OK. Too loud to talk.

But generally nice vibe and great staff.
author: Anna W.

description: The lady in front has attitude and ego. She tries to boss people around and has waited people to show dominance. She also discriminates; If you are coming with a lady, she takes them first.
author: Maxs P.

description:
Top 5 meal, excellent service, but soooo expensive. 5 shared tapas, 4 drinks, 1 shared desert = $175. I'm not mad cause it was so good but I probably won't be back for the $$$$. 

All that said, 9 words - panko-crusted shrimp tacos and octopus-and-squid gordito. 

Never had anything that can compare to those two magical dishes
author: Noah M.

description: Came here for brunch on a Saturday.  For the prices, I expected the portions to be a bit bigger (we left still hungry). We got the taco tropical, tuna tacon, and the ceviche. The food was really good but not out of these world. We also got the 2 birds 1 stone cocktail
author: Catherine C.

description:
Had a great time! I came here with a few friends and was lucky enough to get placed at a table tucked away in the corner. It was a perfect place to catch up over drinks and some delicious fusion Mexican tapas. We shared quite a few dishes between the three of us and they were able to modify the orders to include an extra serving at the appropriate charge so that we could share each plate evenly.

My favorite dish was the taco tropical: a panko shrimp taco wrapped in a thinly sliced jicama "tortilla" and topped with a spicy aioli that's very reminiscent of La Vic's orange sauce. The jicama added just the right amount of juicy crispness. Very innovative and delicious.

Definitely would love to come back soon to try the rest of the menu!
author: Annie D.

description: WONDERFUL brunch! We ordered another round of the guacamole - it was that good!
author: Ellie J.

description:
tl;dr: pricey for very average food & drink

Went for brunch on a Saturday.   About $15 for chilaquiles with eggs.  I've only had them in Mexico.  These were not cooked to the right consistency, nor were they flavorful.  Quite a bit for eggs, beans, and tortilla chips.  Also $11 for a michelada.  One of the poorer Michelada's I've had in the states, but certainly the most expensive.  My GF had the eggs benedict dish.  Also expensive and very meh on flavor.
author: Gabo G.

description:
Guys, I really like this restaurant! The food is amazing and reasonably priced and the vibe is so unique and relaxed yet classy and the staff is amazing and I want to go back... like, rn. 

First off, I'm gonna say something that might not be yelp-approved: Any place that offers unlimited free chips and salsa gets an automatic rating bump by greater than or equal to 1 star. It's a solid rating methodology that has worked well for me.

But even without the free chips n salsa, I still think Lolo deserves a full 5 stars. The wait staff was very on top of things and the food was really well prepared and delicious. Our favorites were the ceviche and empanadas. 

The only thing that might be unattractive about Lolo to some is how packed it is. It is not a quiet, intimate setting. When we went on a Saturday at 7pm, our table was separated from the adjacent table by approximately 1 foot. I am not exaggerating. This made it very difficult to talk about the people at the table next to us, which is one of our favorite dinner pastimes. We had no problem getting seated since we had a reservation - you should probs get a reservation. 

Oh also, one clarification: These are Mexican Tapas. I assumed that they were Spanish bc of the "tapas" and was surprised by the menu. That might be obvious to everyone except me, as it is in the Mission. Idk. K bye.
author: Sarah S.

description: This is most probably my favorite Mexican restaurant in SF! The price is reasonable, staff is super friendly and they don't rush anything and take the time. The high seats at the kitchen were very cool because we could see how the food was made. They are very service oriented and the Margaretha's are great! Also, I LOVE the decoration - the boats, the dogs, all of it! Thanks!
author: Christy V.

description:
The decor here is quirky and interesting - there's a lot to take in. We sat at the seats against the wall of men's sport coats. The other wall - figurines of dogs inside shadow boxes, boots, and flowers. 

We started off with the panko avocado tacos which were indeed delicious with the deep fried avocados, caramelized onions and Oaxaca cheese wrapped in a soft tortilla. I can probably go for this as a satisfying little snack at any given time. 

They provide complimentary chips and dip so I was glad I didn't get the guacamole with chips. I already opted for the chilaquiles with eggs which was a bit spicy. Although not a bad dish I regretted not opting for something else on their menu. If you're craving for something that's more of a traditional breakfast item they also offer a croissant French toast and Mexican Eggs Benedict on their menu. 

I might need to drop by for dinner one of these days.
author: Esther A.

description:
Abosolutely delicious dishes in a lively and colorfully decorated environment.
Love the takes made with Jicama, salads and finally the fondue dessert.
Love it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Carmen C.

description: Have always had a great experience here. Food is excellent. Pro tip: get a side of house made, warm, corn tortillas with one of the dishes, like the pork belly.
author: Bib G.

description: Service was just ok. Cold. Snotty. Impersonal. The didn't want to seat our party of 3 until the third member arrived, and made us stand there for like 5-6 minutes when we could have ordered chips and guac and spend more money at the restaurant.
author: Pete B.

description:
Wow! Came here to celebrate a friend's birthday and don't think we've both ever experienced greater service. Lolo is great, bursting with colorful energy and fun decor. We had an 8:30 p.m. reservation on Friday and arrived 5 minutes late. We were told the wait would be 5-10 minutes and could order drinks while we waited. We ended up not being seated for the next 20-30 minutes but no big deal -- we hung out by the front door and just people watched. When we were seated the staff was very apologetic even though we weren't the least bit annoyed. We got chips and guacamole on the house once we sat down (talk about kind service!). The tapas were delicious, we got the:

-Tacos Tropical
-Carnitas
-Empanadas
-Tinga Tostadas
-Mexican ice cream dessert (omg)
-Flautas 

Our server stopped by after every dish was dropped off and we were helped by almost everyone walking around whether it was getting more water, more chips, our check, etc. You can really tell this is an establishment that's family run and they care about each and every customer. My friend even said, "it's like they actually wanted us to be happy." We didn't like the Flautas too much (our fault, I don't like dairy) and they immediately brought us a different dish and apologized many times for us not liking them. I don't often send food back but they really wanted us to enjoy everything we ordered. Overall, love this place. Great date spot, lighthearted ambiance, wonderful staff, and delicious food guarantees a memorable night!
author: Louise Z.

description: We had a fabulous meal here at Lolo's! For starters, you definitely need a reservation to get into this place. We then ordered a round of spicy margaritas which were delightful. Then we decided to take some suggestions from the waitress and we got the ceviche, guacamole (of course) and the tuna tacos. The tuna tacos were so delectable that we had to get a second order. The only part of the meal I didn't prefer was the pork belly tacos as much of the fat had not rendered out of the pork. Funky fresh atmosphere.
author: Celeste G.

description:
Tapas!

Great food, great service, perfect ambiance. The place is well lit with nice decor but the food was even better.  I'd definitely will return to try out the other items in the menu.
author: Bob S.

description:
Quick seating with reservation and fast and friendly service.
The fish tacos took the grand prize!
author: Bandari M.

description: I think Lolo is so cute! the decor is very... eclectic lol but in a cute way. everywhere I turned I was like "ooh that's cool... ooh how cute..." haha. Anyways. The food is good too and tapas style which is nice for groups so you can just order a bunch of things that sound good and share. I don't remember what we got cause we ordered so many things lol but everything was good and I'll definitely be back!
author: Terra C.

description: Walked in here earlier today after another spot that I wanted to go was closed. Ordered a Michelada and a ceviche. The michelada was just about average. The ceviche was also average. I live in New York so probably spoilt by the standards there, but this place was just about average.
author: Mihir S.

description: This was my first time at Lolo and I was impressed. We came on a Sunday afternoon and made a reservation. We had the grapefruit mimosas which I would highly recommend and we ordered the guacamole which was fresh and delicious. I had the panko avocado tacos which were amazing and my friend had the beef tacos which she loved- she adored the spicy sauce that was served on the side. We also had the ceviche which was awesome. Highly recommend this place!
author: Kristin W.

description: Always good! The carnitas here are some of the best in the city. Make sure to make a reservation though! Otherwise you will wait ;)
author: Meg C.

description: Didn't know there were separate times for brunch and dinner. Came here last Sunday at 3:15pm, hoping to get some dishes that I saw pictured on Yelp, but was given choices from the brunch menu. Overall, food was good and uniquely prepared, but can be a bit pricey for the small portions. Would definitely come back again to try food from the dinner menu.
author: Wendy P.

description: I don't complain much. I hate complainers. I just think this place is a ripoff ... a bad joke. I'm from South Texas. Grew up around and within Mexican cuisine and culture. I was raised eating Mexican food. My first food, besides my mother's milk, was corn tortillas and butter. Mole. Enchiladas. Barbacoa. Tripas. Elote. Cabrito. Pozole. I love it all. I am a passionate lover of Mexican cuisine. I get what Lolo is trying to do, but they're not convincing me... at all. Eating at Lolo, just made me sad. They're some pretentious isht passing as the illusion of authentic Mexican cuisine, masked by skimpy service, sad portions, and not providing the essentials. Lolo served Huevos Rancheros on one blue corn tortilla and one blue corn tortilla on the side, then charges $4 for 4 more, home-made, blue corn tortillas. How is someone supposed to eat huevos rancheros without tortillas? How is it justified to charge the customer more money for such a basic ingredient? Not one jalepeno? Not one!. Salsa came in a small, really small bowl... but it looked 'authentic' 'rustic' so it must be real... please... Not one ounce of spicy hot sauce. Black beans were decent. Coffee was weak as fuck. Not one refill for coffee until the end of my meal. I had to guide the waiter thru the basic essentials of cuisine... what a joke. I'm sure white people don't know the difference. This one does and I felt ashamed to be a white person eating that food cause it wasn't real at all. I'm sure that there are other dishes that they create that they fuckin crush. But I'll never give them the benefit of the doubt, cause they insulted me with some ignorant ass breakfast. I'll never eat here again. Sad. Sad. Sad joke of a restaurant. I should stay home, get my own masa, and make my own tortillas.
author: Ryan B.

description: Went to Lolo for the first time and lucky we got in without a reservation, though we did wait! My favorite was the tuna tacon, and didn't know the corn on cob could taste so good, especially with queso! Funny thing is they also serve the best tortilla chips ever. Good drinks, too. Can't wait to go back and try more on the menu. 4v5 stars because the crab croquettes were fab, but could use a tad bit more crab!
author: Darlene B.

description:
Honestly between the food, service and drinks this place was fantastic. 
Great small plates to share. We enjoyed the empanadas, carnitas, tortilla soup (mmmm), and much more. 
You can't go wrong with also trying something new. My son wanted the octopus and I'm not a big fan but we ordered it. What a treat! 
Thanks to our amazing waitress and staff -- super personable and patient!
Take-away -- try the prince specialty drink and tortilla soup
Will go back for -- surprisingly the octopus and fried avocado taco.
author: Jane K.

description:
3.5 stars. Quirky lil spot with a ton of interesting, recycled decor to gawk at while waiting for your food. The selection of tapas is good with a lot of meat and veggie options. Bff and I tried about five small plates and what stood out was the jicama tacos and the tinga tostadas. The free chips and salsa was a nice touch but the red salsa was horrible. Come on! A Mexican restaurant should have their salsa on point! Service was pretty good though there were way too many bussers coming around trying to clear our plates before were finished. I got the sense that they were trying to rush us. No bueno! :(

I wouldn't go out of my way to come back but if I was in the area I'd re visit..maybe try some other dishes.

BTW: The drinks are fantastic. If anything, go for the drinks and a few small plates. Quick and easy.
author: Susie O.

description:
I love this place. I love how unique the food is. The mezcal cocktails are so amazing. The service was great and bartenders were very friendly. Standout dish was the Taco Tropical. Be sure to get that. Everything else was delicious. 

Will definitely be back
author: Gabrielle C.

description: Great food amd great service.  Had a blast. Make reservations so you don't have to wait.
author: Mrs S.

description:
Made a reservation for 3 for Monday night, though I didn't to since there was plenty of space at 6pm. Ordered some drinks while we waited for the third person in our party. The waitress tried to push the guacamole on this but we decided to wait. After everyone got there we ordered:

 * guacamole - smooth texture, kinda boring, served with it's own chips

 * ceviche - good, served with it's own chips

 * mushroom empanadas - really good crust!

 * gorditas - really tender beef, yummy!

 * fish tacos - okay, nice relish

I was really impressed by all the food except for the typical guacamole and the complimentary chips/salsa - salsa not spicy and kinda bland.

Oh yeah, the plates are pretty small but filing. Each order has two servings. That's two small empanadas, two small tacos, etc.

Really cute place, fun decor.

Total $50 per person including a cocktail, shared bottle of wine, tax and tip.
author: Jean K.

description:
We made our reservations via Yelp. It was simple and easy and we received emails confirming our reservations! The hostess seated us immediately as soon as our tables were ready and even gave us options as to which tables we would like to be seated at. Service is quick and all the servers are very attentive. 

The Food: 
+ Guacomole and Chips - Was fresh and a good start to any meal.
++ Taco Tropical - Was very well balanced and delicious. Yummy Mango bits in the taco. 
++ Fish Tacos - Was creamy, stuffed and delicious.
+++ Empanadas - We loved these the most! Ordered it twice, so be sure to order one for yourself. 

Drinks:
-- Mezcule Mule - A big disappointment! It was like drinking an antiseptic lotion. 
and two different kind of beers.
-- Bumping off stars for the bad drink, limited menu and the tables are way too close to each other. You can literally jump into second tables conversation.
author: N G.

description:
Please make a reservation or you'll have to wait, especially on a busy night like Friday and Saturday night. I had a 8pm reservation and still got seating around 8:15pm. No big deal but a heads up that you may not be seated at your reservation time. There isn't really a 'waiting area' so everyone that is waiting to be seated crowds around the bar, which is small, and the front door. Just find a spot and awkwardly stand there until someone tells you to move or until you get seated. 

We were seated at the table right next to the bar, which was also near the awkward standing space near the front of the door. Our table for 2 was literally right next to another table for 2...maybe 1 inch apart? It was def a first Tinder (or something) date and I could have listened to the entire convo if I wanted to. We couldn't separate the table more or else we would have hit the people sitting at the bar. 

It's about $15 for a margarita.. I'd say that is standard SF price. 

Free chips and 2 types of salsa as soon as you sit down. Yay.

I had the..
Shishito peppers: Some were spicy, some were not. They really didn't taste like anything but you get about 30? I wouldn't order them again. 

Guacamole: It was aite. Pomegranate seeds on top was a nice, fresh touch - I've never seen this before. You're supposed to eat this with the free chips that come out in the beginning. The guac was just ok - we ended up eating it throughout the meal. I wouldn't get it again just because there wasn't anything special about it except the 8 pom seeds that were sprinkled on top. 

Fish tacos: So delicious and I don't even like fish. You can't taste the fish and the peanut sauce thing they give with it is a really nice pairing. I would have ordered this again if I wasn't so full. 

Beef sliders: Pass. The beef was SUPER tough, not easy to chew, and not tender. I guess those three means the sort-of-ish same thing but either way, I wouldn't get it. 

Crab croquette: Tasted fishy.. crabby? I did not like this and it wasn't very crispy for something that is supposed to be crispy. The inside was very very moist (too moist) and whatever sauce was on the serving plate (I think it was soy sauce based)... it was just too much. The white sauce was also weird. Mehhhhh. I wouldn't get it again. 


There were some items on the restaurant menu that weren't on the online menu so I was pleasantly surprised by this. 

This was a fun dining experience. I liked all the tapas that came out, even though I didn't love all of them. I would for sure go back to try the other menu items. 

The service was great and the food came out pretty fast. I'd try to be seated in the back where it seemed less crowded next time. It's also pretty dark in there because of the low lighting. Ambiance, you know? Good for first time Tinder dates or just a nice evening out with friends or someone special.
author: Esther C.

description:
Came here for dinner about a week ago and loved it! 

THE AMBIANCE: The decor is eclectic to say the least. A wall decorated of soccer balls? Check! A wall covered with dollies? Check! Suits attached to the benched seats? You got it. I love how vibrant it is! 

THE FOOD: It's a tapas place, so you definitely should share and try a little bit of everything. I went with a party of 5 and we each got 2 dishes, which turned out to be just the right amount. MUST GET DISHES - taco tropical, pork belly, and tuna tacon! But honestly, I'm sure everything is great here, so you can't go wrong with any dish.

THE SERVICE: They were friendly and on top of it! 

I would definitely come back here, especially since they take reservations. No wait + great food = I'm there!
author: Cassy H.

description:
So happy I finally got to try this place on my bookmark list since it's been there for a while. We were very fortunate that even though I arrived late and couldn't find parking for a while that we were seated almost immediately on a Saturday night during prime dinner hour! 

The inside is dark, dim, I guess kind of romantic but more loud. It's definitely a great place for a group gathering if you have advance reservations and also a fun place to get drinks since their bottled wine is SO CHEAP for a restaurant setting!

We definitely got the recommended list of things, such as the taco tropical (amazing), the lamb sliders (yum) and ceviche. I was a particular fan of their taco tropical because of the taste, texture and just the tortilla. It was very well done and delicious all around.

The wait staff was nice although the hostess left some things to be desired from her attitude ... but the owner / manager was amazing! Highly recommended and great food!
author: Lorrie M.

description: Great drinks, great atmosphere, great service and ambient, ceviche was just OK, pork belly salad was good (can't go wrong with that can you?) and the tacos tropicales were really good. Great place to have fun eating and drinking.
author: Martino P.

description: The food here is pretty tasty, however, when we have a reservation for 8:45 p.m. and do not get seated until 9:20 p.m., the food better be fucking delicious for me to want to come back. And it wasn't that delicious for me to go again and risk experiencing another 35 minute wait while the hostess awkwardly tries to avoid us. She did try to make it up around 9:15 p.m. by saying let me get you guys drinks while you wait but then she charged us for those even though she made it seem like they would be free because of our troubles. Oh, and did I mention that she somewhat talked trash about other diners by telling us that she has a table for us but for some reason "the people there are just sitting around playing with their phones even though they've already paid." Well they get to do that, they are your customers. Stop making excuses and trying to blame your customers for your fuck up. There are so many great restaurants around the city that would probably have handled the situation better and I'll take my business to those establishments. All this to say, the food is great, the hostess (at least the one working the night of 1/13) was incredibly incompetent. Go here if you don't mind terrible service. And in case you were wondering, no we weren't late for our reservation.
author: Margaret Y.

description: Had dinner here with a friend last night. We both loved it! The food, the decor the service was excellent. Can't wait to go back!!!
author: Monique B.

description: Lamb sliders were really good, shisito peppers were good too, some were super spicy, and some weren't as much. The ceviche was not bad, not your typical ceviche you'll find at a peruvian place, but not bad. Chips and dips were good though, and service was excellent. Sat at the bar because it would of been an hr wait for a table.
author: Minerva L.

description:
This is my absolute favorite restaurant in San Francisco, which is a huge title to have. Michelin stars, prix fixe menus with price tags in the hundreds, world renowned chefs, all put to shame.

It's been a part of the neighborhood as long as I have, and they've been on point every single time, in terms of service, menu, and cocktails. Very glad they opened this new location in addition to Cevicheria because it's no longer impossible to walk in and get a seat for two at the bar--in fact I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes since then. Still, make a reservation if you can!

Favorites: tuna tacon, cochinita tostadas, huitlacoche ravioli (the color and texture of this corn fungus is a bit adventurous for some, but I grew up with it--delicious). And the salsas, the cornerstone of a Mexican meal, are superb.

First timers, you should go with at least four people so you can family-style it and sample as much as possible. I've sent a steady stream of out of towners here throughout the years and they always come out raving about it. It's a no-brainer!
author: David G.

description: This eclectic restaurant in the heart of the mission district is worth trying. The taco tropical, sliders and shrimp ceviche were outstanding. The handcrafted cocktails were also tasty and unique. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is the special which were crab tacos were flavorless and expensive and the pork belly tacos were just average.  The service was very good, the waitstaff was attentive and helpful.
author: Karrie G.

description: slightly spiced shrimp tacos on jicama based tacos with a sweet aoili == so creative and delicious. an order ($12) has 2 baby tacos in it, enough for you when you're not hungry but you know you will be in a few hours so you should eat something now to stave off rage later. i came with a girlfriend right before the dinner rush (around 630pm) and were seated at the kitchen counter. we both put in an order for a taco and didn't get any drinks, but didn't feel rushed or judged by the service (which can be a problem at other popular places). will definitely be back to try more of the menu and will come with an appetite.
author: Meryam B.

description:
Lolo encompasses everything that I love about dining out; it is unique with its quirky decorations and the food was absolutely delicious. Unfortunately, I'm knocking off a star (I wish I could give half stars) because I had a bout of food poisoning shortly after eating here. 

My sister and I decided to go here for our traditional birthday celebration by dining out with just us two and made reservations on their Yelp page at 6:30.We arrived a little earlier at 6:15 but were seated right away. We started with drinks, ordering the sangria (very good, not too strong but sweet) and another drink (I unfortunately forgot the name) with watermelon juice, mezcal, and a couple other things. Definitely need to come back to try all of their cocktails because my sister and I wanted to try ALL OF THEM-- they just sounded too tasty and we had a hard time choosing which one we wanted.

Okay...onto the food. We ordered:
-guacamole: guacamole was good, especially with the cotija cheese. I'm not sure I would get it again though since we were already given chips and salsa to start with.

-fried brussel sprouts: one of my favorite dishes of the night. The sprouts were crispy, not too oily and went extremely well with the onion and hazelnuts. I'm making sure I order this every time in the future.

-tuna tacon: very good tacos; albeit small, they pack a lot of flavor and I loved that they toasted the tortilla slightly so it gave the taco a bit of a crunchier texture.

-taco tropical: sooo light and airy, I love the daikon concept for the "tortilla" of this taco. The result was a very light taco, and the breading on the shrimp was so light and crisp! I loved this taco.

-huitlacoche: one of my other favorite dishes of the night. The sauce was really creamy and yummy, I wish I had more bread to dip it in! Pine nuts were a very nice touch.

Service was fine, though it took them a while to notice that we had finished our dinner and were trying to get their attention for some to-go boxes. 

About my food poisoning...my sister and I took BART to get here and by the time we were about to board at 16th St., I started feeling very dizzy. Found seats (thank goodness) and that's when I felt profuse nauseousness and dizziness come on. Then come the clammy hands, extreme heat and an unbearable amount of sweating dripping down my face and neck. Vision became blurred and very bright, flashes every time I blinked O__o The whole time I was just hoping that I wouldn't shit/pee myself, vomit, or pass out because then I would be "that girl who ___ on BART" and my sister probably couldn't carry me.

I love Lolo and their food but I admit that I am very hesitant at this point to go back. I do not want the experience I had last night to happen again. Right now, I'm just happy that I didn't shit or vomit on BART.
author: Sheila N.

description:
I wish i can give this place infinite stars! The restaurant is always packed, but the food is always amazing, and service is beyond perfect. I have been at this restaurant a few times now both on the weekends, and the bartenders are quick to get your drink orders. They are personable and make great drinks. 

On Friday, we sat at that the bar, by the kitchen, and the busser or maybe server, noticed that we have been waiting for awhile, he offered to asked the manager if we can sit at the open seating. The manager came by, and brought us menus. We had mushroom empanadas, which are my favorite, fish tacos, and the octopus special. Everything was delicious!

What was really amazing was I forgot my prescription pills after dinner on Friday. I called and left a message. 15 minutes later, they called back. The lady that I talked to went beyond to find them, instead of just saying, "We'll get back to you, if we find them." Luckily, they were found and was able to pick them up right away.
author: Casey M.

description: The shrimp tacos were the real stand-out. The fish tacos, fried brussels sprouts and guacamole were decent, but nothing amazing. The drinks were innovative and pretty and the service was attentive and friendly. I will definitely be back to try some of the other options on the menu.
author: John L.

description:
Ambiance:
It is cute and kitschy but feels very temporary - like the wallpaper feels like it is going to fall off any moment. I wonder how it will look in there in a year... maybe worse than Fritz on Valencia. 

Drinks:
Nailed it. We tried a selection from the menu and everything was spot on in taste and well executed. If you super want to nitpick, the nice big ice cubes were cloudy, but then you should sthu.

Food:
Tacos were amazing (that tropical one and the tuna - tho the tuna was overcooked, the flavors were so on point).
Guac was not spicy or salty enough but still decent
Pork belly was missing crispy skin, which make me sad. But I still managed to eat it ;-)

End Result:
Our bill was pretty stupid high, but we are lushes so I blame only myself for that. I am not 100% sure I will become a regular or anything, but I would send a co-worker if I sort of liked them and they lived in the south bay and didnt know where to eat in the city and were not super foodies.
author: Kate M.

description: Excellent Chicken Tostadas, Shrimp Diabla, tequila cocktails!! Our favorite is to sit on the back kitchen counter and watch one of the chefs (a very talented woman!!) carefully and meticulously prepare each colorful dish! Food and flavors are unique, and always served piping hot! Only draw back is the always long wait - but very happy they have YELP reservations now!
author: S. V.

description:
OMG THOSE TACOS! I'M IN LOVEE! The soft taco tasted so fresh and the steak was sooo good. I'd come back just for the tacoss. SOO GOOD! MUST GET! 

Came here with a bunch of friends and we ordered a lot of different things, but the only memorable thing is the tacos. So just get the tacos, and you'll leave as a happy bunny!
author: Michelle T.

description: Love this place! Great place to share tapas. Drinks are incredible. Sangria is my fave. Unique decor.
author: Analicia A.

description: Wow ... We ordered 5 different dishes all were amazing! We are coming back for sure. By far, the best dish was the tuna tacos... seared ahi tuna on a flour tortilla... to die for. To go along with the food, the decor was really cool, with different kinds of mexican trinkets used throughout the restaurant.
author: Pau Y Monica C.

description: It was my second dinner in Lolo and I absolutely loved it! Fast and good service, delicious food and great ambience.
author: Lia S.

description: As a Latina i was a bit disappointed. Place & Environment i really enjoyed! But.. My carnitas were hard and they offered me a Michelada that was far looking from one with a salt rim! First sip i took i had to spit out lol then just whipped off. I went back however! Had carnitas again and were better! And to my Michelada offer i had to pass.. very friendly customer service however. A few times they forgot about us but we understood do to how busy they were. & a few more menu options would be nice
author: Maribel M.

description:
Wonderful experience dining here! I made a reservation through Yelp for 6pm on a Saturday. When we showed up, the hostess said there was something apparently wrong with their reservation site and we didn't have a table. She did offer us seats at the counter which we took and were glad we did.  It was fun watching corn tortillas be hand made and watch the kitchen put together the plates. Our server was absolutely lovely and attentive. The complimentary chips were thin and not too heavy and the salsas that came with the chips tasted fresh and had great flavor. Here's our rundown of what we ordered:

- Heirloom tomato and burrata "salad": fresh, flavorful, juicy tomatoes with a creamy, melt-in-your-mouth burrata. This was excellent!
- Panko avocado taco: two great vegetarian tacos with a good helping of avocado and tart oaxaca cheese. This was one of my favorites, the panko-crusted avocado was original and tasted amazing.
- Empanadas: vegetarian empanadas with mushrooms, oaxaca, corn, and peppers. Very, very cheesy with a nice crispy shell. 
- Flautas: Crispy shell with a generous queso fresco filling topped with a huge pile of shredded lettuce and cream. Cheesy, amazing, refreshing with the lettuce.
- Fish tacos: Pretty standard fish tacos in corn tortillas but the fish was fried perfectly and the handmade corn tortillas were a real gem.
*** For vegetarians, just prepare yourself for all vegetarians dishes to be very cheesy! Everything was so good but I wish there were some other dishes that didn't have cheese because it did end up being a bit heavy by the end!

When we were done with dinner, the hostess actually came up to us and apologized for not having a table for us and offered us either free dessert or free shots. What??? This kind of stuff was offered when I used to live in North Carolina but has never happened here, even when we've had disastrous dinners. We said it was no big deal and we really didn't need anything extra because our dinner was wonderful but she insisted. So I asked for flan to go. Not only did she return with our flan to go (which, by the way, was incredible. Beautiful caramel flavor and had a nice, firm texture) but also came back with two shots of Mezcal. I normally absolutely hate tequila and have never had mezcal so I expected to hate it but I actually loved it! It was so smooth! Amazing food (though very cheesy!), fun atmosphere, absolutely incredible service and staff. Highly recommended!
author: Allison F.

description:
Overall thought their food was great! As a vegetarian, my favorite dishes were in this order: 
1. Pablo avocado taco 
2. Vegetarian flauntas
3. Hand-made corn masa quesadilla 

We tried their Tortilla soup and was not a fan! 

Overall tasty, and veggie friendly! I also love the red salsa that they provide with chips.
author: Darshita M.

description:
**FOUR AND A HALF STARS**

I came here for brunch on a Sunday morning. We were sat at the bar. Service was quite awesome.

My date and I had ordered a-many items on this menu that we were totally stuffed. This included the following:
1) GUACAMOLE: I mean, you can never do no wrong with chips and guac.
2) FRIED BRUSSEL SPROUTS: Good, but not a definite winner
3) PANKO AVOCADO TACO: Although I love avocado, panko deep fried avocados were a little too strange for me.
4) CHICKEN CONFIT 'TINGA' TOSTADA: Delicious -- would definitely recommend this.
5) CARNITAS: We were SO full by the end of the meal, and we totally forgot that we had carnitas as well. I'm sure this would've been amazing if we weren't so full.
author: Joanne W.

description:
The decor of this place is awesome!  It instantly took me back to Jalisco, Mexico.  Service couldn't be better!  and onto the food...

My son had the Tuna Tacon: He said it was really good.  I'm not a tuna person so I didn't want to taste....

We shared the Gorditas.  The gordita part reminded me of the ones my mom makes.  I was not a fan of the bbq beef on top, it was a bit dry for me.

We shared a steak special that they had going on that day, it was pretty good.

I had their Taco Tropical:  They were divine!  I would come back a million times just for that plate alone.  What is really cool about it too is that instead of tortillas they use very thinly sliced jicama, which is a healthier version, but you don't even miss the tortillas.

I can't remember the name of the drink I had but it was like sandia something...watermelon with mezcal, a recommendation from our server and I would get something else next time.

Their portions are small, and meant to share, kind of like tapas.  So, I really liked that we could try lots of different food and you weren't overly stuffed.

I would def come back again!
author: Veronica A.

description:
My last review was for night time bar tapas. This review is for their brunch menu.
First off, the service was fantastic. We tried their sangria which was sweet and they only fill half the glass as shown in the pics I uploaded. It's pretty good but I wish they would serve you a full glass for the price. We then started with the brussel sprouts. good choice for veggies. They were delicious! Then came the tuna tacon which comes in two....also yummy! The shrimp ceviche came wiht chips that complimented the ceviche really well. Their crab croquetas are awesome but very filling. The serving came in four huge pieces :D I also tried their Padrillos 2012 malbec from Argentina. Really tasty! I love this place. I would keep going back :D
author: Pam Y.

description:
I only vaguely remember Lolo since my boyfriend insisted on getting pre dinner drinks at Latin America club beforehand. It was our fourth date and we were still basking in the new relationship (or alcohol-fueled) glow. 

I'm not exactly sure what we ordered but everything was pretty good. The drinks were strong and the ceviche tasted fresh. It was a bit loud but we both enjoyed the lively atmosphere. Check out viracocha next door for some speakeasy fun afterwards!
author: Xinxin W.

description:
Every time I have been in here, I walk out feeling like a new women. Those avocado tacos... what. 

Thank you...

1. To the staff for being so warm and friendly (and not snobby)
2. For having good wines on your menu
3. For not being too busy at 6pm on a Monday
4. For letting my friend and I take our sweet jolly time while gradually ordering tapas
5. For reading my mind when my glass was low
6. For being only walking distance from 24th and Mission Bart
7. For refilling our chips numerous times

And that's all folks. Just go here!!
author: Courtney M.

description: Hipster spot...Ambience should be 4 stars and food 3 stars. Try the crab appetizer, Carne asada and for dessert the Tiramisu.  Waited 1.15 minutes for a table which seemed too long.
author: Cris V.

description:
After struggling to find somewhere with an open kitchen at 10:30pm on a Wednesday night, was fortunate to come across Lolo.

Despite it being late, half the restaurant was still full with folks eating dinners and having drinks at the bar. We were immediately greeted and got started with a mezcal mule and a 1451, both drinks were damn good! Dinner consisted of the carnitas, chicharron, tuna tacon, taco tropical, and the sopes calamary. Every dish was damn tasty although I could have probably ate numerous dishes of the taco tropical and the chicharron! 

On top of the amazing food and drinks, service was top notch and the decor looked like something someone who smoked too much while wandering around in a junk yard in Tijuana, threw together. Awesome......
author: Gino E.

description:
Weekend brunch menu is sublime, the de rigeur entry in the "mission mimosa" contest a grapefruit + cava number that hits the spot, and early evening drinks can be chill while also being delicious. Recommended, be thirsty. 

This is a different concept than the original space (now the daring and delicious Loló Cevichería). Both share an an artful interior design that combines vibrant colors with knolled ready-made materials to maximum visual impact. Service at both has always been agreeable, especially so the front of the house here, at the Valencia location. 

Memorable items include dinner: fish tacos. Brunch: chicken tinga torta.
author: Allonsy A.

description: LOVE this place!! One of my favorite restaurants in SF hands down. The taco tropical is to die for, taco is made out of jicama and is extremely delicious and refreshing. Recommend 100%
author: Natalia G.

description:
My boyfriend and I enjoyed a late lunch at Lolo a while ago and we were very impressed. On a blustery SF day, we were happy to dip into the warmth of Lolo. The decor is really interesting, pictures of dogs everywhere, bright and fun colors, car doors on the wall, blown-up photos of palm trees are just a few of the things that you'll probably notice. We had fantastic, friendly, and quick service and loved our food. We love trying different restaurants whenever we head up to SF from San Jose but recently decided to eat at Lolo again when my bf's sister was in a town - high compliments from us to Lolo! I'm sure we'll be back again. When you've finished your meal, don't forget to stop for a coffee down the street at Ritual Roasters.

The food highlights:

cripsy chilaquiles - fried tortilla chips bathed until tender in salsa, peppers, cotija cheese, queso fresco, and sour cream. Mmmm, so good. Make sure to add eggs for a hearty breakfast (and the perfect hangover cure).

taco tropical - panko crusted shrimp, tropical relish, and and spicy aioli on jicama tacos. Definitely the best thing there!

ceviche - shrimp and rock fish citrus roasted pepper sauce, avocado, corn nuts. Definitely a little more citrusy than I'm used too but super delicious.
author: Kate B.

description: This was taco 5 out of 6 on our taco tour of San Francisco. We ranked this one #2. It's a really cool spot with some retro interior designs. A little more expensive than the authentic taco spots in the neighboring area but I think it's worth it with the atmosphere and the other items offered on the menu (read: tasty Mexican-styled cocktails). This is a spot you should bring your friends for a boozy meal and spend your time enjoying the food and the atmosphere.
author: Hideko T.

description:
I want to like Lolo, I really do. But every time I go in there I feel like I'm not part of the boys club. There's something about the attitude of the staff that makes you feel like you should appreciate them for letting you inside (and not the other way around).

The atmosphere is great, the food delicious and drinks are terrific. But they have this weird transition period where they stop serving drinks and food to prepare for dinner. I understand the prep for dinner, I really do. At least they could keep serving drinks during that transition period.

Overall, I just wish there was less of a sense of arrogance in the air.
author: Raul Q.

description:
It's been 5 days...and every day since, I have been craving Lolo! 

Lolo is a cute, colorful, festive tapas restaurant with both tables/booths and bar seating. You should try to book a reservation in case it's a busy day. Luckily, my friend and I were able to sit at the bar at 7:30, which is actually fine for dining between 2. I liked that we were side to side (felt more intimate). 

I will warn you that everything on their menu sounds so delicious! We shared 5 dishes,1 drink each. If you're very hungry, 5 will be enough and to be honest, you should probably just get 4....

TUNA TACON: Tuna + avocado in a tortilla? Simple but oh so tasty. I thought the sauce pulled it all together (it was almost like a soy or teriyaki sauce) as it added saltiness to your otherwise very refreshing bite. I also liked the tortilla they used. I could snack on these all day! 

EMPANADAS: These might have been my favorite. Just very fresh and cooked perfectly. Soft, flaky bread on the outside with juicy mushrooms and corn inside. Mmm! 

CEVICHE: Maybe a little too acidic (citrus-y, sour) for me BUT I freaking LOVEDDD the corn nuts!!!! It added great crunch and contrasted well against the fresh acidity. I also liked the thin chips that were included. More crunch crunch! Overall, I would totally get this again.

CARNITAS: I have to admit that I think El Techno's carnitas are a bit more flavorful and tender, but Lolo's are still good! Add the pickled onions and guac to your taco. All those flavors will be very satisfying. 

FRESH PRINCE (cocktail): I'm a sucker for cocktails that have egg whites in them. Makes the drink fresh and also adds a heavier consistency. Fresh Prince was refreshing and a bit fruity (citrus) with perfect amount of alcohol. 

I need to come back to try more of their dishes. Or, I might reorder all of the above again! Either way, I'll be a happy gal. 

*Good for friend catching-up or date nights!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Such a fun, hip, and yummy tapas place! I think this might be one of my new favorites in the mission!

We ordered the following:
- White sangria - just what's needed for a super hot night and not too heavy or sugary
- Guacomole with cotija cheese - LOVED, but who hates guacomole?
- Fried brussels sprouts - a definite must. Brussels sprouts were the right amount cooked and SO SO SO good.
- Fried avocado taco - YUM, the avocado was so buttery and all the sauces blended so well together. I even put some of the guac on here cuz you can never have too much avocado :)
- Tropical taco - the taco wrapper is made of jicama so it's gluten free, and besides being super unique, it was also delicious (though the avocado taco was my fave).

Quite busy so make a reservation if you're coming with a big group (or be prepared to sit at the bar).

Yum yum yum!
author: Christina C.

description:
Really good tapas place! I highly recommend it. It is great for dates or large groups. The drinks are super unique.

The ambiance is great and the decorations try to depict an old fashioned/unique art.

I would suggest getting the guacamole with queso fresco, the crab croquetas, lamb sliders, and of course you can't go wrong with the taco tropical.
author: Kunal T.

description:
I would give Lolo 3.5 stars-mainly due to service. 

Food is pretty good, our group shared a bunch of plates from the guacamole to the queso dip to the lamb sliders to the kale salad to the grilled corn and a couple more I can't remember right now. Everything was good but nothing blew me away.  Cocktails were very good. Service was terrible which is why I'm rounding down to the 3 stars.
author: Nicole S.

description:
Went here for some late night tapas on a Friday night and surprisingly there was no wait. I love eating at tapas style restaurants since it gives me a chance to try a little bit everything.

My friend and I were not too hungry so we just decided to get:
-Tuna Tacon: it was good but worth $11 dollars for two tacos? no. I don't really even eat that much but i literally finished my taco in two bites. Overpriced. 
-Some sort of pork belly dish.: I dont really remember it..the portion for this made up for that taco but all I remember tasting was a lot of lime juice in this. Was whatever. Didn't care for it.


Service was actually really good and attentive. I do want to go back and try more stuff.. This place is 3.5 stars.
author: Phuong K.

description: You must try the Taco Tropical - it was one of the best tacos I've ever had. It contains shrimp and panko on a jicama tortilla - a thinly sliced Mexican vegetable. We had also ordered the guacamole/chips and the carnitas. I wasn't really blown away by the carnitas, it lacked a lot of flavor in my opinion and was a bit dry. Overall, it's a place you must come see. I loved the decor and their amazing customer service - everyone is very welcoming and attentive.
author: Karen C.

description:
My friends and I came here for a quick dinner on a Monday evening, and it was packed. Seriously, if a restaurant has a 1-hour wait time on a Monday, you know you've found a happening spot!

We ordered the taco tropical, tuna tacon, brussel sprouts, and ceviche. Oh...my...gluttony...the taco tropical?!?! I never thought I'd enjoy eating a daikon as a tortilla -- much less, crave it -- but now I know. Everything in the taco tropical was so well-balanced, light, and flavorful, that I can understand why it's the main hit on the menu. The brussel sprouts were slightly charred and accompanied with toasted chickpeas and sauteed onions, and the portion was large enough that we couldn't even finish it. The ceviche was also excellent. The tuna tacon tacos featured a meaty slab of tuna tartare that tasted on par with other restaurants in SF, but it wasn't as mindblowingly good as the other dishes we ordered. 

The ambience is playful and inviting, just like the food. Excellent service. We'll be back, especially to get more of that delicious taco tropical!
author: Shar S.

description:
Trendy, loud ambiance with good selection of small plates. Would make a reservation or plan to wait 40-60 min. 

For two people three small plates seems to be the right number. We ordered four and between those and the complimentary chips and salsa had too much to eat. Not a terrible problem though since leftover carnitas and corn tortillas make a tasty breakfast. 

In addition to the carnitas we had, in descending order of our favorites, the tuna tacon (an ahi steak taco with a smoky sauce), mushroom and cheese empanadas, and fried Brussels sprouts.
author: Andrew S.

description: A great place! I loved the food there (tried 4 different things on the menu) and their tiramisu is to die for. The drinks are good (although a little bit pricey) and the ambience is super cool. They also take reservations but if you don't get one, they will text you when your table is ready. Our wait time was around 30-40 minutes on a Friday night which isn't too bad. There are a lot of delicious veggie/fish dishes on the menu so definitely a plus for vegetarians. I will definitely come back!
author: Kasia R.

description: If I could give this place 10 stars, I would. When someone from out of town asks where they should eat that won't break the bank but has a good SF flavor, my go-to answer is Lolo. In this last two years, I've probably been here about 15 - 20 times. I've had about everything on the menu, but standouts are: tuna tacon (so creamy and decadent) and the taco tropical (wow, the flavors). Also the drinks here are TDF: go see Leon (pronounced "Lay-Own" not "Lee-On") at the bar because he's that authentic. He deserves the respect he garners in the industry. When bartenders go out for drinks, they get drinks by Leon.
author: Patricia L.

description: Free chips and salsa! Great atmosphere too! Came here for brunch right when they opened so had so issues getting seated. The huevos rancheros were delicious. Beef tacos were good too but a little small. The mimosas were a bit expensive but a great size and complimented with a slice of grapefruit.
author: Kelsey M.

description:
Tropical Taco with mango, friend shrimp and daikon wrap is amazing! 
The amount was not much but it was perfect if not too hungry or paired with appetizers.
We also had the delicious guac which was quite a decent amount.
Drinks are too expensive though, $4 for a narrow glass of tea or soda filled with ice. (Especially the soda comes with the can)
author: Amy K.

description: Very good Tapas! Or should I say muy bien. After a 12-hour flight, we chose Lolo to refresh our stomachs. Great ambience yet not too crowded on a Friday night. Drinks were good. Food was on point. Tried Taco Tropical, Tuna Tacon, Guacamole, and the Crab Croquetas.
author: Bob W.

description:
This place really is as good as it gets folks. My fella and I have been a few times and are always so, so pleased. My favorite starter is the brussels sprouts  - perfectly flavored and even more wonderful when you drizzle them with the salsa verde you get with chips, favorite entree is the avocado panco tacos - OMG. I would die for this taco. Really, I would. My fella is GF and as an added perf they have a ton of GF options. He got the tostada and was also very pleased!

We are loyal Lolo customers!! Also I had a jasmine infused gin and tonic that I wish had a tad more jasmine flavor but was otherwise stupendous.
author: Sonia M.

description:
WOW I loved this meal. 

Started off with the SANGRIA -- best sangria I've ever had and it was because of the poppy liquor. It gave it a hint of rose, like a rose tea. I loved every sip. But it could've been a lot stronger (in terms of alc) -- my friend and I both loved our drinks but thought they were a bit weak. 

Then the TACOS -- taco tropical and tuna tacon. Taco tropical is a great shrimp taco that is so soft I thought it was fish, and wonderfully light and flavorful because of the daikon radish rather than a tortilla. The tuna tacon was also delicious -- more savory but a good pairing with the taco tropical. The tacos are a must here -- their flavor complexity is on point. 

Finally I ordered the lamb sliders and my friend the empanadas. We liked both but definitely thought the tacos stole the show. Lamb sliders were a bit too savory in my opinion -- but the addition of the jalapeño peppers was a nice balance. What I will say is this was by far the most filling dish, so if you come with someone who's concerned they won't be full order this one! It comes with a nice side of shoestring fries too :)

10/10 will def come again. Great food, great drinks, and wonderful service. :)

P.S. Make a reservation on Yelp -- super easy and it works!
author: Lucy W.

description:
Hip spot in the mission with eccentric decor that somehow comes together with its all over disjointedness. 

We ordered the taco tropical, tuna tacon, and carnitas. While the taco tropical gets points for being photogenic, the fried fish and heavy mayonnaise did not taste as inventive as they looked. However, we were pleasantly surprised by the tuna tacon which had fish coated with soy sauce and almost tasted like Asian/Mexican fusion. The carnitas were also solid and filling, although I wish the serving of guac on the side was more generous. 

I'd be back to try more of their tapas!
author: Angela H.

description: Love the decor. Any place that has a baller Norteño Maneki-Neko parked near the restroom, gets bonus points to start with. We started with the guac, which tasted freshly made and was sprinkled with cotija cheese. Good way to open up our taste buds. For my entree, I had the panko-crusted avocado, topped with spicy aioli, cilantro, tropical relish+side of picked onions. My taste buds exploded. I could've had ten of those tacos! Our waiter was nice and attentive. We will be back, for sure!
author: Gabriela W.

description:
We went here because we couldn't get a reservation at Foreign Cinema, but wow! we found a gem! 
It was Saturday lunch time- so the menu consisted of brunch and lunch items. Four of us got shrimp taco, two benedicts (forgot which one) and avocado samdwich thing.. 
All of them were great! Only downside is that the portion is not big. For me, it was just enough- but might not be the case for all.

But the best was their BLOODY MARY! 
I usually don't like any bloody mary, but this one was really good.
I would recommend to anyone!
author: Sora B.

description:
The service could be a little better, but if you get a chance to get a table here, the food will definitely be worth it.

I have been here twice--once, I got in late with my sister, and the bartender was a little rude, pretty much was trying to get rid of us to close the place.

Second time I got here, I got a table in the back and was excited to try out their food. The fan on the ceiling above my table was excruciating, the flickering light gave me a headache almost instantly. I was glad the waiter gave us a new seat after I pointed out the issue, and the night kept on.

The food was delicious, just the right combination with the right spice. The price was steep, but can't expect otherwise in the Mission, so I was ok with it. 

The check was off, so I had to wait for a while until they fixed it and got me to sign a new check. The waiter couldn't do the fix so we had to wait for the manager.
author: Zorayr K.

description:
I came here for a dinner with a friend. It's a cool place, a bit hipster, but nice looking place.

The food is great, but they're small portions since they are tapas. It is a bit pricey as well. So I advise to go with a group and order a little bit of everything and split the bill.

It's totally hipster, American fusion version of tapas. If you like fancy food, its great, but if you're looking for authentic, go somewhere else.

The fish tacos were great along with the beef tacos as well. Everything looked really good and tasty. 

Plus for the the ambience and decorations in the restaurant, its cute.
author: Courtney F.

description: The food was amazing! We had the fish tacos, tacos tropical, and beef tacos with a big bowl of guacamole! So good. Margaritas and a super unusual, but addictive cider rounded out the meal. We had a reservation which enabled us to walk right in and be seated. We received great, responsive service!!
author: Arlene H.

description:
This would be a five star review if the service was better. We came in on a Friday night and business was bustling. We ate at the bar and the bartenders were busy making drinks so we didn't get the best service. The bartender gave us a round of shots to save face after dinner. 

All the food here is good and the drink menu  is very unique. Almost every drink has a signature glass or cup. 

Fish tacos. Tropical tacos. Avocado tacos. Order all of em.
author: Mikey S.

description: great great spot! perhaps an under-rated, overlooked gem...wait who am I kidding this place seems to be getting really popular and it is so deserved. Everything we ordered was fantastic and perfectly flavored. Some of my favorites include: fried brussel sprouts, masa quesadillas, empanadas, gorditas and the floutas. I really have to come back here more often...if I lived in the mission I would make this a weekly spot.
author: Derek S.

description: Vibrant atmosphere, delicious food, and tasty cocktails. I think my favorites were the lamb sliders, meat is cooked perfectly and the sauce makes the even better. The tuna and shrimp tacos are also good. I had the fresh prince cocktail, loved it
author: Shannon J.

description:
Overall: Food is great, but the portions are tiny. Definitely tapas sized plates, with dinner sized pricing. One person could easily have 3 "dinners" by themselves. 

We got the: 
- Guacomole: good and chunky, but very citrus-y.
- EMPANADAS: soooo good. every bite just had a great balance of flavour, and there's nothing ordinary about it. 
- PANKO AVOCADO TACO: delicious!!! I could eat these all day long. 
- CEVICHE and TACO TROPICAL: my friends loved it, but since it's not veg, I didn't taste it

I'd go back, but not on a day I'm super hungry :)
author: Dimple B.

description:
Walking into Lolo's you're immediately greeted by a host. A fun sized, adorable Latin American woman with a thick but very satisfying accent. 

We were told that we were supposed to wait an hour because there were a lot of people ahead of us. The weird part is, that I was okay with the wait because she was telling me, (LOL).

We killed an hour and got drunk at the bar across the block, but saved our appetite for some tasty food. 

We ordered the beef tacos, flautas, tropical tacos, chips, guac and drinks. The food was delicious, but the vibe and energy throughout the restaurant was so much fun that It was a party on its own. Spanish music blasting in the back and nothing but smiling faces throughout the restaurant. 

Leaving the restaurant disappointed me because I live in Los Angeles, If they had one here, I'd be there every other day. 

Cheers to you Lolo!
author: Andy M.

description:
